Description:
JOB OVERVIEW: 
 
 Capital Insurance Group is seeking a candidate to join our Analytics Department. We look to partner with a candidate who fits with the CIG culture, excels as a decision enabler, and can effectively collect and communicate results to key stakeholders. Projects assigned will come from multiple insurance disciplines with a focus on analytics. 
 
 RESPONSIBILITIES: 
 
 As a Data Analyst, you will gain industry expertise in analytics, as well as lead your own analyses under the supervision of seasoned data analysts. To be successful in the role, you will need to have good business judgement and enjoy finding and creatively solving complex business issues. 
 Story Telling  – Demonstrate experience working with data visualization. Developing and deploying effective dashboards and other data communication will be fundamental to success. You will be responsible for fully understanding department-specific needs, identifying and producing robust, intuitive solutions that enable decisionmakers. 
 Collaboration  – Work directly with internal stakeholders to effectively launch analytics solutions across the organization. Success will be measured by the ability to effectively integrate analytics solutions into existing workflows and achieve buy-in from all parties, ultimately translating into improved financial performance.
 Dataset Architecture  – All valuable analyses start with quality data. You will be responsible for compiling relevant data from multiple internal databases, utilizing alternative data for validation, and clearly documenting your process. 
 Automation  – Complete recurring reporting responsibilities with an emphasis on automation and creating efficiency. 
 Education  – Actively pursue continued education development opportunities. You will have access to several continuing education programs offered through CIG including analytics and data science training. CIG also supports travel to conferences that offer career development opportunities are available. 
 Advanced Analytics  – Understand and implement predictive modeling and machine learning techniques (e.g. regression, classification, clustering) and how they apply in insurance. You will be responsible for learning and understanding techniques used, explaining validation metrics, identifying optimal models, etc. 
 Leadership  – You will have opportunities to work on highly visible projects. You will have considerable freedom to pitch ideas and change the status quo. 
 MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: 
 
 Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative or scientific field 
 0-2 years of analytics experience required 
 Experience using SQL and a comprehensive understanding of relational databases 
 Knowledge of Python, R, or other statistical software 
 Proficiency in Microsoft Excel 
 Property & Casualty insurance experience is a plus 
 Predictive modeling experience is a plus 
 Experience with Tableau or other data visualization software is a plus 
 
 Skills necessary to succeed: 
 Communication  – Ability to explain technical analysis to business partners and management, whether in person, in front of a conference room, or through a dashboard. 
 Strong Work Ethic  – Must be results oriented, prioritize work to meet deadlines 
 Quantitative Aptitude  – Ability to apply analytical and statistical concepts to develop business solutions 
 Adaptability  – Has the entrepreneurial spirit to be successful in a dynamic, changing environment and comfortable embracing new technologies 
 Team Player  – Establish working relationships, foster teamwork and cooperation with others 
 
 Why CIG? 
 We are a small team with strong support from company leadership 
 Opportunity to make an immediate and considerable impact to the success of the company 
 Opportunity to expose multiple disciplines within the company to analytics 
 We are interested in growing and promoting from within so we have an interest in growing your skills 
 CIG writes a diverse property-focused portfolio across the Western United States 
 Entrepreneurial environment emphasizes creative solutions and cooperation

Title: Data Analyst I - St. Louis, MO 63105 - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Description Summary 
Job Description 
Be part of something bigger! 
BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world and is advancing the world of health by improving medical discovery, diagnostics and the delivery of care. We have over 65,000 employees and a presence in virtually every country around the world to address some of the most challenging global health issues. 
Role will involve developing new (and enhancing existing) automated programs in Excel VBA, pulling and pushing data to our other business systems. Secondarily there will be analysis work developing and launching numerous tracking dashboards for the business to use. 
Primary Duties and Responsibilities 
We have several transactional processes that we would like to automate within our manufacturing plants at shipping, receiving, manufacturing order manipulation, scrap transactions, etc. 
This individual may work with existing code that needs enhancing as well as develop code from scratch. 
This will be a hands-on role where the person will be expected to first understand the business and operational processes in detail through observation and interview and then work through the development and testing of the developed applications, including producing any necessary work instructions for the programs. 
There will also be opportunity to enhance and develop various dashboards, tracking different critical key performance indicators for the manufacturing plants such as inventory status, output metrics, capacity planning data, etc. that will be used by the business to assist in strategic and tactical production planning. 
Education Requirements 
At least 2 years of course work completed in a bachelor’s degree program for business analytics/engineering or similar experience in data analytics/programming 
Baseline Skill Expectations 
Excellent Excel VBA coding skills in MS Excel, not limited to macros, pivot tables, array management, data manipulation, power query, error handling, debugging and deployment 
Meticulous coding discipline and documentation 
Technical and logical capability to solve problems 
Must be able to coordinate and manage multiple projects simultaneously 
Excellent interpersonal, communication and writing skills 
Ability to work independently and efficiently with minimal oversight required 
A curious nature and a desire to improve 
Demonstrate strong knowledge of Windows operating systems 
Knowledge of database development and maintenance using Microsoft SQL Server 
Strong knowledge of Excel, Visio, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint 
Willingness and desire to learn new operations 
Excellent attendance and punctuality 
Be willing and available to occasionally work a flexible schedule 
2023 graduation or sooner pursuing a degree in Economics, Business Administration, Finance, Data Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Industrial/Systems Engineering or related disciplines 
Interest in analytics, process optimization, manufacturing operations; prior experience a plus 
Strong analytical, problem-solving, listening, and interpersonal skills; High attention to detail while multi-tasking on complex deliverables 
In order to qualify for this position, you must be legally authorized to work in the United States without restriction as to duration. 
For many roles at BD, employment is contingent upon the Company’s receipt of sufficient proof that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. In some locations, weekly testing for COVID-19 may be available instead of vaccination. Consistent with BD’s Workplace Accommodations Policy, requests for accommodation will be considered pursuant to applicable law. 
Why join us? 
A career at BD means being part of a team that values your opinions and contributions and that empowers you to bring your authentic self to work. Here our associates can fulfill their life’s purpose through the work that they do every day. 
You will learn and work alongside inspirational leaders and colleagues who are equally passionate and committed to fostering an inclusive, growth-centered, and rewarding culture. Our Total Rewards program — which includes competitive pay, benefits, continuous learning, recognition, career growth, and life balance components — is designed to support the varying needs of our diverse and global associates.

Title: Junior Data Analytics Analyst - Houston, TX 77002 - Indeed.com
Description:
Join our Business Operational Risk Management (BORM) team as a Junior Data Analytics Analyst. 
 
In this role, you will be working with our BORM Supervision and Conduct team, supporting our Commodities and Global Markets group across the globe. As primary support for our front office supervision and conduct programs, you will take ownership and accountability for developing reporting and analytic solutions and will play an essential role in tagging, organizing, evaluating and presenting data regarding conduct and MI related to supervision in the front office. 
 
You will have the opportunity to support ad-hoc and project work utilizing PowerBI and Excel as well as communicate with internal business stakeholders to document requirements and extract data from our database using SQL queries. You will independently apply your superior problem-solving ability to identify meaningful insights that drive business growth. Further, you will own and drive continuous improvement in the data and analytics capabilities of the business channel. 
 
You will be highly qualitative with an exceptional level of accuracy and attention to detail. You will thrive on solving complex problems and will have a strategic approach to your thinking. You will exhibit strong time management, organization and prioritization skills coupled with a proven ability to multitask and shift your focus across tasks as directed. In addition, you will have strong verbal and written communication skills and can engage with internal stakeholders and partners in other support groups. Collaborative mindset is important, and you should enjoy working in a team environment. 
 
In this role, proficiency in data analytics tools, MS PowerPoint, Excel and PowerBI is desired. 
 
If you are looking for an exciting opportunity to further your career and be part of a dynamic and supportive team, then we would love to hear from you. 
 
About Commodities and Global Markets 
 
Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated, end-to-end offering across global markets including equities, fixed income, foreign exchange and commodities. 
 
Our COVID-19 policy 
 
The health and wellbeing of our employees is a priority. We continue to focus on providing a safe workplace for our people, our stakeholders and those who visit us, and are committed to contributing to the safety of the communities where we live and work. 
 
In line with evolving health regulations and many of our industry peers, we require all Macquarie employees in the United States to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof of full vaccination in order to attend the office and to participate in external meetings and business travel, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. 
 
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion 
 
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and an inclusive workplace enables us to embrace that diversity to deliver more innovative and sustainable solutions for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. At Macquarie, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If you're inspired to deliver on our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’, we want you on our team. If you need adjustments made to the recruitment process, please reach out to your recruiter. 
 
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, marital status, gender identity or any other impermissible criterion or circumstance. Macquarie also takes affirmative action in support of its policy to hire and advance in employment of individuals who are minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. 
 
We equip our people with the support to work in a range of flexible ways. Talk to us about what working arrangements would help you thrive. 
 
#LI-DS1 
 
 
 About Macquarie 
 A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. 
 Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 16,000+ employees and offices in 32 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation. 
 You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference. 
 Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Title: Energy Analyst I - Data Access - New York, NY 10005 - Indeed.com
Description:
Energy Analyst I – Data Access 
Reports To: Manager of Measurement – Data Access 
Location: New York, NY 
Bright Power has been a transformative player in clean energy and sustainable buildings since 2004. We believe a meaningful difference in climate change will only be realized if it is easy for building owners to make their buildings better. 
 
Our approach is simple: we find energy and water problems in buildings, we fix them, and we follow up to make sure the solutions worked. Behind the scenes, our unique combination of software, analytics, engineering, and contracting makes it all happen. If you have a can-do problem-solving attitude and are excited to join a company of the brightest minds working on energy and water in buildings, then apply to join our team! 
Join Us 
Bright Power is comprised of a team of diverse, talented, and hard-working individuals committed to growing this industry and making a positive impact on the environment. We are passionate about reducing energy and water usage by implementing energy efficiency and renewable energy technologies. Our goal is to improve the health, comfort, and value of our client’s buildings, while cultivating a sustainable future. We believe deeply in doing well by doing good and come to work every day seeking to change the world. 
The Role 
The Strategic Initiatives Business Unit of Bright Power is seeking a collaborative, organized, and detail-oriented individual to join our Access Team. Bright Power works with property owners who have loans through the Fannie Mae Green Loan program and helps them meet their utility data reporting requirements. Access Team members identify and request specific forms of data access depending on diverse utility company requirements. 
The Data Access Energy Analyst’s main role is preparing customized requests and documents, implementing a large-scale phone and email campaign, and collecting and reviewing utility data. This position plays a crucial role in ensuring the success of the entire program. 
Primary Responsibilities 
Manage the progress of and maintain relationships with large groups of Borrowers 
Identify outstanding data needs and customize requests to streamline Borrower experience and fulfill diverse utility company requirements 
Manage a high volume of calls, emails, and other tasks to collect utility authorization forms, logins, bill scans, data exports, etc. in a timely manner 
Conduct quality assurance of utility information received from external clients 
Accurately log access information in Bright Power systems to be used by other teams and processes 
Maximize the use of logins wherever possible as the preferred utility data access method 
Collaborate with team members to improve workflow processes 
Other duties as needed, such as: 
Research and document utility company policies for data release 
Request data from utility companies 
Facilitate account-level utility data integration to our benchmarking system 
Skills/Qualifications 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills & comfort speaking on the phone regularly with clients 
Ability to stay organized across a high volume of concurrent assignments 
Strong attention to detail 
Creative and proactive problem-solving abilities 
Collaboration in team-oriented environment by sharing ideas and open feedback 
Preferred Qualifications 
Experience in the energy efficiency, renewable energy, real estate, sustainability, or building operations world 
Experience with cloud-based CRM platforms, e.g. Salesforce 
Proficiency in MS Excel (data manipulation and basic formulas) 
Experience with utility bill data, data analysis, or building performance metrics 
Experience with Energy Star Portfolio Manager, especially for Multifamily Buildings and Commercial 
Benefits 
In addition to working with incredible people, Bright Power offers competitive benefits. Find the list of our benefits offered on our careers home page 
COVID Vaccination Policy 
As of September 1st, Bright Power will require employees to demonstrate proof of vaccination to work in our offices and/or perform on-site visits. In accordance with state and federal laws, Bright Power will allow for medical and religious exemptions from the vaccine requirement. 
EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES
 
 Bright Power provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Bright Power complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation  and  training. 
Bright Power expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Bright Power’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

Title: Product Data Analyst - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
HouseCanary is creating a more efficient real estate marketplace, where its trusted property valuations help consumers and investors enjoy a frictionless experience in buying, financing, and improving their homes. By working directly with institutional investors, HouseCanary already powers more than $200 million in real estate transactions each month. Through partnerships with leading financial institutions, HouseCanary’s ComeHome platform will enable consumers to close on more than $100 billion of real estate transactions this year. HouseCanary recently raised $65M in Series C funding as our team continues our hyper-growth. Founded in 2013, HouseCanary has built its reputation on developing unique analytics for the $30.7 trillion residential real estate market, based on big data and refined through machine learning. By combining this technology with its nationwide brokerage, HouseCanary is uniquely positioned to connect investors and consumers alike to the information that they care most about in an effort to modernize and streamline the home buying and home ownership process. 
We're seeking a passionate Product Analyst to help support our HouseCanary Solutions team, which focuses on large institutions and enterprise customers. By helping us surface actionable, data-driven insights, our Product Analyst will help us drive decision making and will be a core member of our Product team. If you love to wrangle data from multiple sources, unearth hidden insights through intuitive visualizations, drive revenue, and communicate your findings across the entire company, then we would love to talk to you. 
 What you'll do 
Partner and learn from our existing Data Analysis team to help drive business outcomes and support our clients 
Be the owner of product analytics and provide insightful business reporting to the company 
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis to unearth data-driven insights and drive decision making 
Synthesize complex analyses into concise summaries with actionable recommendations 
Partner closely with our Product, Sales, and Finance teams to influence planning and prioritization 
Document, maintain, and extend analytics for our core products and platform 
sSupport the team and help manage the end-to-end product analytics process. 
Create data visualizations and Tableau dashboards to help the team remain focused on our most important KPIs 
 What you have

Working knowledge of Python (including pandas and numpy) or R 
Demonstrated proficiency with SQL and/or Amazon Redshift 
Experience presenting data through visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.)General comprehension of data pipelines and warehouses 
A willingness to roll up your sleeves to help achieve team goals 
 Genuine curiosity and an overall passion for data analysis 
Strong oral and written communication skills 
 Special consideration given for 
Existing familiarity with Redshift and Tableau 
Experience leveraging external analytics platforms such as Heap, Mixpanel, and Google Analytics 
Experience or interest in real estate 
A fantastic sense of humor! 
 We strongly encourage people of color, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, and individuals with disabilities to apply. The Risk Analyst will provide data management and analytic support to Risk and Litigation leaders. POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Responsibilities include, but not limited to: Utilize multiple computational languages, platforms and environments to mine and manage data in preparation for analysis and/or reporting Create new and recurring reports (Excel, Tableau) ,including but not limited to monthly loss runs and reports for senior leadership and finance, as needed Provide monthly analysis of litigation program – using data from various sources Create system for managing/tracking Incident Reports (IRs) in anticipation of litigation and for claim handling Create efficiencies through data automation Create internal and external presentations Structure analytic plans that comprehensively address clinical questions and provide a structured methodology and approach for analysis Aptitude for seeing and understanding the big picture in addition to crunching the numbers Demonstrated ability to “think strategically” by blending data analysis with developing insights from the data Partner with clinical subject matter experts and operational leadership to identify key clinical questions that can be answered using data to drive clinical goals and objectives Other duties as assigned DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE  Legal Analyst, Paralegal, or Legal Coordinator background highly preferred 3+ years of relevant experience Possesses strong communication skills, both written and oral Knowledge of SQL, Excel (lookups, pivot tables, VBA, Visio, etc.), and other reporting tools “Self-starter” who is passionate about continuously improving Ability to work effectively in a highly collaborative team environment Strong sense of accountability; provides actionable and timely support Demonstrated strengths in organizational skills, attention-to-detail, follow-through, analytical, reasoning, critical thinking, ambiguous assignments, and problem solving skills Radiology Partners is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in creating and celebrating a culture of belonging and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all teammates. Title: Data Analyst - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
As a member of the Data Team, you will support every area of Scott's Cheap Flights by using data and analytics to answer questions and solve problems. You will partner with the Sr. Data Analyst to validate data and improve data flow through efficiencies. You will help modernize the data tech stack and bring maturity to the data and analytics discipline at SCF. 
 
 
In the short term: 
Learn the data ecosystem and flow through 
Learn the data structures and systems existing and in process 
Begin to engage with existing reporting 
 In the long term, you will: 
Field, clearly define, and prioritize data requests from stakeholders 
Build and maintain dashboards and reports 
Provide training for new employees on data at SCF 
 What you know: 
1-5+ years experience working for a technology, consumer, SaaS, or subscription business 
Knowledge of the financial levers of success for technology, consumer, SaaS, or subscription business 
A deep and abiding love of working with advanced SQL every day. 
Professional experience setting expectations with stakeholders, prioritizing work, and pushing back on stakeholders 
Professional experience engaging stakeholders to understand questions and business problems 
Ability to clearly and concisely present complex findings and provide actionable solutions to stakeholders 
Several years of experience using advanced functionality of a visualization platform (any platform) 
Preferred : 
Experience with some members of our tech stack, which includes: Fivetran, Segment, dbt, BigQuery, Zoho Analytics, Google Analytics, Notion, GitHub, Slack 
Concentrated experience in financial analytics, product analytics, mobile app data 
Experience auditing data flow for accuracy, integrity, and quality 
 Why you might love working here: 
100% remote work environment, so go ahead and bring your dog to work or wear your PJ's to the office! 
Open vacation policy, with a 3 week minimum! 
Comprehensive health, vision, and dental insurance 
401(k) with a 5% match 
Up to 12-weeks of paid family leave 
Meetup meals when you cross paths with a co-worker 
Continuing education & development reimbursement 
Yearly team retreat (In 2021, we went to Los Cabos in Mexico) 
Challenging problems to solve and an awesome team to collaborate with every single day 
 We want you to bring your authentic self to work every single day. We accept you for who you are and consider everyone on an equal opportunity basis without regard to ancestry; age; appearance; color; gender identity and/or expression; genetics; family or parental status; marital, civil union, or domestic partnership status; mental, physical, or sensory disability; national, social or ethnic origin; past or present military service; sexual orientation; socioeconomic status; race; religion or belief.

Title: Data Analyst - Longmont, CO - Indeed.com
Description:
12/8/2021 
 
 
About ABC Legal Services: 
 
ABC Legal Service is proud to be the national leader in filing service of legal documents. We are growing and are looking for talented new team members to support our growth and solve exciting challenges! 
 
We are a team of 350 with offices in Los Angeles, Dallas, Miami, Brooklyn, Chicago, Washington DC, and more. Seattle is our home and headquarters. We've been successful in this unique business for over 30 years and we continue to advance our technology and business processes to remain years ahead of what our competition is able to offer. 
 
Location: 
 
This position is open to candidates currently living in the Seattle, WA and Denver (Longmont) CO metro areas. We are not accepting applications from remote or relocating candidates at this time. 
 
Job Overview: 
 
The Data Analyst role provides data analytics to ABC Legal Services leadership and employees. Analytics duties include data extraction from our Postgres database, providing reports on data extractions, analyzing data to create insights, creating Metabase visualizations and reports as needed, and identifying issues/problems/opportunities with data collection and storage. The role may ultimately offer opportunities to practice advanced skills such as predictive analytics/ML, database administration, and software development. 
 
Salary Range:  $55K-70K depending on experience 
 
.**No remote options** 
 
Key Responsibilities: 
 
 Generate Metabase reports and charts using GUI query builder and native SQL 
 Query our database directly as needed to address specific company and employee needs 
 Acquire increasing familiarity with the structure and content of our large (400 table) production database 
 Proactively test the validity and cleanliness of data, and suggest appropriate fixes 
 
 
Qualifications: 
 
 Bachelors Degree and minimum 1 year of relevant experience required 
 1 years or more experience working with PostgreSQL or another RDBMS in a professional or academic capacity 
 Ability to interface with clients to provide excellent Customer Service and explain technical/statistical concepts to non-technical people 
 Ability to understand and apply basic statistics concepts, such as probability distributions and hypothesis tests 
 
 
Competitive candidates may additionally possess one or more of the below: 
 
 Advanced statistics skills 
 Experience with predictive models/ML/AI 
 Advanced data visualization proficiency in a library like ggplot or seaborn, or BI software such as Tableau 
 Experience with the AWS ecosystem of products and solutions 
 
 
Benefits/Perks: 
 
 At ABC Legal, we have a small tech department with a culture that makes it easy to learn new skills, take on new roles, and have your voice heard by upper management 
 Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage 
 401(k) retirement plan with 5% matching 
 PTO and 10 paid holidays per year

Title: Data Analyst - Mountain View, CA - Indeed.com
Description:
XPeng Motors  is one of China's leading smart electric vehicle ("EV") companies. We design, develop, manufactures and market smart EVs that are seamlessly integrated with advanced Internet, AI and autonomous driving technologies. We are committed to in-house R&D and intelligent manufacturing to create a better mobility experience for our customers. We strive to transform smart electric vehicles with technology and data, shaping the mobility experience of the future. 
 
As a data engineer, your role is to work closely with other engineers and annotators to provide a steady flow of diverse, high-quality data to our deep learning algorithms, which is the key to our success as a data-driven company. 
 
Responsibilities: 
 
 Learn to write scripting language queries to find hard cases in our massive dataset 
 Analyze datasets with our in-house tool and provide weekly reports about data composition 
 Get familiar with concepts in deep learning in order to make better annotation guidelines when facing edge cases 
 Work with engineers to improve the process for data collection, data mining and annotation. 
 
 Requirements: 
 
 Bachelor's degree or above 
 Passionate about technology and willing to learn new things quickly 
 Excellent communication skills 
 Great work ethics, responsible and reliable 
 
 Good to have: 
 
 1+ year industrial experience in the related field. 
 Some prior experience with scripting languages like python 
 
   What do we provide: 
 
 A fun, supportive and engaging environment. 
 Opportunities to pursue and work on cutting edge technologies. 
 Competitive salary. 
 Snacks, lunches and fun activities. 
 
 We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status or marital status or any other prescribed category set forth in federal or state regulations.

Title: Data Analyst (START DATE JANUARY 2022) - Southfield, MI 48075 - Indeed.com
Description:
SUMMARY:
  Responsible for collecting, analyzing, and maintaining data and information to support performance management related to the CMS Star Ratings program. This includes monthly dashboard reporting, evaluating trends and projecting performance, and explaining performance data to clients and leadership. Position requires extensive experience working with Excel, and willingness to learn PowerBI.
 RESPONSIBILITIES/TASKS:
 Develops documentation, reports and presentations for all levels within the organization including executive leadership.
 Responsible for trend analysis, report development, ad-hoc analysis and support
 Develop and present complex analytics concisely for consumption by upper management and Executive leadership
 Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously by establishing project plans and objectives to ensure goal attainment within defined parameters
 Compile data from a variety of sources and conduct analytics using software including Excel, PowerBI, Oracle (SQL) and SAS to support business decisions
 Knowledge and experience with Medicare Advantage Stars and/or HEDIS data is a plus
 Ensures complete, accurate and timely data for reporting purposes. 
 This position description identifies the responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the performance of the position. Other relevant essential functions may be required. 
 EMPLOYMENT QUALIFICATIONS:
 EDUCATION:
 Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Health Care, Information Systems, Statistics or a related field. Master’s Degree in Public Health, Epidemiology or other related field preferred. Continuous learning, as defined by the Company’s learning philosophy, is required. Certification or progress toward certification is highly preferred and encouraged. 
 EXPERIENCE:
 Five (5) years of experience in a related field required to provide the necessary knowledge, skills, and abilities for the role. 
 SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITIES (SKA) REQUIRED:
 Strong communication skills are required to understand, interpret, and communicate ideas.
 Strong knowledge and use of existing software packages (PowerPoint, Excel, Word, etc.).
 Strong knowledge of data languages such as SAS or SQL
 Strong analytical, organizational, planning, and problem-solving skills.
 Ability to effectively interface with employees at all levels.
 Other related skills and/or abilities may be required to perform this job.
 Administer and adhere to corporate and departmental policies, practices and procedures. 
 WORKING CONDITIONS:
 Work is performed in an office setting with no unusual hazards. 
 The qualifications listed above are intended to represent the minimum education, experience, skills, knowledge and ability levels associated with performing the duties and responsibilities contained in this job description. 
 We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity is valued and we will not tolerate discrimination or harassment in any form. Candidates for the position stated above are hired on an "at will" basis. Nothing herein is intended to create a contract.

Title: DATA ANALYST, DTC (REMOTE) - Seattle, WA 98104 - Indeed.com
Description: Paula’s Choice is Your Right Choice! Paula’s Choice Skincare is a multinational brand that is 26 years strong! Our vision is to empower and enable people around the world with highly effective products and in-depth knowledge to achieve their own definition of beautiful. We question ingredients, follow the facts and stand up for the customer, because we’re in this journey together. Paula’s Choice is committed to diversity! Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. We hope you agree. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for empowering people to achieve their own definition of beautiful, Paula’s Choice could be a wonderful fit for you. What we offer you: A robust benefits package including health, vision, dental, retirement and more Transportation stipend, gym membership and more Product samples and discounts Generous PTO Great location – we’re in the heart of Seattle’s beautiful International District Exceptional environment – we work hard and celebrate our accomplishments. You might catch our teams riding the Seattle Ducks, at Mariner’s games or connecting at happy hours Did we mention we’re a dog-friendly office? How you’ll have an impact at Paula’s Choice: This position is responsible for management of consumer data, analyzing data and developing dashboards and insights to drive strategic business decisions. As a Data Analyst, a typical day might include a mix of the following: Interpreting data to formulate customer insights to drive strategic business goals Collecting and verifying data from multiple sources and platforms and combine data into usable data structures Collaborating with various teams to answer business questions while prioritizing high-value analysis Building out reporting dashboards in Microsoft PowerBI Maintenance and verification of data collection tools Contribution to the development and optimization of an in-house attribution model Other responsibilities as assigned by your manager The details: Location: Remote Hours: Typical PST business hours will require some flexibility Physical requirements: Ability to both sit and be in front of a screen for long periods Travel requirements: Up to 10% What you’ll bring to the table: 1+ years data analytics experience Intermediate to advanced SQL skills Intermediate to advanced Power BI skills Intermediate to advanced skill in Microsoft Excel and Power Point Above average strategic thinking Outstanding communications skills – both oral and written What can help you really stand out: Experience with Python and R Experience using DAX and other PowerBI data modeling techniques Experience using excel Data Model and PowerPivot Experience with KNN or K-Means A/B testing experience Experience supporting SEO or SEM teams Note: At any time, with or without notice, Paula’s Choice reserves the right to add/delete/change the position’s requirements. Job Type: Full-time

Title: Master Data Analyst - Remote - Indeed.com
Description: Job Summary:  The Data Analyst is responsible for new and innovative data development for Master Data Management within a pharmaceutical digital manufacturing program. Jointly with the Data Architect, Data Modeler, and the System Architect, this team will work closely to drive a holistic standard master data model, architecture, and solution. Leveraging key analytic skills with a data discovery mindset to help unleash the power of data and champion new ideas, work in highly collaborative environments, while working across many disciplines focusing on Master Data Management. The Data Analyst performs investigations into data questions and weaving those findings into an effective story to be actionable for business users. Define application data dictionaries by working with business and technical partners. Identify the quality and completeness of data by working closely with business, technical, and project teams. Facilitate working sessions/workshops to document current/future (AS-IS/TO-BE) process flows. Extract insights and recommendations from the analysis and communicate them in a structured way the project team. Own and develop queries to generate the data to run analysis, leveraging SQL, Redshift, PowerBI, Tableau, or alternate toolset. Proactively monitor project needs to identify trends that are sources of opportunity or potential issues, determine root causes, and work with business partners on next steps. The Data Analyst partners with Data Management Leaders, Interface Engineers, Database Engineers, BI Engineers, Product Owners, Business Analysts, Data Modelers, System Architects, Data Architects, Software Engineers, Project Managers, Business Partners, and others across teams to achieve project and business goals.0 Key Responsibilities:  Master Data Management, Data Governance, and Business Intelligence:  [PG1] [MB2] · Design and execute Data Quality checks. · Document data interfaces and data mappings; analyze and interpret data; conduct data sourcing activities. · Act as the SME (Subject Matter Expert) to analyze and translate business requirements towards the delivery of a data driven solution. · Collaborate and conduct meetings with Business Stakeholders to document use cases & process workflows. · Following up on action items assigned to MDM team and driving to resolution. · Maintain a strong focus on quality, data accuracy, and delivering business value. · Build and maintain a master Data Dictionary to aid in future data analysis. · Lead the collection and analysis of master data from various business systems to identify gaps in data and data quality. Data Wrangling:  · Build and maintain an understanding of data flows, sources, and data transformations across multiple domains. · Extract, merge, cleanse, and transform data from multiple sources as needed for analysis. · Apply critical thinking to pressure test and validate logic and outputs against known sources and understanding of business. · Proactively identify data quality issues and collaborate with other subject matter experts to identify solutions. Data Requirements:  · Define business and data requirements, use cases, and process workflows for data & analytic deliverables and serve as liaison with support teams. · Lead collaboration with Business Teams for data improvements and proactively identify data enhancements in conjunction with Data Stewards. · Translate business requirements to data specific requirements for ideal master data model, architecture, and solution. Analysis:  · Provide actionable insights to support business decisions and long-term strategy development, primarily by performing root cause, exploratory, sensitivity and scenario analysis, hypothesis testing, modeling and data visualization to identify patterns/trends/insights etc. on ambiguous business problems · Actively participate in industry and trade data and analytic communities in order to bring fresh ideas to the organization. · Partner with Data Modeling team to identify data elements and attributes related to business processes. Documentation & Communication:  · Lead team to generate and incorporate insights into a cohesive story that clearly addresses business questions and influences decision making. · Effectively create tailored documentation based on input from business partners. · Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences. · Write clear and concise Agile User Stories. Business Consulting:  · Develop and manage business relationships with project team members and senior leaders across the organization. · Consult with business owners to understand the business problem. Independently identify the appropriate analytic approach to solve the problem. · Provide mentorship and feedback to others on analytic approach and leverage systems thinking to connect work to other strategic initiatives. · Serve as a functional and technical data subject matter expert. · Educate senior and executive leaders across the firm on analytical concepts and best practices. Operational Efficiency:  · Document, monitor, and improve processes and controls related to areas of responsibility. · Proactively identify opportunities for efficiency with moderate to broad impact and visibility, propose solutions to relevant parties and drive implementation of solutions. Miscellaneous:  · Develop/create professionally formatted summary materials (e.g., spreadsheets, tables, charts, Presentations). · Actively employs analytical, strategic, and conceptual thinking. · Act as a thought leader, providing practical recommendations and contributing to team discussions on implications of analysis; identifying implementation challenges. Title: Data Analyst - Washington, DC 20006 - Indeed.com
Description:
Oddball believes that we can bring change and improve the daily lives of millions by bringing quality software to the federal space. Our team is full of experienced engineering, product, and user experience professionals who love bringing scalable solutions to life as much as they love working with clients to solve problems. We value learning, growth, and the ability to make a big impact at a rapidly growing company. 
 
We are looking for a Data Analyst that can collaborate with clients, stakeholders and technical teams. In this role, the data analyst will collect, build reports on, advise and roadmap on a variety of metrics based on the program and team's needs, those can include user interaction data, software and programming information, market research, logistics information, or other user behaviors. This person will bring their technical expertise to the program to ensure the quality and accuracy of that data, then process, design, and present it in ways to help people, businesses, and organizations make better decisions 
 
What you'll be doing 
 
The ideal candidate will be working collaboratively with stakeholders, engineering and operation teams to collect and translate data into reporting and presentations that aligns with the software and program team's goals. This individual will effectively communicate the needs of the clients and stakeholders' as well as be able to resolve any gaps that present to be a challenge. 
 
We are looking for someone with the following qualifications: 
 
 3+ years of experience working with Power BI. 
 Extensive experience developing reports, presentations, and roadmaps using Power BI and has strong analytical and problem solving skills, and is able to identify multiple approaches to problem solving and recommend the best solution. 
 Experience working with and around software development teams, preferably, but not limited to, in the federal space. 
 Ability to effectively communicate and synthesize complex requirements to any audience, from engineers to stakeholders. 
 Experience working with product owners, program managers and stakeholders to establish goals, metrics, and a vision for data across the program. 
 Detail oriented with strong verbal and written communication skills including technical writing skills. Must be able to communicate effectively and confidently with users, team members and management. 
 
 Must be located in the US 
 
This is a full time, remote position. Oddball offers a tech and continuing education stipend. This role requires the ability to obtain a low level security clearance. 
 
Due to the Biden Administration issuing an Executive Order (EO) that effectively mandates COVID-19 vaccination for all U.S. based employees of federal contractors and subcontractors, all Oddball employees will need to be fully vaccinated by December 8, 2021, or by their first date of employment if after that date, subject to legally required accommodations.

Title: Data Analyst - California - Indeed.com
Description:
Hello Heart is the recognized market leader in empowering people to understand and improve their heart health using technology. Leveraging AI and data-driven insights, the app-based solution is not only fun-to-use and habit-forming, but can predict serious heart health issues before they occur. Dozens of the largest Fortune 500 employers are realizing best-in-class results for enrollment and ongoing engagement, clinical outcomes and cost savings. Hello Heart is a member of the American Heart Association's Innovator Network and is part of the CVS Point Solutions Management Program. 
 
Hello Heart is not just another tech company, but a digital therapeutics organization that helps save lives. We are on a mission to help people take control of their own heart health. We believe that culture is the primary path to success and so our Hello Heart Values are woven into everything we do. If you appreciate having the  freedom  to do your job, love to have  fun , enjoy moving  fast , and you give and receive  feedback  willingly, you'll love working here. We seek exceptional talent that is eager to do the best work of their life while making the world a healthier place. 
 
Hello Heart has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are collaborative, creative, and courageous. If this sounds interesting to you, why not say Hello, Heart? 
 
Oh, and if you want to see some recent evidence of the fun things we do at Hello Heart, check out our Instagram page. 
 
About the Role: 
 
Hello Heart is growing and is looking for a  Data Analyst  to join our Data Science and Analytics group, and help drive business decisions across the company. This role will be responsible to update, maintain, and run accurate and innovative client reporting, execute data extraction tasks for enrollment processes, uncover product and marketing insights, and provide ad-hoc reporting to teams across the entire organization. 
 
This role will have many opportunities to learn and expand data skills by working with our growing data team of analysts, scientists, and engineers. The data team works cross-functionally with the customer success, product, and sales teams. 
 
Areas of responsibility: 
 
 Define data collection needed across the functions and systems in the organization to support reporting and analysis. 
 Use SQL to update, build, and maintain complex queries that will help drive business decisions across the product, customer success, and sales teams. 
 Collaborate with the Customer Success team to create and present high-quality client reporting presentations for our dozens of F500 clients that highlight Hello Heart's clinical outcomes, impact, and ROI. 
 Summarize and analyze product marketing enrollment funnels, assist in building funnel improvements, produce and support ad-hoc reporting to understand and improve user enrollment and retention rates. 
 Summarize and analyze clinical outcomes, features usage, data trends to create innovating and compelling marketing and commercial materials. 
 
 The ideal candidate will be: 
 
 Data-driven. Lives, breaths and dreams data and gets super excited to analyze complex data sets, come up with new insights and solutions that are applicable in business settings. 
 Strong data project management skills - data hygiene, sanity checks, etc. 
 Highly independent with strong problem-solving abilities and a go-getter. 
 Strong written and verbal communications skills 
 Highly organized, able to multitask and easily adapt to change. 
 A strong team player that can work with multiple functions within the company. 
 Entrepreneurial, self-sufficient, and thrive in fast-paced environments. 
 
 Qualifications: 
 
 2+ years of experience with advanced skills in SQL, reporting, data analysis, and/or visualization 
 Expertise and comfort with excel (e.g., pivot tables, vlookup, macros, etc.) 
 BA/BS degree in quantitative or business fields, or equivalent work experience 
 Experience working with BI/Analytics tools (e.g. Looker, DASH, Tableau, Periscope, Qlik, Redash etc.) 
 Experience with web analytics tools such as Firebase, Google Analytics, or mixpanel 
 Experience analyzing sales, business operation, marketing or consumer product performance 
 
 preferred: 
 
 Familiarity with data and statistical analysis tools (e.g. R, Python, MATLAB) 
 Experience working with medical claims data 
 Experience working with data pipelines (e.g Apache Airflow, Databricks) - Advantage

Title: Data Analyst III - Denver, CO - Indeed.com
Description:
The Opportunity 
 
Teladoc Health is transforming how people access and experience healthcare. Recognized as the world leader in virtual care, we are partnering with thousands of clients to serve millions! of people around the globe every day. Teladoc Health offers a whole person virtual care platform that empowers all people everywhere to live their healthiest lives by transforming the healthcare experience, from acute and primary care to chronic care, mental health, and specialty care. 
 
Our team of data engineers aggregate and transform substantial amounts of health data and information to support actionable, personalized, and timely health signals for our members. This approach delivers better clinical and financial outcomes while creating a different and better healthcare experience for people everywhere. The applicant should have a strong interest in data quality, data analysis, data design and data consumption. 
 
About You: 
 
You flourish in a fast paced and highly collaborative team environment. You are a quick learner and have the expert ability to prioritize tasks efficiently, while delivering high quality work. You understand that solutions provided by a Data Analyst, support in empowering an organization's business in decision making. You will be part of a great working atmosphere, performing complex work in a collaborative team of amazing people, with forward-thinking managers. You will have the opportunity to make an impact. 
 
Responsibilities 
 Resolve data gaps that impact the fulfillment of the business's functional requirements 
 Perform data analysis to identify data defects and present them to the broader team with clarity 
 Be a self-managed candidate that can effectively triage operational trouble tickets in the same mix as more tactical DQ issues / trends 
 Perform pro-active data analysis to identify downward data quality trends before they become visible 
 Guide data architecture decisions in concert with other designers, planners, and architects to ensure a highly scalable, extensible, and performant solution 
 Analyze and profile database tables to ensure alignment of intent of table vs application of table 
 Participate in Agile planning around data feature requests and advocate for the best data engineering projects in priority planning 
 Candidate Profile 
 Bachelor's degree in mathematics, business, statistics, economics, computer science or related field 
 5+ years of demonstrated experience as a top performer in Data Science and/or Analytics (healthcare analytics preferred) 
 Demonstrated ability to articulate, persuade and communicate the value of data quality 
 Demonstrated experience as a thought leader and innovator in the development of new tools, methodologies, and problem-solving approaches 
 Deep understanding and demonstrated ability to adapt to complex business environments and situations 
 Well versed in SQL development with advanced ANSI SQL skills (10+ years) 
 Ability to not just write complex SQL but to performance tune when necessary 
 Strong acumen for Data Analysis (ability to both profile and interpret data) 
 
 People and culture are Teladoc Health's greatest and most valued assets! We've built a culture we are proud of that reflects our values of diversity and inclusion where everyone's voice is equally important.
 $100,000-$130,000 base salary is based on full time employment in Colorado only. Actual pay may vary based job-related skills, qualifications, certifications, and experience. This role may also be eligible for a discretionary bonus or commission payment, in addition to equity incentives and a comprehensive benefits package. 
 
 Why Join Teladoc Health? 
 
A New Category in Healthcare : Teladoc Health is transforming the healthcare experience and empowering people everywhere to live healthier lives. 
 
Our Work Truly Matters:  Recognized as the world leader in whole-person virtual care, Teladoc Health uses proprietary health signals and personalized interactions to drive better health outcomes across the full continuum of care, at every stage in a person's health journey. 
 
Make an Impact:  In more than 175 countries and ranked Best in KLAS for Virtual Care Platforms in 2020, Teladoc Health leverages more than a decade of expertise and data-driven insights to meet the growing virtual care needs of consumers and healthcare professionals. 
 
Focus on PEOPLE : Teladoc Health has been recognized as a top employer by numerous media and professional organizations. Talented, passionate individuals make the difference, in this fast-moving, collaborative, and inspiring environment. 
 
Diversity and Inclusion : At Teladoc Health we believe that personal and professional diversity is the key to innovation. We hire based solely on your strengths and qualifications, and the way in which those strengths can directly contribute to your success in your new position. 
 
Growth and Innovation : We've already made healthcare yet remain on the threshold of very big things. Come grow with us and support our mission to make a tangible difference in the lives of our Members. 
 
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never have and never will discriminate against any job candidate or employee due to age, race, religion, color, ethnicity, national origin, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, membership in an employee organization, medical condition, family history, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, parental status or pregnancy (including breastfeeding – we have a mother's room in both our offices). In our innovative and inclusive workplace, we prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind.

 Data Visualization and Reporting Analyst

 CO - Golden

 Regular

 Hours Per Week
 40

 Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Protocols
 Employment at NREL is contingent upon your compliance with all NREL and DOE safety protocols and mitigation efforts directed at the COVID-19 pandemic. At present, NREL requires all employees to be immunized against COVID-19. Upon hire, new employees must be prepared to provide proof of vaccination on your first day of employment. All employees must have completed vaccinations prior to starting with NREL.
 Working at NREL
 The National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL), located at the foothills of the Rocky Mountains in Golden, Colorado is the nation's primary laboratory for research and development of renewable energy and energy efficiency technologies.
 From day one at NREL, you’ll connect with coworkers driven by the same mission to save the planet. By joining an organization that values a supportive, inclusive, and flexible work environment, you’ll have the opportunity to engage through our eight employee resource groups, numerous employee-driven clubs, and learning and professional development classes.
 NREL supports inclusive, diverse, and unbiased hiring practices that promote creativity and innovation. By collaborating with organizations that focus on diverse talent pools, reaching out to underrepresented demographics, and providing an inclusive application and interview process, our Talent Acquisition team aims to hear all voices equally. We strive to attract a highly diverse workforce and create a culture where every employee feels welcomed and respected and they can be their authentic selves.
 Job Description
 This position works with various Financial Operations stakeholders to develop and maintain reporting of key financial metrics to support team and management decision making. This would include development and maintenance of analytical and operational standard reports, use of data visualization techniques to track key financial metrics in a dashboard format, and prepare ad-hoc reporting to fulfill stakeholder data request. This position can be remote, hybrid, or on-site.
 DUTIES:
 Develop, implement, and support the configuration, deployment, and usage of the dashboard and data visualization toolkit.
 Create, maintain, and enforce data visualization governance and development standards to continuously and proactively improve the quality of reporting.
 Facilitate cross-functional problem-solving sessions to arrive at optimal solutions for data reporting and visualization.
 Proactively work with Financial Operations teams to understand and analysis different reporting requirements.
 Liaison with ITS for Oracle reporting development and enhancements.
 Create custom travel reports using Cognos reporting tool.
 Preparation of high-quality PowerPoint presentations of financial operations data for various levels of the organization.
 Provide input on data collection standards to ensure the accuracy and reliability of created reports and dashboards.
 Act as Financial Operations SharePoint Administrator backup
 Perform other duties as assigned.
 .
 Basic Qualifications
 Relevant Bachelor's Degree and 5 or more years of experience or equivalent relevant education/experience. Or, relevant Master's Degree and 3 or more years of experience or equivalent relevant education/experience. Or, relevant PhD or equivalent relevant education/experience. Or, relevant JD or equivalent relevant education/experience. Complete understanding and wide application of technical principles, theories and concepts in the field. General knowledge of other related disciplines. Considerable knowledge of laws, regulations, principles, procedures and practices related to specific field. Strong leadership, project management and problem solving skills. Ability to use various computer software programs.
 .
 Additional Required Qualifications
 Bachelor’s degree in finance, business, or computer science. Demonstrated experience Business Intelligence (BI), Analytics, and Data Management experience. Knowledge of data visualization best practices in performance tuning and user-centric design. Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills. Excellent verbal and written communication and collaboration skills in a team environment with a variety of customers.
 Preferred Qualifications
 Master’s degree in finance, business, or computer science. Demonstrated knowledge of, OBIEE, Oracle BI Publisher, Data visualization, Cognos Reporting Tool, SharePoint, Oracle R12.2, Concur, Workday. Prior government contractor experience.
 .
 Annual Salary Range (based on full-time 40 hours per week)
 Annual Salary Range: $73,900 - $133,100
 Offers will typically be made in the bottom half of the listed range. NREL takes into consideration a candidate’s education, training, and experience, as well as the position's work location, expected quality and quantity of work, required travel (if any), external market and internal value, including seniority and merit systems, and internal pay alignment when determining the salary level for potential new employees. In compliance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, a potential new employee’s salary history will not be used in compensation decisions.
 Benefits Summary
 Benefits include medical, dental, and vision insurance; short*- and long-term disability insurance; pension benefits*; 403(b) Employee Savings Plan with employer match*; life and accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D) insurance; personal time off (PTO) and sick leave; paid holidays; and tuition reimbursement*. NREL employees may be eligible for, but are not guaranteed, performance-, merit-, and achievement- based awards that include a monetary component. Some positions may be eligible for relocation expense reimbursement. Limited-term positions are not eligible for long-term disability or tuition reimbursement.

 Submission Guidelines
 Please note that in order to be considered an applicant for any position at NREL you must submit an application form for each position for which you believe you are qualified. Applications are not kept on file for future positions. Please include a cover letter and resume with each position application.
 .
 EEO Policy
 NREL is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard basis of age (40 and over), color, disability, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, military or veteran status, national origin/ancestry, race, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding), sexual orientation, and any other applicable status protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Title: Data Analyst - Researcher 2 - Minneapolis, MN - Indeed.com
Description:
Required Qualifications: 
 Undergraduate degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, Analytics, Computer Modeling, or related field and 1 year of work experience; can substitute combination of education and experience to equal 5 years 
 Work experience as a Data Analyst 
 Strong knowledge of and demonstrable expertise with programming languages, data management software, and data visualization tools. Examples include Python, MATLAB, XML, JavaScript, ETL frameworks, SQL,Tableau, Qlik, etc. 
 Possess a combination of technical skills, leadership and teamwork skills, and communication skills 
 Possess strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy 
 Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting/communicating findings 
 Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and management, and data mining and segmentation techniques 
 This position will require a volunteer appointment at the Minneapolis VA Medical Center, where the research team is located. US Citizenship is required to hold a VA appointment. 
Preferred Qualifications: 
 Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for gathering, organizing, analyzing datasets, and presenting findings. Examples include R, SAS, SPSS etc. 
 Knowledge of and/or experience with clinical research and REDCap (Research Electronic Data Capture) application database building and management 
This Data Analyst position will work as part of a clinical research team at the University of Minnesota and the Minneapolis VA. We are investigating how in-home sensor monitoring technologies can be used to keep older adults healthy and living independently as they age (AGING-WELL research study). This position will work independently and within the team in the areas of data management, data processing, and data analysis.
 Dr. Adriana Hughes, PhD is the study’s Principal Investigator, and a faculty of the Minneapolis VA Geriatric Research, Education & Clinical Center (GRECC) and Department of Psychiatry at the University of Minnesota. The AGING-WELL research study is being conducted within the Geriatric Research, Education & Clinical Center (GRECC) at the Minneapolis VA Medical Center. The study is supported by a R01 grant from the National Institutes of Health (NIH). 
Job Duties Include: 
Develop, implement, manage, and maintain data systems and databases (20%) 
Filter and clean large datasets of data to identify and correct code problems and other data-related problems (20%) 
Explore, mine, manipulate, process, and aggregate/curate large datasets of data from primary and secondary sources, and reorganize data in a format that can be easily read (15%) 
Create appropriate documentation that allows stakeholders to understand the steps of data processing and analysis and duplicate or replicate the processing or analysis if necessary (15%) 
Collaborate with programmers, engineers, investigators, and research staff to identify and define opportunities for process improvements, recommend system modifications, and develop policies for data governance (10%) 
Use statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret complex data sets (10%) 
Prepare weekly reports that summarize datasets and effectively communicate problems, descriptives, trends, and patterns in datasets (10%)
 To learn more about the Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences please visit: https://med.umn.edu/psychiatry 
Applications must be submitted online. To be considered for this position, please click the Apply button and follow the instructions. You will be given the opportunity to complete an online application for the position and attach a cover letter and resume. 
Additional documents may be attached after application by accessing your "My Job Applications" page and uploading documents in the "My Cover Letters and Attachments" section. 
To request an accommodation during the application process, please e-mail employ@umn.edu or call (612) 624-UOHR (8647). 
The Department of Psychiatry & Behavioral Sciences is diligent in fostering excellence in teaching, research and clinical service. We recognize excellence is reached through the vibrant exchange of ideas, which thrives when people from a multitude of backgrounds, experiences, perspectives and viewpoints collaborate. We uphold an environment of inclusivity, equal opportunity and accessibility. We are committed to creating and maintaining an atmosphere where similarities and differences are celebrated, mutual respect is cultivated and intellectual growth is fueled. To learn more about our commitments please visit: https://med.umn.edu/psychiatry/about/diversity 
The University recognizes and values the importance of diversity and inclusion in enriching the employment experience of its employees and in supporting the academic mission. The University is committed to attracting and retaining employees with varying identities and backgrounds. 
The University of Minnesota provides equal access to and opportunity in its programs, facilities, and employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, gender, age, marital status, disability, public assistance status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. To learn more about diversity at the U: http://diversity.umn.edu. 
Any offer of employment is contingent upon the successful completion of a background check. Our presumption is that prospective employees are eligible to work here. Criminal convictions do not automatically disqualify finalists from employment. 
 
Please note: All employees at the University of Minnesota are required to report complete vaccination against COVID-19 or submit documentation requesting a medical or religious exemption on their first day of employment. To learn more, please visit the University's COVID-19 Response webpage. 
The University of Minnesota, Twin Cities (UMTC) 
The University of Minnesota, Twin Cities (UMTC), is among the largest public research universities in the country, offering undergraduate, graduate, and professional students a multitude of opportunities for study and research. Located at the heart of one of the nation's most vibrant, diverse metropolitan communities, students on the campuses in Minneapolis and St. Paul benefit from extensive partnerships with world-renowned health centers, international corporations, government agencies, and arts, nonprofit, and public service organizations.

Title: Data Analyst - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
You will help pave the future of how clinical data is made actionable for our customers. 
 
 Summary:  The Data Analyst is a problem solver with a passion for data. You will use data exploration and visualization tools to both highlight effectiveness of Diameter Health solutions in their respective domains and identify opportunities for enhancement. You will assist in the administration of and requirements for an analytic data set. This will require working with cross-functional partners to understand overall and use-case specific value. You should also have strong writing and communication skills and can build relationships with team members and client stakeholders. 
 
Responsibilities:
 Develop, implement, and maintain analytic systems that take complex data and build simple frameworks for analysis 
 Identify and prototype analyses that answer key business questions using SQL, NoSQL, MS Excel, and business intelligence tools 
 Use business intelligence tools to identify correlations and patterns within the data that highlight value and identify opportunities for improvement 
 Define requirements for the product team to consider for inclusion in overall data processing 
 Prepare and present reports to internal stakeholders as well as Diameter Health customers 
 Identify trends and opportunities through analysis of complex data sets 
 Maintain data integrity, perform QA and diligently troubleshoot issues within the analytic data system

Title: Data Analyst - Jersey City, NJ 07311 - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Description: 
As a Data Analyst in the Fidelity Risk Group, the candidate will conduct data analysis and develop insights and solutions that improve our understanding of and response to emerging risks. By working closely with business and technology partners across Legal, Risk, and Compliance, the candidate will provide timely analysis in response to event-driven risks, as well as proactively translate customer behavior and market trends into insights that empower our risk management strategy and roadmap. 
The Expertise You Have 
Bachelor’s degree or higher with 3-5 years of relevant analytics experience 
Advanced SQL skills and experience developing insights from large, multi-sourced datasets 
Comfortable performing terabyte-scale data analysis and ETL using relational databases, warehouses, cloud computing platforms, and API/web services 
Proficiency with data visualization (Tableau preferred) and transforming insights into compelling visual stories 
Prior experience using Python or R is preferred 
Prior experience in brokerage or asset management, or strong interest/experience in investing is preferred 
The Skills You Bring 
You have a strong track record of translating questions and requirements into thoughtful data solutions 
You are comfortable working on both fast-paced tactical work and longer-term strategic initiatives 
You have an exceptional sense of curiosity while prioritizing progress over perfection 
You work effectively when performing independent work as well as when collaborating with colleagues 
You understand and employ fundamental statistical concepts to validate and challenge assumptions 
The Value You Deliver
 Conducting end to end data analysis that will be used to drive strategic discussion, develop innovative tools, prioritize technology spend, and help protect Fidelity's customers and trusted brand. 
Certifications: 
Company Overview 
 
At Fidelity Investments, our customers are at the heart of everything we do. As a privately held company with a rich 75-year history, our mission has remained the same since our founding:  to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients . We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money. 
 
 Join Us 
 
At Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning and growth so you can build the career you’ve always imagined. We welcome associates from different backgrounds and with different perspectives to help us innovate and make a difference for our customers and our communities. 
 
We invite you to  Find Your Fidelity  at fidelitycareers.com. 
Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging. 
 
Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. Title: Data Services Analyst - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Description:
 
The Data Services Analyst is responsible to ensuring incoming data is setup to load electronically into BTO Settlement processing and Data Acquisition for data standardization. This includes providing the mapping layout to the SSIS Developer for new setups and modifications to existing setups. This position requires that you understand the required data fields and criteria for automated loading and ability to research and identify the root cause for failures. This position is very analytical in nature due to varying data elements and areas for loading to be affected. 
The job duties vary based on the allocation of tasks due to volume and coverage. 
Analyst Duties and Responsibilities 
Possess fundamental understanding of the requirements required for incoming electronic data 
Ability to adjust the data where needed to ensure it flows through the electronic process without issues 
Analyze the data received vs what was originally setup to determine the cause for any issues 
Frequent communication with other team members, departments, customers and clients regarding data discrepancies affecting the loading process 
Maintain and keep electronic customer reporting up to date 
Format excel attachment into the eClaim template to load electronically 
Identify white space setups where the setup is the same as another manufacturer, includes ability to use SQL where needed 
Report all issues to the Data Services manager as soon as they are detected 
Works all reload and process failure type tickets for the area as it relates to electronic data 
 Creating SOP documents for processes within the team ensuring there are watch dogs in place to catch issues with the data flow 
Ability to perform in depth research on issues related to electronic data flow 
Outbound communication with distributor, operators, and clients to correct electronic data where needed 
Ability to thoroughly document any issues found, internal and external documents 
Ability to use SQL to do research and updates where needed with electronic data loaded 
Ensure ticket movement by onboarding type and internal expectations on ticket completion dates by ticket type 
Prelog and split pdf documents in BTO 
Manage emails in email application. 
Resolve claim comments, emails, and claim processing when needed 
. Requirements: 
Knowledge and Skills 
Basic Knowledge of SQL queries 
Strong data analysis background 
Ability to analyze incoming data and determine where there are discrepancies with the information received vs how the original data was setup 
Advanced knowledge of various file types data can be received in and the difference between them (ie; txt, dat, xls, csv, psv, etc…) 
Team player, contributes to a positive work environment. 
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
Will become knowledgeable in the AFS applications to understand the importance of imported data 
Ability to perform job duties with little or no supervision 
Degrees, Certificates and Experience: 
Minimum 2-year college or related experience or equivalent combination of both. 
Basic SQL skills 
High school degree
