Title: Junior Data Analyst (Consultant) - Washington, DC 20005 - Indeed.com
Description:
The World Justice Project's (WJP) research and data team is seeking a full-time, paid Junior Data Analyst for the winter 2021 and spring of 2022 (starting in December for a minimum of six months). This position will support WJP's work studying rule of law issues around the world and will entail supporting data analysis and report production processes. WJP's global research and data team operates out its Washington, DC office, but due to the COVID-19 pandemic, this position is currently remote. Multiple positions may be filled from this announcement. 
Essential Duties and Responsibilities: 
The Data Analytics Intern will assist with the research, data analysis, and development of projects on the status of the rule of law in different countries and may also assist with other thematic research as needed. The main responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to: 
Analyze survey data gathered from the general public and experts in 100+ countries. 
Assist with the primary data collection process for the Qualified Respondents Questionnaires in Latin America and the European Union. 
Write reproducible scripts and workflows to collect, clean, and analyze data in order to answer key policy questions. 
Visualize data, write descriptions and summaries of projects, and create presentations of results. 
Proactively provide ideas and critical feedback as part of constantly updating of Rule of Law Index's methodology.
 Assist with primary data collection for new research projects as needed. 
Assist in automating graphs and dashboards for print and web. 
Explore website structures and develop web scrapping R scripts. 
 
 Qualifications 
Bachelor's or Master's degree (completed or currently pursuing) in in Economics, Statistics, Data Analytics, Computer Science or related field.
 Understanding of rule of law and governance issues in global contexts. 
Knowledge of Microsoft Office (especially Excel), with preference given to those with prior experience/proven ability managing large databases.
 Proficiency in Spanish is strongly preferred, other foreign language skills (especially French or Portuguese) is a plus.
 Proficiency in at least one statistical programming language, such as R (strongly preferred), Python, Stata, or related tools. 
Ability to communicate clearly and efficiently and ability to give and receive feedback.
 Highly dependable with the ability to work in a team-oriented environment.
 Excellent written and oral communication skills, excellent problem solving skills, and attention to detail. 
How to Apply:  The World Justice Project is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity. To apply, please go to worldjusticeproject.isolved.com. Please include the following documents (in one PDF file) along with your application: 
Cover letter 
Resume
 Writing sample including data visualizations. It can be in Spanish or English.
 Contact information for 3 professional references 
Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. Incomplete applications will not be considered. This position will remain open until filled. Due to the high volume of applications received, we are only able to follow up directly with candidates selected for interviews. No phone calls please.

Title: Data Analyst (Intermediate Level) - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Topline Group is looking for a strong intermediate level data analyst. Candidate must have a significant level of experience with Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, macros, and VB code if possible) and Access (queries, macros). A working knowledge of queries is expected. Candidates should be familiar with inner joins, left joins, and how to dedupe records in a query, and be comfortable working with nested “If” statements. This is a work-from-home position; however, candidates located in Lynchburg, VA or Greensboro, NC are a plus in terms of ability to easily meet with other staffers when necessary. 
 
Candidate would work with and manipulate large customer data files containing several million records. The data will be analyzed to address key strategic issues for large sales organizations including questions like: 1) what is the optimal size of the sales force, 2) who should they be calling on, and 3) where should the sales associates be located. Candidates will also be expected to interact with clients via video conference calls to assist in reporting/troubleshooting when necessary. 
 
A 4-year college degree is preferred but not essential, as is a minimum of 2-3 years of work experience in a data oriented position. Experience in the hotel/hospitality industry is another plus. Compensation is $50K to $60K commensurate with experience. 
 
As mentioned above, this is a work-from-home position; however, candidates located in Lynchburg, VA or Greensboro, NC are a plus in terms of ability to easily meet with other staffers when necessary. Schedule is very flexible. Position is eligible for 401k plan and 2 weeks of vacation after one year of employment. Medical insurance coverage is not available at this time. 
 
Please send inquiries and résumés to careers@toplinegroup.com

Description:
The New School is committed to creating and maintaining an environment that promises diversity and tolerance in all areas of employment, education and access to its educational, artistic or cultural programs and activities. Title: Associate Forecasting Analyst - New York, NY - Indeed.com
Description:
At Insider Intelligence, we value flexibility and understand everyone's situation is different. For that reason, we are open to hiring either fully remote or in office employees. 
We’re hiring an Associate Forecasting Analyst to join our Forecasting Team at Insider Intelligence, the leading provider of research focused on digital transformation. 
As Associate Forecasting Analyst you will help clients identify key trends in Insider Intelligence’s core research coverage areas (advertising & marketing, financial services, health and technology across the digital landscape)—as well as help clients make smart decisions about digital marketing and media investments. 
You will work directly with our forecasting team to develop Insider Intelligence/eMarketer estimates and forecasts and provide our content teams with insights to help develop reports, articles, press releases, videos and other interactive content as needed. 
 The Ideal Candidate Is: 
Committed to fostering an inclusive culture  and values a representative workplace that embraces diversity of thought and experience. 
Experienced in quantitative and qualitative  data analysis with an innate curiosity around consumer behavior and technology adoption trends 
A confident and creative presenter  who can translate data-heavy analyses into digestible communications (written and verbal) for internal and external stakeholders 
Highly-organized  and pays great attention to detail 
An independent worker  who can move projects through to completion with little supervision 
 Responsibilities: 
Organize and analyze data and qualitative information from various sources related to Insider Intelligence coverage areas (advertising & marketing, financial services, health and technology across the digital landscape), to update or develop models for proprietary eMarketer estimates and forecasts. 
Distill quantitative findings into insights and narratives that impact business objectives. 
Stay on top of digital and mobile trends. 
Collaborate closely with the forecasting team and other stakeholders across content teams to identify new trends and topics that are valuable to eMarketer clients and expand eMarketer estimates and forecasts into those new areas. 
Communicate regularly through presentations and written responses within the organization. 
 Desired Skills & Experience: 
A strong quantitative background with relevant analytical experience in areas such as market research, marketing & advertising, consumer insights analysis and digital trends preferred 
Experience using Excel to analyze data 
Ability to communicate clearly, persuasively and cleanly 
 If this sounds like your dream job, please apply online and tell us why you're a great addition to our team. 
Please note that for all positions at Insider Intelligence, there is an exercise component specific to the role to reduce selection bias in our recruiting process and test how you apply knowledge. 
About Insider Intelligence: 
Insider Intelligence is the world's leading research company focused on digital transformation. We hire people who are passionate about providing business leaders with actionable data and insights in the areas of digital marketing and advertising, media, retail and ecommerce, financial services, healthcare, and more. Our clients, who rely on our content to make informed decisions, include top global brands within Fortune 1000 companies, as well as smaller firms striving to compete in a digital age. 
At Insider Intelligence, we pride ourselves on an inclusive work environment and continuously strive for diversity of thought, identity, and experience while encouraging growth and providing support to team members throughout the organization. Insider Intelligence is committed to corporate transparency through regular business updates and an always-open line of communication. Our employees embody our core values of effectiveness, curiosity, excellence through iteration, efficient communication, and diversity and inclusion.

Title: Data Analyst III - Denver, CO - Indeed.com
Description:
The Opportunity 
 
Teladoc Health is transforming how people access and experience healthcare. Recognized as the world leader in virtual care, we are partnering with thousands of clients to serve millions! of people around the globe every day. Teladoc Health offers a whole person virtual care platform that empowers all people everywhere to live their healthiest lives by transforming the healthcare experience, from acute and primary care to chronic care, mental health, and specialty care. 
 
Our team of data engineers aggregate and transform substantial amounts of health data and information to support actionable, personalized, and timely health signals for our members. This approach delivers better clinical and financial outcomes while creating a different and better healthcare experience for people everywhere. The applicant should have a strong interest in data quality, data analysis, data design and data consumption. 
 
About You: 
 
You flourish in a fast paced and highly collaborative team environment. You are a quick learner and have the expert ability to prioritize tasks efficiently, while delivering high quality work. You understand that solutions provided by a Data Analyst, support in empowering an organization's business in decision making. You will be part of a great working atmosphere, performing complex work in a collaborative team of amazing people, with forward-thinking managers. You will have the opportunity to make an impact. 
 
Responsibilities 
 Resolve data gaps that impact the fulfillment of the business's functional requirements 
 Perform data analysis to identify data defects and present them to the broader team with clarity 
 Be a self-managed candidate that can effectively triage operational trouble tickets in the same mix as more tactical DQ issues / trends 
 Perform pro-active data analysis to identify downward data quality trends before they become visible 
 Guide data architecture decisions in concert with other designers, planners, and architects to ensure a highly scalable, extensible, and performant solution 
 Analyze and profile database tables to ensure alignment of intent of table vs application of table 
 Participate in Agile planning around data feature requests and advocate for the best data engineering projects in priority planning 
 Candidate Profile 
 Bachelor's degree in mathematics, business, statistics, economics, computer science or related field 
 5+ years of demonstrated experience as a top performer in Data Science and/or Analytics (healthcare analytics preferred) 
 Demonstrated ability to articulate, persuade and communicate the value of data quality 
 Demonstrated experience as a thought leader and innovator in the development of new tools, methodologies, and problem-solving approaches 
 Deep understanding and demonstrated ability to adapt to complex business environments and situations 
 Well versed in SQL development with advanced ANSI SQL skills (10+ years) 
 Ability to not just write complex SQL but to performance tune when necessary 
 Strong acumen for Data Analysis (ability to both profile and interpret data) 
 
 People and culture are Teladoc Health's greatest and most valued assets! We've built a culture we are proud of that reflects our values of diversity and inclusion where everyone's voice is equally important.
 $100,000-$130,000 base salary is based on full time employment in Colorado only. Actual pay may vary based job-related skills, qualifications, certifications, and experience. This role may also be eligible for a discretionary bonus or commission payment, in addition to equity incentives and a comprehensive benefits package. 
 
 Why Join Teladoc Health? 
 
A New Category in Healthcare : Teladoc Health is transforming the healthcare experience and empowering people everywhere to live healthier lives. 
 
Our Work Truly Matters:  Recognized as the world leader in whole-person virtual care, Teladoc Health uses proprietary health signals and personalized interactions to drive better health outcomes across the full continuum of care, at every stage in a person's health journey. 
 
Make an Impact:  In more than 175 countries and ranked Best in KLAS for Virtual Care Platforms in 2020, Teladoc Health leverages more than a decade of expertise and data-driven insights to meet the growing virtual care needs of consumers and healthcare professionals. 
 
Focus on PEOPLE : Teladoc Health has been recognized as a top employer by numerous media and professional organizations. Talented, passionate individuals make the difference, in this fast-moving, collaborative, and inspiring environment. 
 
Diversity and Inclusion : At Teladoc Health we believe that personal and professional diversity is the key to innovation. We hire based solely on your strengths and qualifications, and the way in which those strengths can directly contribute to your success in your new position. 
 
Growth and Innovation : We've already made healthcare yet remain on the threshold of very big things. Come grow with us and support our mission to make a tangible difference in the lives of our Members. 
 
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never have and never will discriminate against any job candidate or employee due to age, race, religion, color, ethnicity, national origin, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, membership in an employee organization, medical condition, family history, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, parental status or pregnancy (including breastfeeding – we have a mother's room in both our offices). In our innovative and inclusive workplace, we prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Data Analyst - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Who is ONEHOPE? 
ONE HOPE is a Napa Valley Winery  built on hope and rooted in purpose.  We exist   to  Nourish the Future . Through our technology we enable a purpose-driven community of 5,000+ "Cause Entrepreneurs" to join us on our  mission to share wine and give hope  through wine tasting experiences nation-wide (most are virtual currently). The Cause Entrepreneur opportunity is at the perfect intersection of “gig economy” and “work from home” and is well suited for the current unique environment we live in. As a Cause Entrepreneur, we give anyone the necessary tools to build a cause-centric business on their own terms. 
To date we’ve donated over Seven Million Dollars and through wine sponsorships and thousands of events held we’ve helped non profit organizations raise tens of millions more for other meaningful causes. Our award-winning wines are produced by rockstar winemaker Mari Coyle in collaboration with other great winemakers including Rob Mondavi Jr.. Our Estate vineyard and winery is in the heart of Napa Valley. Since launching in 2007, ONEHOPE has grown from a public storage unit to one of the top 250 wineries of 10,000+ in the US. We aim to be the largest direct to consumer wine brand in the nation by 2022. 
ONEHOPE is backed by some of the best investors and business builders in the world, including our co-chairman Joe Lonsdale (co-founder of Palantir and 8VC), co-chairman Erik Anderson (CEO of Top Golf and West River Group), board member Jennifer Justice (The Justice Department), Sr. Advisor Richelle Parham (CMO of eBay), Wes Chan (Google Analytics and Voice founder and Felicis Ventures) and Ken Howery (co-founder of PayPal and the Founder's Fund). 
Your Team - Growth Marketing 
The growth marketing team is pivotal in taking ONEHOPE to the next level. We are focused on building an experience for our Cause Entrepreneurs and customers that will enable us to become the largest direct to consumer wine brand in the world, while simultaneously increasing our ability to empower people to make the world a better place. We're not just another wine company, we're disrupting existing commerce models with modern experiences. 
The Role 
The Growth Marketing team at ONEHOPE seeks to establish and maintain the data assets, operations, and culture to support a more optimized and introspective ONEHOPE. The team is looking for an impactful Data Analyst to play a foundational role in executing this goal. 
As the first hire of the Analytics team, you will become a specialist on data related to all ONEHOPE functions, including Finance, Sales, Marketing, Product, and Community. You will expand our team’s impact by leading projects with internal partners from end to end, from problem scoping to the development and maintenance of solutions. You will gain mastery across our analytics stack and take pride in maintaining and improving our data infrastructure to support the team’s goals. Lastly, you will be a thought partner to the EVP of Growth on various issues, from designing analyses to setting team strategy. 
What You’ll Do 
Responsibilities will include: 
Supporting analytics pipeline - including data modeling to dashboard development in Looker - to enable the proliferation of self-service BI across ONEHOPE. 
Leading and executing on data-driven projects from problem scoping to implementation across different functions. 
Conceiving and creating data assets (datasets, dashboards, statistical models) that will support relevant teams and company strategy. 
Collaborating with data engineering to unlock data sources beyond the reach of our analytics stack. 
Communicating findings and recommendations to stakeholders with varying levels of statistical expertise. 
Leading trainings, events, and other activities that actively promote and help to develop a data-first culture at ONEHOPE. 
Potential projects may include: 
Becoming embedded in our marketing team to craft and build the data infrastructure that enables the bespoke reporting vital to optimize their operations.

 Quality and Process Improvements

Title: Data Analyst - Chicago, IL 60606 - Indeed.com
Description:
Our Company 
Home Partners of America is an owner and operator of high-quality, single-family, retail homes. Our mission is to help more people get into great homes, in the neighborhoods they love, while preserving the opportunity to build a more secure financial future. This commitment to making homeownership a reality is made possible through a unique business model that leverages data and analytic capabilities on Home Partners’ technology-enabled operating platform. We are a dynamic organization poised for growth and expansion into the future and are looking to hire passionate and energetic employees. 
Your Role 
We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our data quality and analytics team. The Data Analyst is responsible for providing data analysis, BI reports, and data visualization solutions. This position is based in our Chicago office. 
Responsibilities 
Prepare and validate monthly and quarterly financial reports. 
Provide ad hoc reports and data sets based on end-user requests. 
Develop and maintain dashboards and data visualizations to monitor data quality. 
Partner with business teams to identify appropriate data sources and analysis methodology to meet business needs. 
Initiate and own analyses to drive new insights and data solutions/products. 
Requirements 
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, or other quantitative fields. 2+ years of experience as a data analyst or business analyst. 
Experience using statistical analysis and modeling techniques. 
Experience with Tableau, Power BI, or other data visualization platforms. 
Knowledge of SQL. 
Comfortable interacting and working with offshore team. 
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment. 
Knowledge of Python is a great plus. 
Home Partners of America and Pathlight Property Management are Equal Opportunity Employers and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind. All employment decisions including the decision to hire, promote, discipline or discharge are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity or sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability status, genetic information, veteran or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations in which we operate.

Title: Data Analyst - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Who is ONEHOPE? 
ONE HOPE is a Napa Valley Winery  built on hope and rooted in purpose.  We exist   to  Nourish the Future . Through our technology we enable a purpose-driven community of 5,000+ "Cause Entrepreneurs" to join us on our  mission to share wine and give hope  through wine tasting experiences nation-wide (most are virtual currently). The Cause Entrepreneur opportunity is at the perfect intersection of “gig economy” and “work from home” and is well suited for the current unique environment we live in. As a Cause Entrepreneur, we give anyone the necessary tools to build a cause-centric business on their own terms. 
To date we’ve donated over Seven Million Dollars and through wine sponsorships and thousands of events held we’ve helped non profit organizations raise tens of millions more for other meaningful causes. Our award-winning wines are produced by rockstar winemaker Mari Coyle in collaboration with other great winemakers including Rob Mondavi Jr.. Our Estate vineyard and winery is in the heart of Napa Valley. Since launching in 2007, ONEHOPE has grown from a public storage unit to one of the top 250 wineries of 10,000+ in the US. We aim to be the largest direct to consumer wine brand in the nation by 2022. 
ONEHOPE is backed by some of the best investors and business builders in the world, including our co-chairman Joe Lonsdale (co-founder of Palantir and 8VC), co-chairman Erik Anderson (CEO of Top Golf and West River Group), board member Jennifer Justice (The Justice Department), Sr. Advisor Richelle Parham (CMO of eBay), Wes Chan (Google Analytics and Voice founder and Felicis Ventures) and Ken Howery (co-founder of PayPal and the Founder's Fund). 
Your Team - Growth Marketing 
The growth marketing team is pivotal in taking ONEHOPE to the next level. We are focused on building an experience for our Cause Entrepreneurs and customers that will enable us to become the largest direct to consumer wine brand in the world, while simultaneously increasing our ability to empower people to make the world a better place. We're not just another wine company, we're disrupting existing commerce models with modern experiences. 
The Role 
The Growth Marketing team at ONEHOPE seeks to establish and maintain the data assets, operations, and culture to support a more optimized and introspective ONEHOPE. The team is looking for an impactful Data Analyst to play a foundational role in executing this goal. 
As the first hire of the Analytics team, you will become a specialist on data related to all ONEHOPE functions, including Finance, Sales, Marketing, Product, and Community. You will expand our team’s impact by leading projects with internal partners from end to end, from problem scoping to the development and maintenance of solutions. You will gain mastery across our analytics stack and take pride in maintaining and improving our data infrastructure to support the team’s goals. Lastly, you will be a thought partner to the EVP of Growth on various issues, from designing analyses to setting team strategy. 
What You’ll Do 
Responsibilities will include: 
Supporting analytics pipeline - including data modeling to dashboard development in Looker - to enable the proliferation of self-service BI across ONEHOPE. 
Leading and executing on data-driven projects from problem scoping to implementation across different functions. 
Conceiving and creating data assets (datasets, dashboards, statistical models) that will support relevant teams and company strategy. 
Collaborating with data engineering to unlock data sources beyond the reach of our analytics stack. 
Communicating findings and recommendations to stakeholders with varying levels of statistical expertise. 
Leading trainings, events, and other activities that actively promote and help to develop a data-first culture at ONEHOPE. 
Potential projects may include: 
Becoming embedded in our marketing team to craft and build the data infrastructure that enables the bespoke reporting vital to optimize their operations. 
Collaborating with Go-to-Market leaders to refine our metric-backed stories and working across the analytics stack to generate the assets that support those communications. 
Creating churn prediction models that will help our Sales, Marketing & Field Development teams to more efficiently allocate and prioritize resources. 
Partnering with the Sales team to arm them with the data needed to train, optimize and close deals. 
Building data models that will enhance our ability to do more complex cross-functional analysis. 
Qualifications: 
2+ years of experience in a data analysis role 
Problem solver that wants to tackle new challenges and, given context, being self-directed and passionate about owning your work autonomously. 
Create visualizations using tools like Looker (preferred), Tableau, Mode, or Periscope/Sisense for Cloud Data Teams 
Good understanding of and interest in statistical concepts vital for nuanced analyses. 
Experience with executing in a cross-functional and ambiguous startup environment. 
Proficient in using SQL to write complex queries that join data across multiple systems 
Data analysis programming languages such as Python or R is a plus 
Experience with data modeling layers such as DBT is a plus 
Solid background of learning new tools, technologies, and frameworks. 
Additional Benefits and Perks: 
A best in class team and company culture 
Computer and technology provided 
Medical benefits 
Paid vacation and holidays 
Award-winning wine 
Flexible work hours 
Monthly happy hours and birthday celebrations 
Location: Remote; Los Angeles a plus

We'd love to talk to you! Please submit the following to apply: 
Resume 
Cover letter explaining:

Why you want to work at ONEHOPE

Title: Epidemiology Analyst - Data Modernization - Remote - Indeed.com
Description: Healthcare Staffing Professionals has an immediate need for an Epidemiology Analyst. The Epidemiology Analyst will work on LADPHs data transition of IRIS surveillance and case management systems. The candidate will facilitate mapping of the disease processes and data elements, and help in creating and implementing data workflows, data dictionaries, and data quality assurance and quality improvement feedback loops. The candidate will also comply with Public Health training regarding confidential information related to personal information and support the various reportable disease teams on identifying and interpreting clusters, prioritizing investigations, and automating processes. The position will start immediately upon acceptance and employment clearance and is initially funded through 2/22/2022 with potential renewal. Pay Rate- $39.27/hr working 40 hours a week Benefits : Paid Holidays, Paid Sick Time, PTO Healthcare Employer Fully Funded Healthcare (Anthem Blue Cross), Dental and Vision, Life Insurance from Initial Start Date. Shifts: M-F (100% Telework) Employee will be working a minimum of 8 hours a day between the hours of 7 AM to 7 PM for a total of 40 hours a week Job Duties a. Support the various reportable disease teams on identifying and interpreting clusters, prioritizing investigations, and automating processes; b. Work on the transition of IRIS surveillance and case management system; c. Facilitate mapping of the disease processes and data elements, and help in creating and implementing data workflows, data dictionaries, and data quality assurance and quality improvement feedback loops; d. Comply with Public Health training regarding confidential information related to personal information; and e. Accept responsibility for other duties as assigned. Minimum Qualifications:  A Master's degree from an accredited college with specialization in epidemiology or its equivalent -OR- A Bachelor's degree from an accredited college in public health, social science, health science or related field -and- two years of experience assisting in the design, conduct, and evaluation of epidemiologic studies or investigations; and A valid California Class C Driver License, proof of vehicle insurance, and reliable transportation or the ability to utilize an alternative method of transportation when needed to carry out job-related essential functions. Desirable Qualifications:  · Experience in designing, conducting, evaluating, and interpreting epidemiological studies or investigations; and · Knowledge in communicable disease surveillance and control, including interpretation and evaluation of laboratory test results and statistical data. Job Types: Full-time, Contract Pay: $39.27 per hour Benefits: Dental insurance Health insurance Life insurance Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Location: Remote

Title: Data Analyst - Lodi, CA 95240 - Indeed.com
Description: Summary:   Data Analyst will perform a variety of reporting functions. The primary responsibility requires analyzing various data and generating reports. Communicating internally and externally the actions recommended to be taken, and electronically documenting all these activities. Essential Duties and Responsibilities  include the following: · Generate standard or custom reports summarizing business, financial, or economic data for review by executives, managers, clients, and other stakeholders. Manage timely flow of business intelligence information to users. · Report to management various key performance indicators (KPIs) · Review reports for discrepancies and analyze variances. Perform account reconciliations. · Provide technical support for existing reports, dashboards, or other tools. · Develop, implement, modify, and document recordkeeping and accounting systems, making use of current computer technology. · Maintain library of model documents, templates, or other reusable knowledge assets. Maintain or update business intelligence tools, dashboards, systems, or methods. · Create business intelligence tools or systems, including design of related databases, spreadsheets, or outputs. Identify or monitor current and potential customers, using business intelligence tools. · Collect business intelligence data from available industry reports, public information, field reports, and internal sources. Disseminate information regarding tools, reports, or metadata enhancements. · Analyze strategies through analysis of related product, market, or other best practices. · Review documentation to ensure the accurate development of reporting solutions. · Conduct or coordinate tests to ensure that intelligence is consistent with the defined needs. Collect and analyze data to detect deficient controls, duplicated effort, extravagance, fraud, or non-compliance with laws, regulations, and management policies. · Maintain a healthy relationship with all employees, customers, and vendors. · Other duties as assigned by management or supervisor. QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Education and/or Experience : Applicant must have relative experience in data or financial analysis with an expert understanding of data systems and Microsoft excel. Prior construction industry experience a plus. Licenses or Certifications:  Bachelors degree Communication Skills:  Ability to read and comprehend instructions, correspondence, and memos. Ability to write clear instructions, explanations, and correspondence. Ability to professionally communicate via phone, text messaging, email, or written communication. Ability to easily operate computers and computer related programs. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization. Reasoning Ability:  Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed written or oral instructions. Analysts should have good judgment skills and the ability to make decisions quickly. PHYSICAL DEMANDS The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. Title: Data Analyst - Boston, MA 02110 - Indeed.com
Description:
Acadian Asset Management LLC is a Boston-headquartered investment management firm with wholly owned affiliates located in Singapore, London, and Sydney. As of September 30, 2021, the firm managed approximately US$113 billion on behalf of major pension funds, endowments, foundations, governments, and other investors based in the U.S. and abroad.
 
 Position Overview: 
We are seeking a detail-oriented, well-organized individual for the position of Data Analyst. The Data Analyst will be part of the Investment Analytics and Data team in a highly visible position supporting and enhancing the data management operations and data control framework across all areas of the firm. Primary responsibilities include regular monitoring of the quality of the data used as inputs to our investment process and responding to queries concerning that data from internal and external constituents. This individual will use a wide range of applications to support a full range of data used throughout Acadian used by Investment Research, the Quantitative Forecasting Process, Portfolio Construction, Trading, Performance, Business Development, and Client Service.
 
 What You’ll Do: 
 
 Develop expertise and understand data fundamentals, as well as various market and economic data from multiple vendors. 
 Familiarity with data alignment and cohesion supporting security instrument identification and linkage/flow through business functions and systems including trading, accounting, performance, and reporting. 
 Preferred familiarity with the data lifecycle within a quantitative asset manager preferred. 
 Determine, design, implement data processing metrics, validations, controls, monitoring and alerting. 
 Process improvements to our data infrastructure in support of our investment and research processes 
 Fulfill data and reporting requests received from other groups within the firm. 
 Work independently to learn the Acadian investment process lifecycle while also working with the Boston and Singapore Investment Analytics and Data teams to provide consistent and high-quality data management. 
 
 We’re Looking for Teammates With: 
 
 Bachelor’s or Postgraduate degree in a related field with minimum 3 years of related experience 
 Expertise with industry standard investment tools such as Bloomberg or Refinitiv 
 Prior data management, data analyst consulting experience preferred. 
 Strong analytical and communication skills 
 Experience with data modeling, data management process modeling, data profiling 
 Proficient with SQL in a Microsoft SQL Server environment preferred. 
 Solid data analysis and techniques using languages such as Python and Pandas (preferred) 
 Expertise with data management platforms such as Markit EDM, Informatica PowerCenter, or Ataccama preferred 
 A passion for enterprise data management and data quality controls / validation frameworks 
 
 Why Work Here: 
Acadian is a quantitative investment firm where ideas are empowered by technology. Our team is made up of a diverse mix of professionals who thrive in a culture that fosters ingenuity through collaboration and transparency. We offer a casual office environment, top-notch benefits, and excellent professional and personal development opportunities.

Title: Customer Data Insights Analyst - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
About Kraken 
Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cryptocurrency so that you and the rest of the world can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. In our first decade, Kraken has risen to become one of the largest, most successful and respected crypto exchanges on the planet. 
We are changing the way the world thinks about finance and our range of successful products are playing a critical role in the mainstream adoption of crypto assets. We continue to trail-blaze into new territory with the introduction of Kraken Bank, providing a more seamless integration between crypto and the traditional financial system. This makes us the first crypto company (ever) to be awarded a U.S. state banking charter. 
Our diverse group of 2,000+ Krakenites are distributed all over the world as part of our 'remote first' culture, united by a shared passion for delighting customers, upholding crypto values and achieving our meaningful mission. We attract people who push themselves to improve, are radically transparent and think differently in order to unlock their potential. 
Crypto is a rapidly evolving industry and we’re just getting started. We’re growing fast and you're invited to join the revolution! 
About the Role 
Kraken is a market leader in one of today’s most innovative and rapidly growing industries. In our mission to accelerate the global adoption of cryptocurrencies, we understand that crypto isn’t straightforward for most people yet. This is where our support platforms play a key role - guiding users in their crypto journey and providing them with the right information every step of the journey. 
As our user base grows alongside our range of service offerings, our end-to-end client experience plays an increasingly important role in not only making our platform more accessible to clients, but in making the entire crypto space more accessible. We are therefore seeking an experienced web analyst to join our Client Engagement Operations team. 
The ideal candidate will have a deep working knowledge of digital and web analytics, and be able to employ various analytical and statistical tools for evaluating trends and measuring performance against qualitative and quantitative objectives. 
 Responsibilities
 Generating data-driven insights to improve the customer experience by reducing friction and improving positive outcomes.
 Partnering with our Data team to extract data across various systems (digital platforms, CRM databases, etc.), evaluating and measuring key elements of the customer journey, and identifying trends and opportunities for improvement across the entire customer journey.
 Developing and driving a deep understanding of our customer journeys through research and analysis using Google Analytics, Data Studio, Mixpanel, and other web and business analytics tools.
 Creating impact in the organization by supporting efforts around customer research and analytics, and applying knowledge of experience strategy principles, customer research, robust data analytics and customer experience modeling. 
Partnering closely with stakeholders from Product, Design, Reporting and other teams to drive improvements in the user experience across Client Engagement channels.
 Requirements
 Bachelor's Degree or related academic/professional background (Degree in Social or Behavioral Science, Market Research, Statistics or a related subject area). Master's Degree is a strong plus. 
2+ years’ experience in the field of web analytics, Customer Experience and/or Customer Insights & Analytics. 
Familiarity with a range of customer research methods used to collect qualitative and quantitative data. 
Experience with Human Centered Design principles, journey mapping and client journey analytics. 
Strong written and presentation skills including the ability to break down sophisticated data into ‘big picture’ themes. 
Strong analytical, problem-solving and project management skills. 
Ability to influence large, diverse groups through fact-based analysis and decision-making. 
Ability to work under deadlines and deliver results, to think innovatively, creatively and strategically, to multitask and change course if necessary, to achieve desired results.
 Proficiency in visual display of data. 
 Location Tagging: #US #EU #APAC #LI-Remote #LI-RK1 
We’re powered by people from around the world with their own unique and diverse experiences. We value all Krakenites and their talents, contributions, and perspectives, regardless of their background. 
As an equal opportunity employer we don’t tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind. Whether that’s based on race, ethnicity, age, gender identity, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Data Analyst - Washington, DC 20007 - Indeed.com
Description:
U.S. News & World Report is a multifaceted digital media company dedicated to helping citizens, consumers, business leaders and policy officials make important decisions in their lives. We publish independent reporting, rankings, data journalism and advice that has earned the trust of our readers and users for nearly 90 years. Our platforms on usnews.com include Education, Health, Money, Travel, Cars, News and 360 Reviews. 
 We reach more than 40 million people monthly during moments when they are most in need of expert advice and motivated to act on that advice directly on our platforms. Our signature franchises include our “Best” series of consumer guides on colleges, graduate schools, hospitals, diets, cars, financial services and more. These guides provide an easy-to-digest list for consumers to better understand and compare when making their decisions. We continue to publish annual guides of the authoritative Best Colleges and Best Hospitals rankings on our website and in print. And our U.S. News Live flagship conferences highlight important national conversations including Healthcare of Tomorrow and Healthiest Communities. 
 Your role in helping us shape the future: 
 U.S. News empowers everyone to thrive. In this position you will have the opportunity to leverage your strengths and skills toward producing the company’s graduate school, college and K-12 rankings. One week you may help recode elements of the ranking algorithms; another week you may be performing quality assurance on statistical data collected. You will be working on a small team and very quickly will be involved in the facets of the rankings - from research and analysis through reporting data and testing the website. 
 Are you up to the challenge? 
 You have an evaluative, analytical mindset which you can employ to solve methodology challenges. 
 Possess a keen eye for detail and sharp critical thinking skills for conducting quality assurance of datasets. 
 Are proficient cleaning, merging and manipulating messy, disparate files. 
 
 You should definitely have: 
 Experience coding with statistical software packages, preferably STATA. 
 Ability to query databases using SQL statements. 
 It would be nice if you had: 
 Demonstrated familiarity with higher education and/or K-12 datasets. 
 Career or academic experience in any of the following: survey research, regression analysis, project management, explaining technical information to non-technical audiences. 
 What it’s like to work with us: 
 Talent is our best asset! 
 We invest in people with passion and potential who understand U.S. News’ dedication to our consumers. 
 Entrepreneurial, mission-driven culture with core values of quality and integrity 
 Focus on fostering personal and professional growth 
 Competitive benefits including paid vacation time, medical, tuition reimbursement, and training 
 Collaborative Work Environment ~ Fun, diverse, inclusive and ambitious co-workers

Description:
Description:
 
PerfectHealth is looking for a resourceful, detail oriented and efficient healthcare Data Analyst which will be responsible to gather and analyze healthcare data from multiple sources (e.g. insurance processing, clinical operations, patient behavior) to extract trends and business insights. To succeed in this role, you should be analytical and resourceful. You should also be an excellent communicator who’s able to tell the story behind raw data to non-technical audiences. Your goal will be to help us operate through data driven decisions and streamline our processes to keep patients and employees satisfied. 
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Understand health care operations and systems Create and validate record-keeping processes Pull and integrate data from disparate sources (e.g. cost and claims, clinical data, UM & CM data) Evaluate and preprocess raw information Delve into data to discover discrepancies and patterns Build models that capture a wide range of health care operations Present and explain information in an accessible way (e.g budgeting reports) Suggest ways to both increase healthcare quality and reduce costs (e.g. money spent in R&D) Collaborate with management and internal teams to implement and evaluate improvements 
. Requirements:
 Proven experience as a Healthcare Data Analyst Experience in data analysis and visualization methods Understanding of healthcare procedures Knowledge of Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) frameworks Proficient in SQL and analysis tools (e.g. SAS) Knowledge of Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) and data management systems Excellent analytical and communication skills Outstanding organizational and problem-solving aptitude BSc/BA in Health Informatics, Statistics, Mathematics or a related field 
COMPETENCIES Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities. Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment. Good written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills. Ability to present ideas in business-friendly and user-friendly language. Highly self-motivated and directed. Keen attention to detail. Team-oriented and skilled in working within a collaborative environment. 
This is a remote position which may be performed anywhere in the United States except for within the State of Colorado. 
 We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status. 
ConcertoCare is an Alcohol/Drug/Smoke-Free Workplace 
 
 We offer a competitive salary, great health and wellness benefits, 401k, and generous paid time off. 
 For more information, please submit your interest to us by including your resume and salary requirements

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Redwood City, CA 94065 - Indeed.com
Description:
Location:  Redwood City , CA | Open to remote work in most US States
 
Capital Games is a mobile game studio located in Sacramento, CA. We are home to Star Wars: Galaxy of Heroes, the most successful Star Wars mobile game ever released, charting as the #1 grossing game in over 35 countries, and one of the Top 40 grossing games in the entire world across Apple and Google.
 
We are looking for a Data Analyst on a new, unannounced project. As an analyst, you will guide game design, product management, and studio leadership through decision making with your actionable insights surfaced along all stages of the player journey.
 
Responsibilities
 
Manipulate, analyze, and tell a story from large amounts of complex data using different tools and data analysis techniques
 Define, measure, and monitor KPIs, with a focus on experimentation and incremental improvements to early player experiences
 Develop, validate, and fine-tune telemetry events
 Assist engineering groups in debugging data discrepancies
 Regularly present findings on player insights and any new trends in game health
 Construct dashboards and tools that enable non-analysts to explore data on their own
 Work hand-in-hand with designers, product managers, and producers to ensure business decisions are being made with accurate and up-to-date information
 
Qualifications
 
4+ years of work experience in past analytical roles
 Bachelor’s degree in math or sciences (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering)
 Expert SQL skills with experience querying large, complex data sets
 Experience building data aggregations and ETLs
 Experience creating interactive dashboards and easily-understood data visualizations using software (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Looker)
 Understanding of how to best structure and validate A/B tests and experiments
 Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple customers and competing priorities
 Comfortable presenting findings to an array of audiences, including senior management and non-technical disciplines
 
Bonuses
 
Experience with live service or mobile games
 Experience working on at least one product in pre-production
 Experience with statistical toolkits, such as Python or R
 Experience using Google Cloud Platform data tools (e.g. Composer, Airflow)
 Experience building out and mapping telemetry from the ground up
 Experience constructing forecast models

Title: Automated Data Analyst - Controlling - Vance, AL - Indeed.com
Description:
Overview:
 
Bertrandt - your trustworthy engineering partner 
Looking for a career, not just a job? Want to join a dynamic team working for an international industry leader? Enjoy an energetic work atmosphere? Bertrandt US may be just what you have been looking for! The Bertrandt Group has been providing development solutions for the international automotive and aviation industries in Europe, China and the USA for more than 40 years. A total of around 13,000 employees at 53 locations guarantee extensive know-how, sustainable project solutions and a high level of customer orientation. Its main customers include the major manufacturers and numerous system suppliers. 
Quality Position at a world-class automotive OEM. Under general supervision, this position will act as the Hyperion system administrator, as well as the CXO & Power-BI system administrator. The position will be responsible for performing general analytics on existing data sets in various areas of the business, as well as gathering and analyzing data requirements, performing analysis on different databases, and performing cost-controlling tasks. 
This position offers a competative hourly rate of $30 - $40/hr 
Responsibilities:
 Design and implementation of calculation scripts that are used to forecast all costs as well as the transitions between different planning’s 
Performance improvement through optimizing database structures (e.g. removing unnecessary cube elements, and optimizing calculation scripts) 
Design database applications such as interfaces & data transfer mechanisms to enable efficient access to the database. 
Analysis and optimization of the data base to increase time efficiency in run time, and diminished application and server issues 
Set up of planning layouts for different planning’s (e.g. Strategic planning [FTR] or mid term planning [EA's & OP]), and create and lock planning versions 
Trouble shooting and maintenance activities 
Conduct user trainings 
Identification of areas to increase efficiency and automation of data analysis processes. 
Responsible for performing general analytics on existing data sets in various areas of the business (e.g. MO/SUV, Supply Chain, FunCo areas, MP, GSP etc.). 
Examines and identifies data patterns and trends to help answer business questions and improve decision-making. 
Responsible for gathering and analyzing data requirements, and developing logical and physical databases and data models. Further development of databases to address business requirements, ensuring system scalability, performance and reliability. 
Analysis of different databases (e.g. Hyperion, cbFC, NACOS-BI, PeopleSoft, Kronos, HReData) and calculation variables to ensure data congruency and to improve data accuracy and planning results.. 
Qualifications:
 Bachelor Degree in the field of Business Administration, Finance, Information Technology or related area or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 
A minimum of five (3) years' of relevant professional experience in the following area: 
Data analysis, systems programming, development of interfaces between multiple systems, cost controlling, or other related area of experience. 
Proficient in Java, visual basic, and other Computer Science Languages 
Proficient in forecasting, administering, and reporting functions of controlling 
Proficient in system administration in Hyperion, TM1, SAP, CXO, & Blue Prism 
In-depth knowledge and expertise of database technologies, along with solid programming, design and system analysis skills. 
Very strong analytical skills, particularly in strategic business and financial analysis. 
Highly proficient in Excel. 
Ability to communicate and network well at all levels in support of functional area goals. 
Ability to orchestrate and lead projects and to organize and lead meetings to next steps and conclusions 
Preferred Skills: 
Proficient PowerPoint and ThinkCell. 
Meeting organization and facilitation abilities. 
 Benefits: 
Complete and comprehensive benefits package including Med/Dent/Vision 
Employer paid STD/LTD/Life 
401k Retirement program 
Generous paid vacation/sick/holidays 
Creativity encouraged in a fun, friendly work environment

Knowledge of SQL. 
Comfortable interacting and working with offshore team. 
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment. 
Knowledge of Python is a great plus.

Title: Data Research Analyst (Health and Wellness) - Remote - Indeed.com
Description: Data Research Analyst (Health and Wellness) Envision2bWell Inc is a mission-driven health & wellness technology startup. Our digital platform empowers companies to engage their workforce and consumers to engage in their health to move beyond the scale for 360° Wellness and a healthy lifestyle. Our proprietary workplace and consumer wellness assessments offer companies and individuals a roadmap to better health and well-being. When working with Envision2bWell, you will work with a small but mighty passionate team on a mission to bring Social Health Empowerment to the masses. Job Description:  Are you excited to use data to tell a story and have experience in survey research, data and evaluation? Been waiting for something different to show up in the flood of job descriptions that tap into more than just a job for you? Envision2bWell is seeking a Health and Wellness Data Analyst experienced utilizing Power BI and other survey tools to model datasets and develop interactive reports. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. The Data Analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. Data analysts will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements. As a health and wellness health analyst with Envision2bWell, you will get to use your skills in an unlimited capacity in an intrapreneurial environment. In addition to being an excellent written and verbal communicator, the ideal candidate will be resourceful and highly creative in an analytical mindset. To succeed in this role, a solid understanding of survey creation, data collection and reporting is key. A background in public health, including an understanding of the social determinants of health is crucial to interpreting and analyzing our data. Responsibilities:  Design and plan a variety of internal/external assessments and surveys using established procedures and practices Research and analyze data from surveys to identify patterns and stories Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems Locate and define new process improvement opportunities Prepare and organize survey results presentations, and reports. Develop and implement research design, inclusive of methodology and appropriate statistical methods for analyzing data on assigned projects Review data runs, suggests and pursues additional analyses as appropriate, and provide overall quality assurance Creates presentations and write reports for internal and external clients Work with management to prioritize business and information needs Maintain up-to-date knowledge and expertise with traditional and new research methods, analytic techniques, and technologies Utilize SPSS software to write programs and creates syntax to implement agreed-upon research design and methodology An understanding of various primary research survey tools (SurveyGizmo, Alchemer, Survey Monkey, Qualtrics, etc.) Skills:  Bachelor’s degree required. Public health preferred. Master’s degree a plus Demonstrated expertise in survey research methodology, sampling, designing questionnaires, data analysis, and report preparation Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy At least two years of prior experience in manipulating and interpreting data using data analysis techniques (queries, drills, sorting, formulas) Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks) Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc) Experience with statistical analysis concepts Strong organizational and communication skills Excellent oral and written communication skills Ability to manage projects simultaneously and under pressure of deadlines Superior attention to detail, accuracy and follow-through Experience in using survey software (i.e., Qualtrics or Survey Monkey). Ability to work with minimal supervision. Envision2bWell is a startup that is disrupting the health and wellness space. We need like-minded individuals who want to make a difference in the world as we seek to leave a legacy of achieving Social Health Empowerment for the masses. Visit us at www.envision2bwell.io to find our more while considering whether to apply. Applications without answers to our questions will NOT be considered. Acceptance for everyone, everywhere is at the heart of Envision2bWell Inc. We promote diversity of thought, culture and background, which connects the entire Envision2bWell family. At Envision2bWell, we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship, or other characteristics protected by state or federal law or local ordinance. Job Types: Full-time, Part-time Benefits: Dental insurance Flexible schedule Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Professional development assistance Retirement plan Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus pay Application Question(s): What makes you a good candidate for this role that would get our attention? What's your story? Experience: Data Analytics: 3 years (Required) Work Location: Remote

Title: Assistant Data Scientist Analyst - Houston, TX 77040 - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Summary 
Uses data to help develop new products or other data driven product enhancements across insurance as part of our Enhance Product Innovation Collaboration (EPIC) team. Interacts with a diverse set of stakeholders using modern statistical techniques and creativity to identify novel analytical directions. Familiarity with concepts such as predictive analysis, cloud computing, machine learning, artificial intelligence, & Bayesian analysis

Excellent communication skills including the ability to identify and communicate data driven insights 
Prior consulting experience preferred 
Possess and have ability to apply knowledge of principles, practices, and procedures 
Advanced organizational and analytical skills; demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously 
Knowledgeable of industry changes, legal updates, and technical developments related to applicable area of the Company’s business to proactively respond to changing business environment

Title: Analyst- Personalization Athlete Data (REMOTE) - Pittsburgh, PA - Indeed.com
Description:
The Analyst - Personalization Athlete Data is a part of the Marketing Capabilities and Personalization team and will play an integral role in both expanding data capabilities within existing programs and identifying new ways for DICKS to connect with our Athletes. This role will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy of athlete data across various systems by developing, maintaining, and validating data quality standards and metrics to support personalization efforts. This role will also utilize data to drive decision making within digital marketing and particularly assist in the interpretation and application of new tools and data sets to drive optimization and personalization strategy. As a subject matter expert, the analyst will be responsible to maintain and disseminate knowledge of our available Athlete data and how it can be used for personalization. 
 Assist in establishing data architecture design in partnership with technology and data compliance teams for new and evolving data sources with a passion for digging into complex logic and finding inconsistencies. 
 Assist in development of architecture design for system integrations, ingestion of new 1st party datasets, and data ETL processes, both internally and with external business partners. 
 Work with Technology to enhance data capabilities and ensure data integrity through validation. 
 Serve as primary contact for validation of any tech code changes to customer data and system enhancements to confirm expectations and requirements are met through data validation and QA. 
 Partner with marketing systems team and external vendors to ensure data accurately flows into all marketing systems. 
 Simultaneously participate in multiple, high priority analytics projects that are often at varying stages of maturity 
 Build strong data visualizations that are intuitive and informative to communicate insights in a way that builds confidence and enables data driven decisions to drive business value. 
 Support campaign data governance, troubleshoot data, and understand data flows and transformations. 
 Act as an advisor to guide CRM Targeting in structuring data queries correctly to answer business questions and conduct analysis based on a strong knowledge of our customer data model and business logic rules. 
 Maintain a deep understanding of the structure and location of various data sources to be utilized 
 Partner with the analytics team to support reporting and measurement of the incremental value driven by personalization tests and mature programs. 
 Aid in design, measurement, evaluation and recommendations of testing with the goal of quantifying incremental value of personalized campaigns. 
 Centralize an inventory of incremental value we are driving through personalization via tests results and KPIs of fully mature personalized programs. 
 Review relevant data sets and analyses to develop detailed and informed insights and implications to inform strategy and decisions. 
 Organize insights, data and visualizations into comprehensive stories for distribution to leadership partners in support internal business decisions. 
 Help to articulate the value of personalization and bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise. 
 
 Qualifications 
 Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business, Technology or related field 
 3 - 5 Years

Prepare documentations and specifications. Build interfaces between the business intelligence systems and other college information systems to maintain a timely and accurate integration of data. Collaborate and work with data analysts in various departments to ensure that data meets their reporting and analysis needs. Provide technical guidance for design and implementation of data governance systems and policy. Work extensively towards SQL Server development in writing core TSQL scripts to implement complex business logics. Develop SSIS packages to implement complex ETL strategies as a part of business requirements for population of dimensional data structures. Work on creating SSAS cubes and various cube objects such as KPIs (Key Performance Indicators), calculated members, attributes hierarchies and perspectives. Design eye-catching reports with data from OLTP database, dimensional data structure and OLAP cubes for business reporting purposes. Keep abreast of new business intelligence technologies Qualifications BS or MS of degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or related field is required At least 1 year of experience using Microsoft SQL Server Database, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS is required Experience with other relational databases, BI reporting and data discovery tools is preferred Job Types: Full-time, Contract Salary: $60,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year Work Location: One location Benefits: Health insurance Dental insurance Vision insurance Relocation assistance Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Data Analyst - Dayton, OH 45433 - Indeed.com
Description: 1.2.1 The contractor employee shall assist in designing, formulating, conducting, and leading data analysis of operational studies on health surveillance data/health records/other relevant military records and risk reduction of negative health outcomes affecting the USAF total force population. The contractor employee shall use judgement and originality in developing innovative approaches to define and resolve highly complex situations. 1.2.2 The contractor employee shall assist in the management of the retrieval and integration of health information data, personnel records, deployment-related records, health surveillance registries, and other military-related data into useable format for end-users. 1.2.3 The contractor employee shall assist in data collection in support of USAFSAM/FESO’s mission. 1.2.4 The contractor employee shall draft reports, prepare, and/or present reports, documents, and/or presentations pertaining to the status of the research and data analysis as requested, and meet FESO projected suspense’s. 1.2.5 The contractor employee shall present results of studies or investigations through briefings, technical reports, and publication into scientific journals. 1.2.6 The contractor employee shall apply knowledge of science/technology to analyze and resolve multifaceted issues/problems with minimal guidance, and collaborate with technical area stakeholders to develop strategies for effective execution within a particular technology area. 1.2.7 The contractor employee shall assist in teaching the data analytics section of the Operational Support Team (OST) course. 1.2.8 The contractor employee shall provide consultation support to OST assigned at base level. 1.2.9 The contract employee shall interface with USAFSAM/FESO leadership and staff. Title: Customer Data Insights Analyst - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
About Kraken 
Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cryptocurrency so that you and the rest of the world can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. In our first decade, Kraken has risen to become one of the largest, most successful and respected crypto exchanges on the planet. 
We are changing the way the world thinks about finance and our range of successful products are playing a critical role in the mainstream adoption of crypto assets. We continue to trail-blaze into new territory with the introduction of Kraken Bank, providing a more seamless integration between crypto and the traditional financial system. This makes us the first crypto company (ever) to be awarded a U.S. state banking charter. 
Our diverse group of 2,000+ Krakenites are distributed all over the world as part of our 'remote first' culture, united by a shared passion for delighting customers, upholding crypto values and achieving our meaningful mission. We attract people who push themselves to improve, are radically transparent and think differently in order to unlock their potential. 
Crypto is a rapidly evolving industry and we’re just getting started. We’re growing fast and you're invited to join the revolution! 
About the Role 
Kraken is a market leader in one of today’s most innovative and rapidly growing industries. In our mission to accelerate the global adoption of cryptocurrencies, we understand that crypto isn’t straightforward for most people yet. This is where our support platforms play a key role - guiding users in their crypto journey and providing them with the right information every step of the journey. 
As our user base grows alongside our range of service offerings, our end-to-end client experience plays an increasingly important role in not only making our platform more accessible to clients, but in making the entire crypto space more accessible. We are therefore seeking an experienced web analyst to join our Client Engagement Operations team. 
The ideal candidate will have a deep working knowledge of digital and web analytics, and be able to employ various analytical and statistical tools for evaluating trends and measuring performance against qualitative and quantitative objectives. 
 Responsibilities
 Generating data-driven insights to improve the customer experience by reducing friction and improving positive outcomes.
 Partnering with our Data team to extract data across various systems (digital platforms, CRM databases, etc.), evaluating and measuring key elements of the customer journey, and identifying trends and opportunities for improvement across the entire customer journey.
 Developing and driving a deep understanding of our customer journeys through research and analysis using Google Analytics, Data Studio, Mixpanel, and other web and business analytics tools.
 Creating impact in the organization by supporting efforts around customer research and analytics, and applying knowledge of experience strategy principles, customer research, robust data analytics and customer experience modeling. 
Partnering closely with stakeholders from Product, Design, Reporting and other teams to drive improvements in the user experience across Client Engagement channels.
 Requirements
 Bachelor's Degree or related academic/professional background (Degree in Social or Behavioral Science, Market Research, Statistics or a related subject area). Master's Degree is a strong plus. 
2+ years’ experience in the field of web analytics, Customer Experience and/or Customer Insights & Analytics. 
Familiarity with a range of customer research methods used to collect qualitative and quantitative data. 
Experience with Human Centered Design principles, journey mapping and client journey analytics. 
Strong written and presentation skills including the ability to break down sophisticated data into ‘big picture’ themes. 
Strong analytical, problem-solving and project management skills. 
Ability to influence large, diverse groups through fact-based analysis and decision-making. 
Ability to work under deadlines and deliver results, to think innovatively, creatively and strategically, to multitask and change course if necessary, to achieve desired results.
 Proficiency in visual display of data. 
 Location Tagging: #US #EU #APAC #LI-Remote #LI-RK1 
We’re powered by people from around the world with their own unique and diverse experiences. We value all Krakenites and their talents, contributions, and perspectives, regardless of their background. 
As an equal opportunity employer we don’t tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind. Whether that’s based on race, ethnicity, age, gender identity, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Data Governance Analyst (100% Remote) - Home, KS - Indeed.com
Description: Our Analytic Center of Excellence (ACOE) is seeking a Data Governance leader who will have a direct impact on moving our entire organization toward a data-driven culture. As a liaison to business and technology teams across the organization, this individual will collect and align policies, standards, and procedures to further enable data governance capabilities. If selected, you will help structure and manage an Enterprise Business Glossary and Data Catalog that serves as a central control for our Business, Data, and Technical Assets. You will be providing thought leadership to advance innovative and automated solutions to managing the life cycle and lineage of data assets while improving data quality across the organization. Role Facilitate and collaborate with data stewards to define enterprise business terms and assist with bringing resolution to data quality concerns and issues. Work directly with business partners to establish enterprise business data domains, ownership, and stewardship. Partner with both the business and technical SMEs to establish relationships between business assets, such as business terms, and data or technical assets, such as policy and reports, and assist with the documentation of data movement and data lineage of enterprise data assets. Establish procedures to document and curate data assets, including classifying mastered and reference data, identifying the authoritative source, and what and where sensitive data resides. Facilitate and document data ownership roles, including elements, definitions, transformations, calculations, etc. to the appropriate functional Data Steward(s), ensuring all key participants are granted appropriate input rights Lead analysis, development, and build of an Enterprise Data Catalog that addresses data lineage in support of privacy, security, regulatory, legal, and audit initiatives. Drive adoption of data ownership, data stewardship, and data governance processes across the organization. Collaborate with data stewards, data owners, and data consumers to establish best practices, processes, and procedures in support of our Enterprise Business Glossary and Data Catalog. Mentor and coach junior analysts on data governance disciplines and best practices. Establish KPIs, metrics, and measurements to monitor data quality and data governance maturity. Drive organizational adoption of ERwin data governance tool suite by providing user documentation, training, and demos to ensure proper usage and adherence to processes and procedures. Partner with Erwin tool suite vendor on product’s functionality to maximize our usage of the capabilities within the product. Qualified candidates need an advanced knowledge of Data Architecture, Data Modeling, Data Warehousing, and Business Intelligence concepts as it relates to Master Data Management & Data Governance. Expertise needs to include Developing and implementing data governance platforms (i.e. ERwin, Collibra, Informatica, etc.). Data governance frameworks and principles including master and reference data management. Development and management of data policy, process workflows, and procedural documentation, Data analysis, data modeling, data mapping, and profiling. A strong understanding of identifying and classifying data assets. Experience and knowledge of privacy and regulatory laws related to data privacy and protection. Prefer Understanding and familiarity with healthcare insurance data. Undergrad/Graduate Degree in Healthcare, Management Information Systems, Computer Science or related field. Details Total Comp $120,000 - $125,000 $25,000 - $35,000 in 401k contribution over three years. Affordable health premiums. 100% Remote position. Unless a medical or religious exemption is approved must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. US Citizen / Permanent Resident authorization required. Job Type: Full-time
