Title: Automotive Business Analyst - Herndon, VA - Indeed.com
Description: The Business Analyst will work within the Retail Buying Experience (RBE) Department in Herndon, VA. This newly formed department is responsible for working in close collaboration with our headquarters, regional field teams, and dealer partners to transform traditional retail sales tools and processes into a more progressive buying experience for our customers. The RBE Business Analyst will be responsible for preparing requirements, specifications, business processes, and recommendations for Audi of America's Tier 3 digital partners, which provide digital software and hardware tools to the Audi dealer network. These digital tools are intended to: improve the retail customer experience to be more transparent; create efficiencies for dealers; improve profitability; and ultimately, increase customer retention. The individual in this role will also: gather and synthesize functional & non-functional business requirements; execute gap analyses between business requirements & best practices; and develop business cases for bringing new tools and technologies to the customer experience. The RBE Business Analyst will provide reporting and analyses to support strategic decisions and process improvements. Business Analyst responsibilities include: Evaluate tools currently used by dealer network to identify areas of improvement, working with Tier 3 vendors to develop and implement tool enhancements. Identify future tools & technologies that would benefit the dealer network in providing an omnichannel retail buying experience. Review current processes for capturing lead information from Tier 3 tools and identify opportunities for more effective and efficient data management. Assist in redesign of existing data management processes, while establishing a long-term strategy for reporting ownership within Tableau & Sales Force. Develop new benchmark processes for digital retail data management and omnichannel sales process reporting to evaluate both dealer performance and tool performance. Align with AoA Field and all internal stake holders on analytics and reporting needs, ensuring high adoption and enthusiasm for all reporting tools. Provide Audi internal stakeholders, field personnel, dealers and vendor partners with analytics and reporting needed to improve the overall buying experience. Maintain and update content on the RBE Field & Dealer Portal (audimodernretail.com) and xAudi (internal extranet). Relentlessly review the output of our Lead Management Dashboard (Audi Lead Intelligence), measuring quality and identifying solutions to data deficiencies. Analyze & evaluate the 3rd Party Lead Program by provider on a monthly basis to make recommendations for where Audi of America should focus on acquiring more or less leads to increase sales rates. Manage 3rd Party Lead opt-outs and monthly lead caps set by dealers, along with 3rd Party Lead billing by dealer. Provide other dealer billing budget support, on as needed basis. Manage overall RBE annual budget for internal team, and RBE field training team. Support implementation of an Audi of America Partner Program Job Types: Full-time, Contract Pay: $20.00 - $40.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Experience: SQL: 1 year (Preferred) Tableau: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location

Title: Operations Analyst - Jersey City, NJ 07310 - Indeed.com
Description: OPERATIONS ANALYST  Location  Jersey City, NJ Job Type  Full time Non-exempt (40 hours/week); PTO and benefits Pay Rate  Hourly rate $20.00 - $22.00 per hour About Drive  Drive Engineering is a leading DBE/MBE provider of Transportation Operations, Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS), Traffic Engineering, Systems, and Planning consulting services in the Mid-Atlantic region. Our staff is highly experienced in managing the entire project life cycle from early planning through completion, including PS&E development and construction design services for both design-bid-build and design-build projects. Job Description  Drive Engineering is currently seeking qualified candidates to work as Operations Analysts at a transportation operations facility at our client site in Jersey City, New Jersey. The Operations Analysts will work in rotating shifts to support a 365-day environment and provide 24/7 coverage. The job responsibilities are as follows: The Analysts are responsible for gathering and analyzing information on real-time conditions on the NY/NJ/CT regional transportation network and the northeast corridor. This information is obtained from a wide range of sources, including transportation agency contacts, police/local agency contacts, scanners, and Intelligent Transportation Systems implemented in the operations center. The Analysts confirm the information with the operator of the facility involved, evaluate the significance of the incident and its effect on various agencies, distribute the information to the affected agencies, and provide follow-up support and information to all agencies. The Analysts are responsible for identifying ways for agencies to notify the public of transportation-related problems by facilitating the sharing of resources such as highway advisory radio (HAR) or Variable Message Signs (VMS) among the agencies. The Analysts will monitor and operate the client’s Intelligent Transportation Systems (including but not limited to Closed-Circuit Television, travel time data, HAR, VMS, and TREX, the system for data entry) to rapidly obtain information on the regional transportation network, distinguish false alarms from actual incidents, ensure that the appropriate operating and police agencies are notified, and provide accurate and timely information to the agencies. The Analysts are responsible for maintaining accurate logs of all actions taken related to their functions during their shifts. The Analysts are also responsible for identifying, and performing preliminary troubleshooting of mechanical, electrical, or system problems that may cause false alarms or missed incidents, or otherwise render the systems ineffective. Minimum Qualifications  High school diploma or GED Ability to read/comprehend/understand maps (GIS/GPS) Knowledge of the transportation networks - Ability to identify most major bridges/tunnels & interstates throughout the NY/NJ/CT region. - General familiarity with transit systems (major transit hubs as well as associated lines/branches for the various commuter rail lines. Ability to analyze data (graphs, trends, information on maps, charts, etc.) Computer skills (proficient in Microsoft Word with working knowledge of other products including Excel, PowerPoint). Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment and work in high pressure situations. Excellent written and verbal communication skills Self-starter Valid Driver’s License Ability to work independently and as part of a team Understand concept of a 24/7/365 workplace - Rotating shifts - Potential for mandatory overtime - Work holidays - Work weekends - Work extended shifts (12 hours) Preferred Qualifications  Familiarity with traveler information systems (511, travel time information, speed data) Prior experience in a traffic operations center Familiarity with transportation jargon (ITS, ICM, Connected Vehicle systems) Strong knowledge of NY/NJ/CT roadways, bridges and tunnels Monitoring/understand broadcasts (TV, radio traffic reports, Police & Fire scanners) Familiarity with crowdsourcing. As a small and growing firm, Drive Engineering is committed to investing in the professional development of our staff. We are looking for key project staff members to work closely with public clients and prime contractors. The position is an opportunity to be in a cutting edge field within an expanding company. EEO/AA It is the policy of Drive Engineering Corp. to provide equal opportunity for qualified persons and not to discriminate against any applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. Drive Engineering Corp. is an affirmative action employer. If you require accommodation during the application process, please contact Human Resources at  215-367-5535 . Work Authorization  Drive Engineering participates in E-Verify. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is typically not available for entry level positions. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $20.00 - $22.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Employee assistance program Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Professional development assistance Retirement plan Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Weekend availability Education: High school or equivalent (Required) Work Location: One location

Title: SimCorp Dimension Senior Business Analyst - McLean, VA - Indeed.com
Description:
At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation.
 As part of Freddie Mac’s return to the office pilot, all employees, contingent workers and visitors must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to be on-site unless they have an approved accommodation. 
Position Overview: 
The Investment & Capital Markets (ICM) department in Finance is seeking a highly motivated hands-on Senior Business Analysis to join our SimCorp Application Support Team. In this role, the individual will support business as usual (BAU), change management, user access testing (UAT) and business management activities across ICM Finance. 
The ideal candidate will have at least 5 years experience using SimCorp Dimension (SCD) to identify and solve for challenges in both BAU and UAT. This position will involve partnering effectively with various business and IT stakeholders and will require solid communication skills, ability to build relationships and drive a consistent agenda. The ideal candidate is a "self-starter" with a desire to understand accounting concepts and a passion for change management. 
Apply now and learn more about our benefits and why there’s #MoreAtFreddieMac! 
Our Impact: 
Our team is responsible for supporting Freddie Mac’s accounting book of reference (ABOR) and investment book of records (IBOR) platform for Fixed Income, Exchange Traded and over the counter (OTC) Derivatives. Our goal is to collaborate with our key Stakeholders within the ICM Division to support their business requirements and help drive change throughout all aspects of the Front to Back Office trade lifecycle. 
Your Impact: 
Your Impact Falls into Three Primary Categories 
Application Support 
Manage SimCorp Dimension enhancements, break-fixes, and small projects in both BAU and UAT independently and as part of the team with internal and external stakeholders 
Demonstrate ownership of problems, issues, or requests from start to finish. Facilitate appropriate handoffs, but track the item through resolution. Escalate proposed or actual solutions that do not adequately resolve the problem or satisfy the stated need. 
Work independently while driving and managing assignments from concept through deployment/launch 
Project Management / Collaboration 
Interact and communicate effectively with business and IT partners to solve issues or business challenges 
Work with project teams and stakeholders to ensure that business requirements gaps or issues are resolved in a transparent and timely manner 
Work with different teams to identify opportunities for efficiency in project planning and execution to provide the business with solutions at the lowest cost while balancing risk appropriately 
Work with business partners to document and understand requirement needs and challenge the team to create inspiring solutions 
Be a liaison between the business area customer/user, testing groups and development groups to ensure that scope items for a release are accurately implemented and tested from the business perspective 
Analytics 
Leverage mortgage experience to ensure that functional requirements / use cases are fully developed, communicated and understood 
Solve complex business issues by putting pieces together and understanding how our systems work 
Strong SQL database querying skills a plus and 
Qualifications: 
Minimum 5 years of business analysis and SCD experience in the mortgage industry, with a strong understanding of Fixed Income products and Interest Rate Derivatives 
Understanding of SCD FAP/FAM configurations, Portfolio Calculation, and Message Queues 
Bachelors Degree or equivalent work experience; advanced studies/degree preferred 
Proven knowledge of strategic planning and execution, project management, and best practices implementation 
Experience in the primary/secondary mortgage market, preferably underwriting and/or credit analytics 
Ability to rapidly learn key business design concepts of given project being developed and internal project tools and project management methodology / related processes 
Ability to support multiple concurrent high priority projects in various capacities (i.e., lead one or more projects while supporting one or more projects) 
Ability to analyze, document, develop and manage complex business processes, think analytically and solve problems 
Ability to work collaboratively with key internal stakeholders, external customers, external stakeholders and matrixed teams 
Project management experience using standard project management tools; collecting, writing and maintaining business requirements; maintaining action item trackers, issue and risks logs; managing budgets and reporting and facilitation of effective project team meetings; ability to work as an influence 
Strong accounting background with general ledger/subledger expertise a plus 
SCD Data Warehouse experience a plus 
Keys to Success in this Role: 
Strong knowledge and expertise with SimCorp Dimension 
Strong verbal and written communication skills including the ability to develop and deliver presentations to multiple types of audiences and ability to interact cross-functionally and drive both business and technical discussions 
Self-starter / independent thinker: demonstrated ambition to take on new roles with increasing responsibility with limited guidance and direction from management 
Strong business analysis skills and experience with agile / waterfall methodologies 
Proven track record of driven, results-oriented, creative and nimble problem-solving capabilities and a willingness to do “whatever it takes” to deliver business value quickly 
Current Freddie Mac employees please apply through the internal career site. 
Today, Freddie Mac makes home possible for one in four home borrowers and is one of the largest sources of financing for multifamily housing. Join our smart, creative and dedicated team and you’ll do important work for the housing finance system and make a difference in the lives of others.

Title: Operations Research Analyst II (Data Scientist) - Annapolis Junction, MD 20701 - Indeed.com
Description:
Peraton Overview 
 
 Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the worlds leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted and highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies across the intelligence, space, cyber, defense, civilian, health, and state and local markets. Every day, our employees do the cant be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers. 
 
 Responsibilities 
 
 Job Description: 
Serves as Data Scientist (operations research analyst). Utilizes data science techniques, methods, and tools to evaluate, manipulate, analyze, and graphically represent Cyber Mission Force (CMF) readiness and manpower data. Researches, collects, and analyzes readiness data related to manpower, training, equipment, and retention from various sources to develop better understanding of cyberspace operations readiness assessments and support specifically related to CMF team composition, training and qualification standards, and manpower status. Contributes to uncovering and resolving issues associated with the development and implementation of operational programs. Interprets policies, procedures, standards, guidelines, and objectives and applies operations research principles and techniques to compound analytic needs. Applies data-mining techniques, statistical analysis, and builds high-quality prediction systems. Identifies issues and priorities affecting readiness of cyber teams, individual cyber work roles, and retention of the cyber work force. 
Requirements 
Selects features, builds and optimizes classifiers using machine learning techniques for the conduct of datamining to generate and maintain CMF readiness accountability metrics data 
Collects, develops, queries, maintains, visualizes and automates metrics to assess USCYBERCOM andCyber Mission Force readiness (i.e., readiness of deployable teams, personnel, and equipment), assists in thedevelopment of readiness and status updates, and ensures current readiness and training conditions areupdated within various readiness databases 
Exhibits a general degree of ingenuity, creativity, and resourcefulness during the conduct of research anddevelopment and preparation of documents, briefings, and analyses which may include narrative, tabular, andgraphic materials 
Analyzes, reports, and develops recommendations on data related to CMF readiness metrics 
Applies advanced technologies, scientific principles, theories, and concepts to assist organizations inadvancing CMF team readiness and performance 
Provide detailed assessment reports that represent data as useful information and ensure the analysispresents meaningful results to senior leaders 
Prepare critical readiness inputs to Department-level Joint force readiness reviews, and the Command's JointMission Essential Task List (JMETL) in the DRRS 
Assesses subordinate HQ readiness program development through readiness monitoring and employment ofmethodologies to assess readiness reporting to ensure compliance with USCYBERCOM and DoD directivesand requirements 
Collaborates with internal and external partners to facilitate CMF team readiness information sharing 
Contributes to uncovering and resolving issues associated with the development and implementation ofreadiness reporting programs 
Assists in identifying and prioritizing requirements for reaching and maintaining CMF readiness and manpowergoals 
Conducts ad-hoc analysis and present results in a clear, understandable manner 
Develops concept papers, technical white papers, and related documentation informing CMF readiness 
 Qualifications 
 
 Labor Category Qualifications (REQUIRED): 
Minimum 10 years of experience in data science (operations research analyst) 
Minimum of bachelors degree in data science (preferred), or operations research, computer science, cybersecurity, computer engineering, or related discipline 
Possess a general understanding of cyberspace doctrine, policies, operations, and organizations 
Experience in using query languages, with common data science toolkits, and using data visualization tools 
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills 
Excellent communications skills 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
Additional Capabilities Desired: 
Delivers innovative, flexible, integrated solutions to meet changing business needs 
Enhances data collection procedures to include information relevant for building analytic systems 
Assists in identifying and prioritizing requirements for capability development efforts 
Applies and/or develops technologies, scientific principles, theories, and concepts to assist organizations in advancing performance and operating more efficiently 
Develops cost-benefit analysis, data collection, data analysis, risk analysis, simulation model execution, economic analysis, and operational effectiveness studies 
Assists in addressing requirements and the evaluation of data assessment strategies: sampling, statistical analysis, evaluation, flow processing, and management assessment strategies 
Devises modeling and measuring techniques, and utilizes mathematics, statistical methods, engineering methods, operational mathematics techniques (linear programming, game theory, probability theory, symbolic language, etc.) and other principles and laws of scientific and economic disciplines to investigate complex issues, identify, and solve problems, and aid better decision making 
Assists in addressing requirements and the evaluation of data assessment strategies: sampling, statistical analysis, evaluation, flow processing, and management assessment strategies Substantively contributes to uncovering and resolving issues associated with the development and implementation of operational programs

 Career area
 Technology

 Full-time
 Ally and Your Career
 Ally Financial only succeeds when its people do - and that’s more than some cliché people put on job postings. We live this stuff! We see our people as, well, people - with interests, families, friends, dreams, and causes that are all important to them.  The Opportunity
 As a Senior Technology Analyst, you will be joining as a key member of the Technology External Workforce team that serves as the center of excellence for Ally’s key external technology staffing. You will play a critical role in driving continuous improvements to the program guided by KPIs and data-driven insights to ensure Ally Tech teams have the right people at the right time to deliver world-class technology capabilities for our customers. In this hands-on and multi-disciplinary role, you will apply your analytical and process improvement skills to further mature our program. This will require that you’re comfortable wrangling data, performing analysis, and creating visualizations in platforms such as PowerBI for broad consumption. While you’re savvy with data and analytics, what really sets you apart is your relentless focus on driving business outcomes and continuous growth mindset. To be successful in this role, you’ll collaborate well with cross-functional teams and serve internal stakeholders to achieve the desired outcomes
 The Work Itself
 Collect, process, and analyze data to derive insights and produce regular/adhoc reporting in a fast-paced environment 
Break down problems into capabilities, epics, and user stories to refine the backlog and plan the work going into Kanban board 
Work with internal customers to develop and understand business requirements 
Ensure effective systems are in place to house and access key information 
Deliver data to customer specifications and timelines 
Communicate regularly and effectively with team members and supervisor 
Provide high level of customer service to internal customers 
Establish and maintain good working relationships with external partners 
Facilitate satisfactory communication and resolution of problems 
 The Skills You Bring
 Required Qualifications: 
 Bachelor’s degree in Technology related field 
 2-3 years analyst experience, preferably in financial services
 Applied experience in one or more relational database management systems 
 Applied experience with Excel, PowerBI, and other MS tools 
 Desired Qualifications 
 Experience with Agile methodologies 
 Ability to analyze and document complex business processes 
 Ability to think analytically and solve complex problems
 Clear and effective written and verbal communication skills 
 How We'll Have Your Back
 Ally's compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and pay-for-performance incentives (bonuses) based on achieving personal and company goals. But Ally’s total compensation – or total rewards – extends beyond your paycheck and is designed to support and enrich your personal and professional life, including: 
Time Away:  competitive holiday and flexible paid-time-off, including time off for volunteering and voting. 
Planning for the Future:  plan for the near and long term with an industry-leading 401K retirement savings plan with matching and company contributions, student loan and 529 educational assistance programs, tuition reimbursement, and other financial well-being programs. 
Supporting your Health & Well-being:  flexible health and insurance options including dental and vision, pre-tax Health Savings Account with employer contributions and a total well-being program that helps you and your family stay on track physically, socially, emotionally, and financially. 
Building a Family:  adoption, surrogacy, and fertility support as well as parental and caregiver leave, back-up child and adult/elder day care program and childcare discounts. 
Work-Life Integration:  other benefits including LifeMatters® Employee Assistance Program, subsidized and discounted Weight Watchers® program and other employee discount programs. 
Who We Are: 
Ally Financial is a customer-centric, leading digital financial services company with passionate customer service and innovative financial solutions. We are relentlessly focused on "Doing it Right" and being a trusted financial-services provider to our consumer, commercial, and corporate customers. For more information, visit www.ally.com. 
Ally is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical or mental disabilities. For accommodation requests, email us at work@ally.com. Ally will not discriminate against any qualified individual who is capable of performing the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - IMMUTA - Fort Belvoir, VA - Indeed.com
Description:
Peraton Overview 
 
 Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the worlds leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted and highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies across the intelligence, space, cyber, defense, civilian, health, and state and local markets. Every day, our employees do the cant be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers. 
 
 Responsibilities
 
 Provides intelligence support for contingency operations, battle staff and operational-level planning, Joint and multi-lateral training exercises, and strategic engagement policy throughout the Areas of Operational Responsibility (AOR) and Areas of Interest (AOI). 
Monitors and analyzes all strategic and operational aspects of political, military, and economic developments for the countries in the AORs and AOIs. 
Assesses future and on-going political-military developments, military capabilities and doctrine, weapons acquisitions, and employment of military forces within each country. 
Researches, authors, and coordinates threat assessments to support the Commander and the other senior leadership as well. 
Connects pieces of information that is available from different sources like field agents and form reliable reports on anti-terrorism and national security to deal with potential threats. 
Assesses the believability of the information from the reliable sources, collects it and validates intelligence. 
May provide team leadership to other Analysts. 
Provides a full range of intelligence and administrative support to assist analysts, engineers, and scientists involved in a variety of intelligence disciplines and activities. 
Activities include, but are not limited to, building and maintaining databases; execute intelligence master data management; data architecture; monitor intelligence; assists with administration and management of RFIs; produces metrics;provides crossdomain data transfer and intelligence dissemination support, system-high to -low transfers between JWICS, SIPRNet, NIPRNet, and other U.S. and Allied / Partner systems. 
Produces metrics, graphics, and briefings as required to support production management and mission management functions. 
Current DoD TS/SCI Security Clearance with ability to obtain CI polygraph 
 Qualifications 
 
 4 years demonstrated experience leading a team and managing work tasks of subordinates conducting intelligence planning, collection, processing, analysis, or dissemination. demonstrated experience involving complex security classification decisions such as coalition/foreign partner support, foreign disclosure, intelligence dissemination, or crossdomain operations. demonstrated ability to deliver professional briefings and presentations to diverse audiences. demonstrated ability to draft and maintain documentation such as Standard Operating Procedures and ability to produce reports 
incorporating text and graphics to convey complex concepts. 
 demonstrated understanding of metadata. demonstrated ability to instruct and interact with small groups on data and information requirements and coordination tasks. 
Demonstrates in-depth knowledge and understanding of the labor category activities required to meet mission requirements. 
Demonstrates mastery of qualitative and quantitative analytic methodologies and pursue developments in academia or other fields that affect tradecraft methodology. Demonstrates ability to define comprehensive, new, or unique research approaches that enable rigorous assessments to address and contribute to high-level tasks. 
Demonstrates in-depth analysis of analytic operations and knowledge management issues across organizational and intra-IC boundaries and clearly articulates key findings. 
Demonstrates ability to work independently and with minimal oversight. 
Demonstrates ability to review analytic products for cogent arguments, tradecraft standards, and adequate support for conclusions; routinely tests analytic rigor of analytic products. 
Desired Experience: Minimum 12 years of experience related to the specific labor category with at least a portion of the experience within the last 2 years. 
Required Experience: 10 years demonstrated experience in an intelligence discipline working in the DoD or IC within the last 2 years. 
Advanced Experience using Microsoft SharePoint 2013+

 Job Description
 The Data & Analytics Lead will lead a team of data analysts within Consumer and Business Banking (CBB) Financial Crimes Control (FCC) Reporting and Analytics responsible for gathering and integrating large volumes of data focused on Anti-Money Laundering/Bank Secrecy Act/Know Your Customer, performing analysis, interpreting results and developing actionable insights to accelerate operational excellence, demonstrate compliance and mitigate risk.

 Develop insightful and compelling summary reporting and dashboards for management and business line partners.
 Provide executive level data and reporting.
 Ensure all data acquisition, sharing and results of applied recommendations are compliant with company standards and policies.
 Partner with various groups to improve data collection and integration.
 Create and maintain documented procedures for routine responsibilities.

 Basic Qualifications
 
 Bachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience
 10 or more years of applicable experience
 
Preferred Skills/Experience
 Staff supervisory experience highly preferred

 Excellent computer skills, including proven experience with Microsoft Office suite, Oracle, SQL, SAS, Hadoop, HQL, Presto, Superset and Tableau

 Experience in advanced analytics and statistics
 CAMS
 Experience supporting AML/BSA, Customer Due Diligence, economic sanctions/OFAC or other compliance related initiatives in a large, complex, highly regulated financial institution

 Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects and deadlines simultaneously
 Excellent presentation, interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills

Title: Risk Adjustment Analyst - Hempstead, NY - Indeed.com
Description:
Position Summary: 
The Risk Adjustment Analyst will support revenue program management activities around data management and submissions to CMS. Serve as a subject matter expert to management and stakeholders around end-to-end process of data management, data processing, data analysis and submissions. Interface with different business areas on the execution of data submissions, identifying and applying best practices and processes to ensure efficiency and accuracy of end-to-end operation of risk adjustment programs. Identify and recommend both strategic and tactical improvements, and contribute to compliance to all applicable laws, guidance, and regulations. Develop and sustain a long-term optimal structure and processes around emerging encounter data submission requirements; analyzing, monitoring, and planning key risk adjustment milestones and identifying and recommending opportunities for improvement.
 
Assist in designing an overall suite of analytic capabilities and actionable reports to solve problems, provide data-driven guidance, and monitor risk adjustment performance. Work closely with end-users to gather reporting requirements and analyze internal reporting tools; to ensure proper testing and validation of data elements on the finished product; to participate in the resolution of reporting problems; to build, perform, and maintain reporting analysis and modeling; to provide analytical support on various strategies to ensure organizational goals are met; to propose opportunities in maximizing reimbursement based on the CMS HCC model and the CRG model; to propose innovative approaches to create or improve automation and optimize processes data and analytic processes as well as reporting; and to lead cross-functional analytical and operational teams toward the goal of improved risk adjustment scores.
 
 Essential Position Functions/Responsibilities: Data Management & Submissions: 
 
 Partner with other business units to deliver requirements around necessary updates to underlying data and systems as used by the Risk Adjustment and Coding departments. 
 Recommend, develop, and monitor processes around data collection, submission, and reconciliation to ensure full compliance with all applicable laws, guidance, and regulations. Provide detailed reporting and oversight for data submission activities. Partner to develop dashboards to report progress with sponsors and escalate issues with key stakeholders. 
 Understand CMS risk score methodology, including risk score calculation, key regulator deadlines for data submission, understand eligibility, claims, and provider data. 
 Accurately monitor and reconcile submitted encounters against response files to ensure that submission gaps are addressed in a timely manner. Interface with Quality, Finance, IT, Provider, Claims, Business Intelligence, and other company teams to improve and correct data. 
 Analyze data flow and data integrity to identify areas for improvement in risk adjustment scores. 
 Complete routine quality assurance checks to ensure data accuracy and completeness and execute corrections as needed.

Title: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst (Remote Eligible) - Miami Lakes, FL 33016 - Indeed.com
Description:
JOB SUMMARY  The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for all aspects of data analysis, from meeting with stakeholders to define and gather requirements through the delivery of insightful and actionable analytics. The analyst is tasked with building/reporting of KPIs, dashboards, scorecards, statistical models, and ad hoc analytics to ensure that business processes are conducted in a controlled and efficient manner. Extraction, cleansing, and transformation of data are all necessary functions to aid the analyst in the maintenance of established reporting as well as in the creation of ad hoc analysis and special projects as requested by department managers within the Bank Operations Division. 
 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS 
 
 Production of dashboards, KPIs, scorecards, executive decks, and exception tracking reports on a routine basis. Must be quick at understanding various critical business processes and must be able to interpret data related to these processes to make decisions and root out data integrity issues. 
 Determine and create optimal graphical display for critical measures, producing graphics and dashboard formats to accurately and professionally convey process performance. 
 Develop streamlined and automated approaches for gathering and delivering data, thereby reducing manual business processes where possible. 
 Development of models to predict future volume and capacity needs. 
 Structuring of data to support drill down analyses on process performance. 
 Analyze reporting requirements, extract and interpret data, and ultimately provide recommendations to management. 
 Participate in project teams and provide guidance on relevant metrics to support production needs. 
 Lead special projects as assigned, working closely with IT to develop data structures when needed for reporting. 
 Work with subject matter experts to discover, define, assess, and document business needs and requirements. 
 Must possess the ability to clearly document reporting logic and processes for auditability. 
 Adheres to and complies with applicable, federal and state laws, regulations and guidance, including those related to anti-money laundering (i.e. Bank Secrecy Act, US PATRIOT Act, etc.). 
 Adheres to Bank policies and procedures and completes required training. 
 Identifies and reports suspicious activity. 
 
 QUALIFICATIONS 
 
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 
 
EDUCATION 
 
 Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration or related analytical field required (i.e. Management information systems, engineering, math/statistics, or computer science). 
 
 EXPERIENCE 
 
 5+ years in an analytical capacity in conjunction with the development/maintenance of a reporting library. 
 5+ years working closely with IT to develop robust reporting data structures within a data warehouse. 
 5+ years writing complex SQL queries (e.g., CTEs, correlated subqueries, complex aggregations...) 
 5+ years developing reports from a leading business intelligence platform such as SSRS, Business Objects, or OBIEE. 
 Extensive experience with visual dashboarding tool (Tableau is preferred but Qlik, Microstrategy, ThoughtSpot, PowerBI or similar tool will be considered). 
 2+ years of experience programming in Python or R required. 
 Advanced level of experience in Microsoft Excel. 
 Banking and/or financial services industry experience is a plus. 
 Experience reporting in a cloud environment is a plus, especially Amazon Web Services (AWS). 
 KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES 
 Knowledge of relational databases, such as SQL Server or Oracle is essential. 
 Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills are essential. 
 Knowledge and/or experience in predictive modeling and machine learning. 
 Capability of effectively documenting code and reporting processes. 
 Exceptional written and verbal communication skills - ability to disseminate information clearly to all levels of the organization. 
 Ability to design and translate complex data requirements to partners within the Information Technology group (database/ETL teams). 
 Elicit requirements from clients: Learn business quickly to gain a deeper understanding of key business drivers and analytical needs, ultimately architecting the most efficient, robust and sustainable solutions possible. 
 Well-versed in data profiling, data manipulation and/or data analysis. Ability to write complex queries on large data sets from disparate data sources using SAS, SQL, Access, BI (Business Objects), OLAP or other tools. 
 Involvement in data hygiene / data quality initiatives; familiarity with master data management and best practices. 
 Working independently or on teams as needed, multi-tasking, and handling changing priorities from time to time. 
 Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. 
 Adapts easily to new software and tools. 
 Project management certification is a plus.

Summit Companies is looking for experienced, reliable, and efficient Human Resources Analyst to be part of our team. You'll own the analysis of people driven metrics and data. Join for great benefits, competitive wages, and exciting work. 
Summit Companies is comprised of 4 subsidiaries performing fire protection facility services including fire sprinkler, fire suppression, fire alarm, and consultative engineering. We are presently serving 15 states with our 36 branches and growing. Due to this growth, we are adding this position to develop and support operations in analyzing business intelligence and available data in the HR arena. 
The purpose of the Human Resources Benefit Analyst position is to collect, compile and analyze HR data, metrics and statistics to make recommendations related to recruitment, retention, and legal compliance. 
This position works in direct supervision of the Director of Human Resources. 
Minimum Qualifications: 
Associate’s and/or bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Industrial Psychology, or related field required. 
Experience: 
3 years Human Resources Analyst experience or equivalent education experience 
3 years of data analysis pertaining to job classification and compensation, recruitment, selection, training, employee benefits, and/or equal opportunity compliance preferred 
3 years of professional computer skills (Typing 45 WPM, Intermediate ability in MS Word, Excel Outlook, Access) 
1-year Union experience, preferred 
1-year ADP or similar experience, preferred 
SHRM-CP or SHRM-SCP, preferred 
Duties and Responsibilities: 
Collects and compiles HR metrics and data from a variety of sources including the human resource information system (HRIS) and payroll outputs, management and employee surveys, exit interviews, employment records, government labor statistics, competitors’ practices, and other sources. 
Analyzes data and statistics for trends and patterns with attention to recruitment, hiring practices, retention, benefits, engagement, and turnover, while maintaining compliance with employment laws and regulations. 
Presents data analysis findings to others, including senior leadership. 
Where feasible, streamline data and information consumption via Tableau or similar system. 
Identifies and recommends reasonable short- and long-term goals, milestones, and benchmarks for key performance metrics. 
Based on metrics and analysis, makes recommendations for policies and activities to improve the organizational culture including suggestions to maintain legal compliance. 
Facilitates implementation of new training, development, and other related initiatives. 
May conduct or assist with conducting classification audits to ensure that jobs are properly classified as exempt or nonexempt. 
May assist in extraction and compilation of data for department audits including workers compensation, retirement, non-discrimination testing, and union requested audits, and more. 
Ensures compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices. 
Assist HR leadership with departmental budgets, as requested. 
Assist with specialized reporting as it pertains to the union requirements, including and not limited to union reporting, as requested. 
Guide and/or assist with performance, benefits, and compensation review and evaluation processes, as requested. 
Perform other duties as assigned for departmental/organizational success. 
Success Factors / Job Competencies 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. 
Thorough understanding of local, state, and federal laws involving employment, HR, and HR policies. 
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software. 
Highly Proficient with Excel including pivot tables, V-look ups, etc. 
Proficient with or the ability to quickly learn the organizations HRIS, payroll, and similar employee management software. 
High priority of confidentiality 
Ability to meet deadlines with high attention to detail 
Ability to work independently (and part of a team) in a fast-paced environment 
Ability to collaborate within a cross-functional team environment 
Organizational Benefits: 
Our compensation package is competitive and our benefits package includes 2 optional medical plans, a dental plan, a vision plan as well as available supplemental insurances through Aflac. We offer Employer-Paid Life, AD&D and LTD insurances as well as Paid Time Off and 8 Paid Holidays. 
We are fully committed to equal opportunities for employment to all individuals regardless of race, national origin, gender, religion, sexual orientation, disability, familial status and any other classification protected under the law. We are an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. 
INDSC

If you have experience in logistics and supply chain processes, we’d like to meet you. Your goal will be to help our supply chain run as smoothly and profitably as possible. Title: REMOTE - EHS and Sustainability Technical Analyst - Wilmerding, PA 15148 - Indeed.com
Description:
REMOTE 
 Kelly Engineering Resources, a managed solution provider and business unit of Kelly Services, Inc., is currently seeking a Environmental, Health, & Safety and Sustainability Technical Analyst ,  for a  multi-year engagement  at one of our Global Medical Device clients in  Pittsburgh, PA.  This role is a full-time, fully benefitted position. As a Kelly Engineering employee, you will be eligible for Medical, Dental, 401K and a variety of other benefits to choose from. You will also be eligible for paid time off, including holiday, vacation, and sick/personal time. 
 Virtual/Remote position .........The Environmental, Health, & Safety and Sustainability Technical Analyst is a key member of the EHS&S Team and will have responsibilities for all EHS & Sustainability Data Analysis, Training Management, and Technical Support for the EH&S Data Management Systems. In this role, the Technical Analyst will provide analytic support to the Director of EHS&S in making strategic data-related decisions by collecting, analyzing, segmenting, tracking, and reporting data pertinent to the EHS&S Programs; including data gathering and coordination with key stakeholders to gain access to relevant data. The Technical Analyst will be the subject matter expert related to all environmental, safety and sustainability metrics through data reporting, assessment and analytics. In this role, they will develop and maintain effective working relationships with both internal and external clients. This position reports directly to the Director EHS&S. 
 Essential Functions 
 Collects and analyzes data from multiple sources and databases in order to develop EH&S statistics/trends and determines the most informative approaches to summarizing the data and communicating analytical results. 
 Provides management with detailed analyses to identify deficiencies in safety performance milestones throughout the organization and assists business units in evaluating the health of their organization. 
 Design, develop, implement, and maintain, as required, reporting tables, metrics, and reports that drive key business decisions. Must be able to create innovative or customized templates & formats, written reports & presentations, and training materials. 
 Provides data management support for the ETS EHS&S SharePoint Site, the EHS&S Data Management Portal, and other data collection systems. 
 Monitors, manages, and analyzes data entered into the data collection systems to ensure data integrity, consistency, and gap closure. 
 Tracks, categorizes, and processes incidents, incident reports, and corrective actions in the EHS&S Data Management Portal. Verifies effectiveness of corrective measures and identifies potential for safety performance degradation or enhancement. 
 Responsible for producing performance-based, interactive learning experiences to meet the business needs of the company. Works virtually in a collaborative team environment and uses proven instructional design methodologies to design and develop SCORM learning content. 
 Collaborate as Subject Matter Expert (SME) with Corporate EHS Director to develop, update, and revise course material content; including, but not limited to, Power Point Presentations, participant guides, activities, instructor guides, webinars, and other training methods. 
 Lead technical training course design and development by offering technical expertise in developing course materials. Selects and recommends appropriate media and delivery methods for coursework. 
 Collaborate with key stakeholders and subject matter experts to analyze needs and implement SCORM learning content. 
 Collaborate with IT, third party contractors, technical architects, developers, database specialists and engineers in order to implement and deploy new tools across the company, as well as improve application and model quality of existing tools. Identify problems in the testing and configuration process. Evaluate the functionality and efficiency of the processes. 
 Assists in the development, delivery, assessment and improvement of health and safety training. 
 Supports strategic Sustainability programs and activities related to Workplace, Communities, Customers, Supply Chain and Environment. 
 Collects data for compliance reporting on greenhouse gas emissions, utilities, chemicals and other environmental impacts. 
 Assists in the development, delivery, assessment and improvement of sustainability training. 
 Core Competencies 
 Data Analysis and Management Systems Requirements 
 Demonstrated experience performing safety analytical and operation tasks. Demonstrated experience with qualitative and quantitative accident analysis techniques 
 Strong proficiency using Microsoft Office applications and mobile technologies, as well as, demonstrated experience using other MS Office products to monitor, track, analyze, and report on large amounts of data. 
 Knowledge and experience with SQL, web-based reporting, or business intelligence (BI). Experience with other systems for data query and report building are strongly preferred. 
 Training and Learning Management Requirements 
 Demonstrated proficiency with web development tools and learning technologies. Strong knowledge of instructional design principles and methods. 
 Advanced proficiency with web development tools (XML, SCORM, video deployment, and file optimization techniques) and learning technologies (iSpring, Adobe Flash, Action Script, Photoshop, Captivate, and Articulate). 
 Demonstrated knowledge of adult learning principles or user interaction 
 Ability to deliver impactful and interactive training 
 
 Personal Characteristics 
 High energy level and demonstrated ability to influence others and impact change. 
 Ability to observe strict confidentiality. 
 Ability to establish credibility and be decisive – but able to recognize and support the organization’s preferences and priorities. 
 Strong interpersonal and well-developed oral and written communication skills. An ability to communicate clearly and professionally with all levels of employees, leadership, consultants, and regulatory entities. 
 Demonstrated attention to detail and accuracy in work. 
 Ability to work under pressure, stay organized, and continuously meet deadlines. 
 Demonstrates, through actions, a commitment to the philosophy of continuous improvement and multi-disciplined, problem-solving teams in all aspects of performance. 
 
 Qualifications 
 Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, engineering, or related subject, and 3 years' experience mining and reporting on data using tools such as MS Power BI, SQL, and Excel against object-oriented databases, with tool implementation experience, OR any equivalent combination of experience and education which demonstrates the skills, knowledge and abilities required to perform the work. 
 A minimum of 5-7 years’ experience in EH&S, training, and data analysis. Must have demonstrated experience in research, analytical and statistical assessment, and evaluation methods and techniques to analyze a large volume of data and identify trends and issues. 
 Thorough knowledge of US federal laws and regulations pertaining to safety, health, and environmental programs. 
 Ability to apply critical thinking methods: define problems, collect and interpret relevant data, establish facts, draw valid conclusions, and implement countermeasures. 
 Hands on with a sense of urgency, ability to manage under pressure and manage multiple priorities and projects. Attention to detail is essential in addition to multi-tasking ability. 
 Must have knowledge of a variety of computer software applications, in word processing, spreadsheets, database and presentation software 
 Ability to read, analyze, and interpret procedures and regulations. Ability to write reports and business correspondence. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from employees, managers, and industry peers. 
 Ability to track and collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. 
 Ability to self-start and follow through on tasks. 
 Certificates, Licenses, Registrations: None Required

Title: Loan Closing Analyst Sr - Commercial - Pittsburgh, PA 15219 - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Profile
 
Position Overview
 
At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. In Commercial Lending Operations, we want to inspire new and innovative ideas on how to provide “best in class” service to our customers. As a Loan Closing Analyst Sr - Commercial, you will be based in Pittsburgh, PA; Kalamazoo, MI; Brecksville, OH; Miamisburg, OH; Houston, TX; Dallas, TX; or East Brunswick, NJ.
 
We seek motivated, driven and creative individuals that enjoy working as part of a team in a high-energy environment which thrives on innovation and ingenuity. You will work together to create new solutions which will provide our clients with an exceptional customer experience. Valued opinions, supported by collaborative teams, impact the success of Commercial Lending Operations.
 
The schedule for this position is Monday through Friday, Daylight hours.
 
Job Description
 
Closes varied and more complex loans without supervision and disburses loan funds. Prepares and/or reviews all loan documents for completeness and accuracy with discretion. Independently weighs financial risks.
 Independently reviews documentation and verifies work processes to ensure completeness, accuracy and conformance to established service levels and applicable policies and procedures. Reviews complex loan-closing documentation based on approval documentation. Responsible for sharing best practices with team members and recommending process improvements. Represents department on projects and initiatives. Participates on deal team with negotiations of the legal documentation. Reviews and validates due diligence associated with project or transaction with discretion.
 Partners with internal and/or external business partners to route communications, documents or other action items to complete transactions. Identifies and may address exceptions; escalates appropriately. May interact with customers and/or have assigned accounts or portfolios.
 Provides responses and documentation to inquiries and ad hoc requests. Completes loan set up sheets and other necessary documentation for entry into the bank's loan system.
 May schedule time frames at discretion for loan closings in light of loan commitments and customer needs.
 
PNC Employees take pride in our reputation and to continue building upon that we expect our employees to be:
 Customer Focused - Knowledgeable of the values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions and able to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions.
 Managing Risk - Assessing and effectively managing all of the risks associated with their business objectives and activities to ensure they adhere to and support PNC's Enterprise Risk Management Framework.
 
Competencies
 
Data Gathering and Analysis – Knowledge of data gathering and analysis tools, techniques and processes; ability to use these to gather and analyze data on the learning needs of a target population.
 
Decision Making and Critical Thinking – Understanding of the issues related to the decision-making process; ability to analyze situations fully and accurately, and reach productive decisions.
 
Effective Communications – Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors.
 
Managing Multiple Priorities – Ability to manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects, groups, or activities, making effective judgments as to prioritizing and time allocation.
 
Negotiating – Knowledge of successful negotiation concepts and techniques; ability to negotiate successfully across the organization and with external vendors and clients in a constructive and collaborative manner.
 
Operational Functions – Knowledge of major functional processes and associated operating requirements; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.
 
Planning and Organizing – Mobilizes both time and resources to get things done.
 
Problem Management Process – Knowledge of and ability to bring a reported problem to successful resolution.
 
Products and Services – Knowledge of major products and services and product and service groups; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.
 
Standard Operating Procedures – Knowledge of and ability to design, implement and evaluate standard operating procedures affecting daily and strategic business operations in order to increase operational efficiency.
 
Work Experience
 
Roles at this level typically require a university / college degree, with 2+ years of relevant professional experience. In lieu of a degree, a comparable combination of education and experience (including military service) may be considered.
 
Education
 
Bachelors
 
Additional Job Description
 
Benefits
 PNC offers employees a comprehensive range of benefits to help meet your needs now and in the future. Depending on your eligibility, options for full-time employees include medical/prescription drug coverage (with a Health Savings Account feature); dental and vision options; employee and spouse/child life insurance; short- and long-term disability protection; maternity and parental leave; paid holidays, vacation days and occasional absence time; 401(k), pension and stock purchase plans; dependent care reimbursement account; back-up child/elder care; adoption assistance; educational assistance and a robust wellness program with financial incentives. To learn more about these and other programs, including benefits for part-time employees, visit pncbenefits.com > New to PNC .
 
 Disability Accommodations Statement: 
The PNC workplace is inclusive and supportive of individual needs. If you have a physical or other impairment that might require an accommodation, including technical assistance with the PNC Careers website or submission process, please call  877-968-7762  and select Option 4: Recruiting or contact us via email at pathfinder@pnc.com.
 
The Human Resources Service Center hours of operation are Monday - Friday 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM ET.
 
 Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO): 
PNC provides equal employment opportunity to qualified persons regardless of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or other categories protected by law.
 
California Residents
 
Refer to the California Consumer Privacy Act Privacy Notice to gain understanding of how PNC may use or disclose your personal information in our hiring practices.

Title: Financial Systems Analyst - Westerville, OH 43081 - Indeed.com
Description:
FINANCIAL SYSTEMS ANALYST 
 Contract to hire opportunity 
 JOB OBJECTIVE: 
 To analyze, design, and introduce accounting data flow, accounting processes, and financial and analytical reporting solutions founded on leading edge technologies. Recommends and implements methods for increasing efficiency and profitability by analyzing financial business practices and accounting processes to suggest improvement regarding topics from budgeting and cash operations to fiduciary management. Work with individuals across the organization to ensure seamless integrations of the organization’s business system platforms with the General Ledger systems and supporting data warehouses. Create operational efficiency through innovation and continuous improvement. 
 ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 
 Work within cross-functional groups to support all aspects of the organization’s financial reporting and audit requirements. 
 Partner with the business team, users, and customers to elicit requirements and document financial reporting or integration issues. 
 Support financial audit and regulatory compliance requirements. 
 Work alongside Information Technology business analysts and application developers to evaluate the impact of new or change business application development on existing financial reporting processes to mitigate downstream impacts. 
 Identify, improve, and develop technology solutions that drive organization’s financial strategic goals. 
 Conduct financial reporting risk assessments along with fit gap and cost analysis for proposed business solutions. 
 Troubleshoot existing financial and business application/system components to determine system reporting or integration issues. 
 Work directly with third party solution providers to understand their products and develop technical financial system integration specifications. 
 Interact with finance leaders and third-party solution providers to assist in maintaining and updating financial system applications. 
 Design business financial reporting solutions to maximize the use of a single source of financial information. 
 Analyze and recommend new financial system technologies, services and ideas to improve financial tracking and processing efficiencies. 
 Analyze data and financial reporting processes to provide recommendations on system modifications and designs to continually improve and streamline workflows. 
 Develop ad hoc financial management reports and dashboards as needed or requested by business or financial leadership. 
 Work with business and QA to prepare test plans and evaluate test results for business application implementations through financial journal entries and management reports. 
 Work with finance applications’ owners to provide backup and support of application security and maintenance. 
 Present financial technical solutions, create supporting materials, and train finance or accounting staff on the correct usage of the organization’s various technologies to accomplish business tasks. 
 Investigates compliance/regulatory issues and concerns and recommends appropriate business solutions and/or strategies based on those issues 
 Construct reconciliation methodologies and ensure the proper coding/reporting needed to ensure core business systems, data warehouses and financials are balanced, or alerts are immediate when out of balance situations occur. 
 
 OTHER FUNCTIONS: 
 Be available for consulting and technical assistance for production problem resolution for daily or month end close and posting issues. 
 Work with IT QA to perform manual or automated application integration testing to ensure financial transaction process correctly. 
 Creates reconciliation scripts to ensure business systems and financial applications are synchronized and balanced. 
 Create strong collaborative relationships with business and IT to provide consulting about financial impacts and considerations. 
 
 KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: 
 
 Bachelor's degree with a major in accounting or computer science or related field from an accredited college or university is strongly preferred; commensurate experience may be considered. 
 A minimum of five years full time or equivalent part time paid experience with a property/casualty or workers’ compensation insurance carrier or equivalent insurance program is required. 
 Strong understanding of accounting processes, data flows, and business system’s impact on accounting. 
 Excellent analytic, communication and problem-solving skills. 
 Detail-oriented with the ability to rapidly learn and take advantage of new concepts, business models, and technologies. 
 Strong understanding the functional accounting applications, business operations and technical flow of any business application. 
 Highly motivated, a quick learner, works independently or on a team to drive solutions with minimal supervision. 
 Experience and strong SQL knowledge and able to demonstrate competency in querying databases. 
 Training or knowledge in property-casualty insurance and statutory accounting rules and procedures. 
 
 ADDITIONAL DETAILS: 
 Due to the volume of responses, only the most qualified candidates to the job requirement can be contacted. 
 We appreciate all our applicants, but we are not able to sponsor now; no C2C or H-1B. 
 There is no ‘per diem’ with this position and must be able to work on W-2 hourly basis. 
 There is no relocation budgeted for this position. If this position requires you to relocate you will be responsible for those costs.

Title: Analyst, Workforce Management - Alton, IL - Indeed.com
Description:
Diversity of backgrounds, ideas, thoughts, and experiences is vital to our culture and the way we do business. Creating an environment where differences are embraced and where every person feels engaged and included makes us safer, stronger, and more successful. 
 With a history dating back to 1886, American Water is the largest and most geographically diverse U.S. publicly traded water and wastewater utility company. The company employs more than 7,000 dedicated professionals who provide regulated and market-based drinking water, wastewater and other related services to 15 million people in 46 states. American Water provides safe, clean, affordable and reliable water services to our customers to help make sure we keep their lives flowing. For more information, visit amwater.com and follow American Water on Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn. 
 PLEASE NOTE: In order for American Water to evaluate decisions about new regulations, reintegration, and safe operating practices, all employees are required to report their vaccination status. 
 Primary Role 
 Design and compile business analysis that will support critical business decisions. This is accomplished by designing reporting systems, analyzing historical performance trends, and design reports that effectively communicate the results of your analysis.Forecast call volume and KPI performance for HOS lines of business. Design, configure and maintain reporting systems and data using advanced Microsoft Excel skills and Tableau reporting. Monitor data to identify changes with customer behaviors, preferences, satisfaction, sales, etc. Gather data from SQL tables, Cisco – CUIC, Verint, other systems as required. Support various departments including marketing and client success with reaching their goals through effective workforce analysis. Develop strategic reports based on analysis that will be utilized by HOS management to develop budget and staffing plans.

 Utilize multiple data sources 
 Routine Reporting - Create, update, and publish highly accurate daily, weekly, monthly, year-to-date and annual standardized reporting packages and analysis that meet all stakeholders’ needs and timeframes. 
 Maintain definition of terms that are used within the reports. Create and maintain reporting and analytics documentation. 
 Utilize expertise in MS Office programs, Tableau, Verint and other workforce and reporting packages to deliver meaningful, relevant, and insightful analysis that are graphically pleasing and presentation ready. 
 Routine Reporting - Provide support to workforce by identifying additional opportunities to analyze data for improved business intelligence. 
 Collaborate with marketing and client success to ensure workforce is effectively planning for new business, products, and new business technology and trends. 
 Identify new more efficient business processes and procedures. 
 Partner with the workforce specialists, operations, marketing, technology, and operations to identify areas of opportunity. 
 Strategic Analysis - Research and utilize data from similar industries and/or like business units to identify appropriate benchmarking data and metrics. 
 Provide strategic analysis to help align performance data with key business objectives. 
 Utilize effective interpersonal communication (written, verbal, electronic, formal presentations, listening and group facilitation) when interfacing with all levels of management. 
 Support the workforce department as required with product and performance management and other tasks as required. 
 Knowledge/Skills 
 Advanced skills in SQL and Microsoft Excel. Supporting skills: MS Office: PowerPoint, Word, and Outlook. 
 Adept at managing multiple priorities and tasks in a fast-paced environment. 
 Experienced with setting up and maintenance of databases.
 Accurately analyze and collect data for various types of business reports. 
 Strong balance of quantitative and analytical abilities paired with excellent communication and interpersonal skills. 
 Must be creative, responsive, resourceful, and adaptive in a dynamic environment. 
 Compile presentations and present findings of your analysis to operations and executive management. 
 Proven ability to work in a team environment. 
 Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite / Excel Advanced (pivot tables, compiling macros, database query, etc.) 
 Proficient with database and reporting tools (SSRS/SQL, Reporting Services) and Geographic Information Systems use.
 Create custom data interface(s) and report development. 
 Knowledge in process and continuous improvement methodologies. 
 Workforce management software, IVR and telephone technology. 
 Experience/Education 
 Associates degree in Business, Finance, Computer Science, Information Systems, or similar technology field is preferred or equivalent experience. 
 Proven experience with using SQL and Microsoft Excel to create pivot tables, graphs and charts.
 Experienced with building and updating reports and tables in Tableau. 
 Experience coordinating multiple organizational requirements; Operations, Finance, Client Success, Marketing, Etc. 
 2 years business analyst experience within a contact center environment. 
 Thorough understanding of internal and external factors that impact contact center performance. 
 Experienced with multi-site call center configuration with vendor 3rd party vendor staffing. 
 Travel Requirements 
 5% 
 Work Environment 
 Office / Potential to work from home 
 Flexible hours may be required at times based on business needs 
 Other

Collaborates

Customer obsessed

Title: Senior Financial Analyst - Claremont, NC 28610 - Indeed.com
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY: 
The Sr. Financial Analyst will take an active role in the manufacturing financial and operational reporting process. Among their responsibilities, the Sr. Financial Analyst will perform month end close duties, monthly reporting, ad hoc analysis, budgeting, and forecasting.
 
 PRIMARY FUNCTIONS: 
 
 Assist and prepare annual budget and monthly forecast 
 Build bottoms up budget and forecast models on labor, material costs and overhead costs 
 Develop cost of material models that incorporate trends, expected product mix and pricing changes by location 
 Work with corporate on occupancy models to ensure proper estimates 
 Develop all other operating cost models to ensure accuracy 
 Load forecast and budget into Essbase 
 Prepare and distribute budget and forecast p/ls 
 Monthly close activities 
 Research variances versus budget, forecast and prior year 
 Recommend and prepare journal entries (i.e. accruals, deferrals, reclasses) 
 Prepare and distribute company-level p/ls, building p/ls, departmental actuals vs forecast 
 Assist with profitability analysis on business changes (i.e. price increases, wage rates, efficiencies, expansion, etc.) 
 Assist the overall team with product profitability reviews and analysis at the collection and product level 
 Analyze and document recurring expenses such as maintenance service agreements, supplies, etc. to develop an understanding and identify cost saving opportunities 
 Prepare weekly and monthly scorecard for distribution to management 
 Assist in reporting and analysis on business issues (i.e. root cause analysis, failed scans, days to receive, inventory turns, etc.) 
 Prepare weekly labor reporting to management 
 Develop SOPs, work instructions and process flows charts around critical operational processes with financial impact 
 Prepare ad-hoc reporting as needed for executive leadership 
 
 MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: 
 
 A Bachelor degree in accounting or finance 
 3-5 years experience in a similar role 
 Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite with advanced Excel skills 
 Experience with accounting and ERP software, SQL, and Power BI 
 Strong problem-solving skills, including the ability to effectively address issues in collaboration with others as appropriate 
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
 Ability to analyze data and produce reports to assist operations 
 Ability to work well under pressure and effectively handle multiple, concurrent demands and appropriately prioritize responsibilities 
 
 PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: 
 
 Experience in manufacturing 
 Experience with Oracle, DAX2009, D365 and Essbase 
 
Position eligible for relocation

Title: Senior Analyst – Analytics Operations - Chicago, IL 60606 - Indeed.com
Description:
Company Description 
Epsilon is the leader in outcome-based marketing. We enable marketing that’s built on proof, not promises. Through Epsilon PeopleCloud, the marketing platform for personalizing consumer journeys with performance transparency, Epsilon helps marketers anticipate, activate and prove measurable business outcomes. Powered by CORE ID®, the most accurate and stable identity management platform representing 200+ million people, Epsilon’s award-winning data and technology is rooted in privacy by design and underpinned by powerful AI. With more than 50 years of experience in personalization and performance working with the world’s top brands, agencies and publishers, Epsilon is a trusted partner leading CRM, digital media, loyalty and email programs. Positioned at the core of Publicis Groupe, Epsilon is a global company with over 8,000 employees in over 40 offices around the world. For more information, visit epsilon.com. Follow us on Twitter at @EpsilonMktg. 
Job Description 
Overview: 
Our Analytics team transforms our unique data to impact business. With a team of 100+ people, everyone can specialize in their passion—from account analytics to analytics development to business intelligence. Whether it’s driving insights from cutting-edge tools or building the tools yourself, you have the opportunity to show your capabilities. And no matter where you fit in, our proprietary line of ad tech products means data collection is efficient and accurate. You'll enjoy shaping big business decisions with big data analytics. 
As part of the Audience Analytics team in Analytics Operations, you'll be responsible for building and developing customized, addressable audiences of users for our diverse set of advertisers. The Audience Analytics team also plays a key role in collaborating with our Decision Sciences team to build (or guide) the development of audience targeting tactics and eventually implementing them after testing. 
Responsibilities: 
Develop and maintain Epsilon's PeopleCloud Digital Media Solutions suite of standard and premium audiences 
Automate existing ad hoc processes into scalable ones using SQL, Python and Airflow 
Develop, execute and automate operational processes including creating, refreshing, deprecating, and troubleshooting audiences 
Lead or participate in projects to improve Epsilon's PeopleCloud Digital Media Solutions audience targeting platform or enable new audience targeting tactics 
Conduct analysis to support business decisions around audience quality and the impact that audiences have on performance 
Requirements: 
2 - 7 years of relevant experience 
2+ years of hands-on industry use in SQL, a scripting language (Python, R) and advanced Excel (pivot tables, vlookups, graphing) 
Knowledge of data visualization tools (Tableau, etc.) 
Experience with big data ETL and/or data engineering related tasks 
Experience with task automation such as Airflow or Prefect 
Experience with querying optimization and performance tuning 
Familiar with data warehouse principles (relational tables) 
Familiar with version control such as Git 
Experience with sprints and/or Agile development practices 
Detail oriented and takes initiative to check data quality and integrity on complex datasets 
Excellent communication, troubleshooting and diagnostic skills 
Highly motivated & driven 
 Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: 
Experience building SQL stored procedures, functions, triggers, views 
Knowledge of Python Packages and Libraries 
Experience building audience targeting products / practice in Ad Tech industry 
Experience working for a marketing data company or data management platform 
Knowledge of Hadoop, Jupyter, Linux CMD, Luigi, Kubeflow, Papermill 
Experience with statistical modeling (preferred, but not required) 
Qualifications 
Additional Information 
Great People, Deserve Great Benefits 
We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career. 
Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Epsilon’s policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived race, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy), marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, religion, creed, color, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including transgender status), veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Epsilon also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories.
