The HR Analyst will be accountable for collecting, compiling, and analyzing HR data, metrics, and statistics, and applying this data to make recommendations related to recruitment, retention, and legal compliance. You will work closely with the VP of Human Resources and Talent Acquisition Specialist on a daily basis to meet these needs.
 
Are you an exceptional fit for this role?

Title: Business Intelligence Manager - New Orleans, LA 70130 - Indeed.com
Description:
Lucid is a research technology (ResTech) platform that provides programmatic access to first-party data. With respondents in more than 100 countries, Lucid enables anyone, in any industry, to survey online audiences and get the answers they need. These answers reveal the sentiments, motivations, and behaviors of target demographics – data that can be used to build business strategies, measure the impact of digital advertising, publish research, and more. Founded in 2010, Lucid is headquartered in New Orleans, LA with offices throughout the US, Europe, and Asia. 
The Business Intelligence Manager will be responsible for the full life cycle of BI analytics including designing and developing data models, reports, and dashboards; data exploration; performing analysis; establishing and driving KPIs; and training end users. The role will require a strong partnership with the leadership team to monitor and measure our organization's success and ensure data driven decision making. 
This role is an Individual Contributor position with Manager level ownership and autonomy. We can consider candidates working remotely within the US or on-site from one of our US offices in New Orleans, New York, or Dallas. #LI-remote 
Responsibilities 
Identify, analyze, document and improve existing business processes and legacy reporting solutions 
Work across entire business org to determine what critical, customer impacting problems can be solved with the use of various artificial intelligence techniques and to support new products and services 
Partner with the leadership team to gather requirements and analyze Lucid's financial and operative KPIs 
Design, develop, test and deploy BI solutions (data models, reports and dashboards) 
Ensure data quality, completeness, and accuracy 
Mentor and collaborate with BI support team 
Troubleshoot and support existing business intelligence reports and dashboards 
Qualifications 
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent work experience.
 4+ years of related work experience in business intelligence, data warehousing, or a similar field.
 Strong SQL experience including advanced query concepts
 Proven analytical, problem solving, creative thinking and design skills 
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, team oriented environment 
Open to thinking out of the box, is innovative, and can work with new and different artificial intelligence/intelligent computing paradigms. 
Proven track record of managing BI solutions end-to-end, including requirements gathering with business users, collaboration with backend engineering, front end report development, technical documentation, and end-user training/roll out. 
Knowledge of MS BI Reporting Stack (SSRS and Power BI) or similar technology 
Bonus points if you have... 
Experience with standard star schema design and development concepts, including fact table types, grain levels, and SCDs 
Experience working with global remote teams 
Have experience with Cloud technologies (AWS and Snowflake) 
Lucid's Hiring Commitment 
 
 We understand that many candidates may not be perfectly qualified for a job posting. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable – and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of dedication, impact, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment. We want you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is near the desired qualifications. 
We also know that diversity of background and thought can enhance problem-solving and encourage more creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team. 
At Lucid we foster a collaborative and inspiring workplace. We pride ourselves in doing this by recruiting, hiring and retaining diverse, passionate, and forward-thinking talent. Lucid is committed to and encourages an inclusive environment and we are dedicated to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Title: Financial Systems Analyst - Westerville, OH 43081 - Indeed.com
Description:
FINANCIAL SYSTEMS ANALYST 
 Contract to hire opportunity 
 JOB OBJECTIVE: 
 To analyze, design, and introduce accounting data flow, accounting processes, and financial and analytical reporting solutions founded on leading edge technologies. Recommends and implements methods for increasing efficiency and profitability by analyzing financial business practices and accounting processes to suggest improvement regarding topics from budgeting and cash operations to fiduciary management. Work with individuals across the organization to ensure seamless integrations of the organization’s business system platforms with the General Ledger systems and supporting data warehouses. Create operational efficiency through innovation and continuous improvement. 
 ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 
 Work within cross-functional groups to support all aspects of the organization’s financial reporting and audit requirements. 
 Partner with the business team, users, and customers to elicit requirements and document financial reporting or integration issues. 
 Support financial audit and regulatory compliance requirements. 
 Work alongside Information Technology business analysts and application developers to evaluate the impact of new or change business application development on existing financial reporting processes to mitigate downstream impacts. 
 Identify, improve, and develop technology solutions that drive organization’s financial strategic goals. 
 Conduct financial reporting risk assessments along with fit gap and cost analysis for proposed business solutions. 
 Troubleshoot existing financial and business application/system components to determine system reporting or integration issues. 
 Work directly with third party solution providers to understand their products and develop technical financial system integration specifications. 
 Interact with finance leaders and third-party solution providers to assist in maintaining and updating financial system applications. 
 Design business financial reporting solutions to maximize the use of a single source of financial information. 
 Analyze and recommend new financial system technologies, services and ideas to improve financial tracking and processing efficiencies. 
 Analyze data and financial reporting processes to provide recommendations on system modifications and designs to continually improve and streamline workflows. 
 Develop ad hoc financial management reports and dashboards as needed or requested by business or financial leadership. 
 Work with business and QA to prepare test plans and evaluate test results for business application implementations through financial journal entries and management reports. 
 Work with finance applications’ owners to provide backup and support of application security and maintenance. 
 Present financial technical solutions, create supporting materials, and train finance or accounting staff on the correct usage of the organization’s various technologies to accomplish business tasks. 
 Investigates compliance/regulatory issues and concerns and recommends appropriate business solutions and/or strategies based on those issues 
 Construct reconciliation methodologies and ensure the proper coding/reporting needed to ensure core business systems, data warehouses and financials are balanced, or alerts are immediate when out of balance situations occur. 
 
 OTHER FUNCTIONS: 
 Be available for consulting and technical assistance for production problem resolution for daily or month end close and posting issues. 
 Work with IT QA to perform manual or automated application integration testing to ensure financial transaction process correctly. 
 Creates reconciliation scripts to ensure business systems and financial applications are synchronized and balanced. 
 Create strong collaborative relationships with business and IT to provide consulting about financial impacts and considerations. 
 
 KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: 
 
 Bachelor's degree with a major in accounting or computer science or related field from an accredited college or university is strongly preferred; commensurate experience may be considered. 
 A minimum of five years full time or equivalent part time paid experience with a property/casualty or workers’ compensation insurance carrier or equivalent insurance program is required. 
 Strong understanding of accounting processes, data flows, and business system’s impact on accounting. 
 Excellent analytic, communication and problem-solving skills. 
 Detail-oriented with the ability to rapidly learn and take advantage of new concepts, business models, and technologies. 
 Strong understanding the functional accounting applications, business operations and technical flow of any business application. 
 Highly motivated, a quick learner, works independently or on a team to drive solutions with minimal supervision. 
 Experience and strong SQL knowledge and able to demonstrate competency in querying databases. 
 Training or knowledge in property-casualty insurance and statutory accounting rules and procedures. 
 
 ADDITIONAL DETAILS: 
 Due to the volume of responses, only the most qualified candidates to the job requirement can be contacted. 
 We appreciate all our applicants, but we are not able to sponsor now; no C2C or H-1B. 
 There is no ‘per diem’ with this position and must be able to work on W-2 hourly basis. 
 There is no relocation budgeted for this position. If this position requires you to relocate you will be responsible for those costs. 
 
 
 Why Kelly ® ? 
 The Managed Solutions practice within Kelly Outsourcing and Consulting Group (KellyOCG®) is one focus within the full array of Kelly Services® workforce solutions.
 Kelly Services has transformed from the staffing industry pioneer to a leading workforce solutions provider. KellyOCG is the distinguished outsourcing and consulting segment of Kelly Services, known for applying a forward-looking approach that enables companies to make strategic workforce planning decisions that impact their business and competitive advantage.
 The Managed Solutions practice area of KellyOCG is dedicated to partnering with clients to architect and implement solutions that put them in a position to meet their operational obligation to their organization and freedom to focus on their more strategic business needs.
 About Kelly Services ® 
 As a workforce advocate for over 70 years, we are proud to have a role in managing employment opportunities for more than one million workers around the globe. We employ 550,000 of these individuals directly with the remaining workers engaged through our talent supply chain network of supplier partners. Revenue in 2015 was $5.5 billion. Title: Power BI Administrator - Durham, NC 27709 - Indeed.com
Description:
Fidelity TalentSource is your destination for discovering your next temporary role at Fidelity Investments. We are currently sourcing for a Power BI Administrator to work at Fidelity Investments in Durham, NC. 
 The Team 
 The Data Visualization Chapter plays a pivotal role in the broader organization via solutions that help executives and other business leaders orchestrate organizational performance and manage strategy in a more controlled and transparent manner. We are part of the Enterprise Technology Group. Your efforts will support the Power BI set up and implementation at the executive level within Fidelity Investments. 
 The Expertise You Have 
 Bachelor’s degree in a technology with minimum of 5-10 year of work experience 
 Advanced knowledge & “hands-on” experience on Power BI & Power BI Tenant Administration with at least 3-5 years’ work experience 
 Intermediate/Advanced knowledge & experience with SQL and good understanding of Data warehousing and Relational database concepts & technologies 
 Exposure to Snowflake Cloud Datawarehouse 
 Exposure to Agile methodology 
 
 The Skills You Bring 
 Ability to setup and automate Power BI platform related activities using scripting languages like PowerShell/Python/Shell scripting etc 
 Ability to build CI/CD pipeline to check in and migrate Power BI data sets/dashboards/reports between workspaces utilizing Power BI Rest APIs/Power Platform 
 Ability to build framework to capture Power BI user tracking/logging, usage monitoring, anomalies detection in published data sets and reporting at an enterprise level using Power Platform 
 Ability to build framework that can be used to take regular backup of workspace content & data sets using Power BI Rest APIs/PBI cmdlets 
 Experience on working with Power BI and Snowflake in Direct Query mode 
 Strong analytical, presentation and leadership skills 
 Data Analysis using SQL on data sources 
 Ability to work and collaborate in globally dispersed organization 
 Strong project and time management skills with an ability to set and maintain multiple, competing priorities. 
 Strong desire to learn and develop additional skills and expertise overtime, as well as drive process improvement 
 Adaptable, flexible and thrive in a changing, dynamic environment 
 Highly motivated, proactive, self-starter and works well with minimal supervision 
 
 The Value You Deliver
 Applying your past experiences and help set up & establish a well governed, secure, scalable and highly performing Power BI foundation that can be leveraged across enterprise and to advocate for best practices 
 Looking for Continuous process improvement possibilities with an "automate first" mindset 
 Digging into the details and understanding unique technical and business processes. 
 Assisting with development and delivery of product vision, strategy, systems and operational processes 
 
 COVID Work Policy 
 Safety is our top priority. Once we can be together in person with fewer safety measures, this role will follow our dynamic working approach. You’ll be spending some of your time onsite depending on the nature and needs of your role. 
 Dynamic Working – Post Pandemic 
 Our aim is to combine the best of working offsite with coming together in person. For most teams this means a consistent balance of working from home and office that supports the needs of your role, experience level, and working style. 
 Your success and growth is important to us, so you’ll want to enjoy the benefits of coming together in person – face to face learning and training, quality time with your manager and teammates, building your career network, making friends, and taking full advantage of cultural and social experiences Fidelity provides for you. 
Company Overview 
 
Fidelity TalentSource is the in-house temporary staffing provider for Fidelity Investments, one of the largest and most diversified global financial services firms in the industry. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, including technology and customer service, to fill assignments across Fidelity’s U.S.-based regional and investor center locations. If you would like to experience Fidelity’s supportive and collaborative culture while expanding your skill set and developing your professional network, consider a role with Fidelity TalentSource. Apply today at FTSJobs.com. 
 
We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.
 
 Fidelity TalentSource will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, please contact our HR team at  HR@ ftsjobs.com  . 
 
 Information about Fidelity Investments 
 
At Fidelity Investments, our customers are at the heart of everything we do. As a privately held company with a rich 75-year history, our mission has remained the same since our founding:  to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients . We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityCareers.com. 
 
Fidelity Investments and Fidelity TalentSource are equal opportunity employers.

Title: IT ERP Business Systems Analyst - Needham, MA - Indeed.com
Description:
This role is 3 days onsite in Needham and 2 days work from home.
 
OVERVIEW OF ROLE
 
We are looking for a full time IT ERP Business Systems Analyst, focused on the operations and finance areas in our growing IT Department. In this dynamic role, you will be responsible for working with business owners of various systems, documenting requirements, specifying functionality to developers, testing and obtaining end user acceptance criteria. Work will include all phases of the project delivery lifecycle including support. Examples of systems are Microsoft Dynamics (ERP), MES (Shop Floor Mechanical Execution System), JET reporting and PowerBI (Reporting). Key projects this year include new capabilities for advanced planning and scheduling as well as warehouse management of raw materials.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES
 
Work with Business Owners and Development to define and document business rules for systems development and/or implementation.
 
Translate system enhancement requests into specifications for developers.
 
Make system configuration changes and setup master data to improve system functionality
 
Test new functionality
 
Provide tier 2 support to end users including hands on configuration and master data adjustments in the system
 
Build reports using JET and PowerBI
 
Participate in requirements sessions with stakeholders and users, work as the liaison with upstream as well as downstream teams and systems.
 
Effectively communicate changes in technical components and requirements of an initiative to developers and business stakeholders.
 
Work as the Business Systems Analyst within project teams to deliver major enhancements and new systems.
 
Support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) by developing test plans, supporting testers, identifying, and tracking defects.
 
QUALIFICATIONS
 
2-5 years working as a Business Systems Analyst
 
ERP (e.g. Microsoft Dynamics, Oracle, SAP) configuration, master data setup, data structure knowledge and SQL query experience, Microsoft ERP preferred
 
Strong analytical skills, exceptional planning, and organizational skills.
 
Experience documenting and diagraming current processes
 
Previous IT project implementation experience
 
Ability to analyze data using excel, BI tools etc.
 
Business process knowledge of "Plan to Deliver" inclusive of manufacturing and supply chain
 
Manufacturing industry experience, CPG and Food is a plus
 
Proficiency in English; Excellent verbal and written communication with strong interpersonal and relationship building skills
 
Energy and drive to excel
 
Initiative and ability to proactively see projects to full completion
 
Capacity to juggle multiple tasks and projects simultaneously without compromising quality
 
Willing to learn new systems and be hands-on
 
Bachelor's degree in related business or technical major

Title: Senior Analyst - Finance & Analytics - Atlanta, GA - Indeed.com
Description:
SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES 
 
The Senior Analyst will develop a strong understanding of FirstKey Homes operations, navigate internal systems to compile and analyze data, interpret results, and assist with implementation of solutions. Comfort working in a fast pace, high-growth company that requires adaptability, collaboration and responding with a sense of urgency. 
 
ESSENTIAL DUTIES 
 
 Assist with the preparation of the Annual Operating Plan, Quarterly Forecast and Monthly rolling forecast processes. 
 Work closely with departments to understand variances and provide explanations to the leadership. Research, analyze and help explain any variances to the Plan/Forecast. 
 Serve as a subject matter expert on data analytics and telling the story behind data. Be able to synthesize data into digestible and intuitive reports. 
 Participate in presenting models and analysis to various levels of management, including operating managers, executives, board members and Cerberus team members. 
 Define, improve, and refine KPIs to drive operational improvements across all FirstKey Homes business units. 
 Proactively provide recommendations on new data sources and metrics for future analysis. 
 Partner with business teams and advocate for data-driven decision and frameworks via democratization of data usage across the business. 
 Conduct competitive analysis on Single Family Rental (SFR) industry, key competitors, and overall macro trends. 
 Synthesize and interpret data to identify current and emerging real estate trends and developments. 
 Embrace continuous innovation in Finance & Analytics with a focus on data driven decision making and minimizing manual processes. 
 Drive the development of analytical tools to support the Finance & Analytics strategy. 
 This summary is not an all-inclusive description of job duties. Other job duties and responsibilities may also be assigned by the incumbent's manager at any time based upon Company need. 
 
 To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 
 
REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE 
 
 Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Data Analytics, or equivalent work experience and/or education. 
 Minimum 5 years' experience in an analyst or similar role. 
 Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with proven ability to effectively influence staff at all levels. 
 Advanced PowerPoint, Power BI, and Excel skills with focus on executive messaging. 
 Detail-oriented with a commitment to operational excellence and quality. 
 Advanced proficiency with some or all the following: SQL, VBA, Python, Statistical Models and R. 
 Experience with large datasets, recommending actions and synthetizing insights. 
 
 PREFERRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE 
 
 Experience working in Real Estate, Consulting, or Investment Banking. 
 Experience working in a fast pace, high growth company. 
 Experience sourcing and interpreting data to drive process improvement decisions. 
 
 REQUIRED SKILLS 
 
 Critical Thinking— Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems. 
 Complex Problem Solving — Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions. 
 Mathematics— Using mathematics to solve problems. 
 Active Listening— Giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times. 
 Active Learning— Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making. 
 Systems Evaluation — Identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the system. 
 Monitoring— Monitoring/Assessing performance of yourself, other individuals, or organizations to make improvements or take corrective action. 
 Speaking— Talking to others to convey information effectively. 
 Writing— Communicating effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience. 
 
 WORK STYLES & BEHAVIORS 
 
 Analytical Thinking— Job requires analyzing information and using logic to address work-related issues and problems. 
 Initiative — Job requires a willingness to take on responsibilities and challenges. 
 Integrity— Job requires being honest and ethical. 
 Dependability— Job requires being reliable, responsible, and dependable, and fulfilling obligations. 
 Attention to Detail— Job requires being careful about detail and thorough in completing work tasks. 
 Adaptability/Flexibility— Job requires being open to change (positive or negative) and to considerable variety in the workplace. 
 
 FirstKey Homes is an equal opportunity employer and will not tolerate discrimination in employment on the basis of race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, ethnicity, national origin, marital status, veteran status, genetic information or any other legally protected classification or status.

Title: Loan Closing Analyst Sr - Mtg - Downers Grove, IL 60515 - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Profile
 
Position Overview
 
At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. We work together each day to foster an inclusive workplace culture where all of our employees feel respected, valued and have an opportunity to contribute to the company’s success. As a Loan Closing Analyst Senior - Mortgage within PNC's Mortgage operations organization, you will be based in Jacksonville, FL, Downers Grove, IL, or Pittsburgh, PA.
 
Job Description
 
Closes varied and more complex loans without supervision and disburses loan funds. Prepares and/or reviews all loan documents for completeness and accuracy.
 Reviews documentation and verifies work processes to ensure completeness, accuracy and conformance to established service levels and applicable policies and procedures. Prepares and/or reviews more complex loan-closing documentation based on approval documentation. Responsible for sharing best practices with team members and recommending process improvement. Represents department on projects and initiatives.
 Partners with internal and/or external business partners to route communications, documents or other action items to complete transactions. Identifies and may address exceptions; escalates appropriately. May interact with customers and/or have assigned accounts.
 Provides responses and documentation to inquiries and ad hoc requests. Completes loan set up sheets and other necessary documentation for entry into the bank's loan system.
 May schedule time frames for loan closings in light of loan commitments and customer needs.
 
PNC Employees take pride in our reputation and to continue building upon that we expect our employees to be:
 Customer Focused - Knowledgeable of the values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions and able to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions.
 Managing Risk - Assessing and effectively managing all of the risks associated with their business objectives and activities to ensure they adhere to and support PNC's Enterprise Risk Management Framework.
 
Competencies
 
Data Gathering and Analysis – Knowledge of data gathering and analysis tools, techniques and processes; ability to use these to gather and analyze data on the learning needs of a target population.
 
Decision Making and Critical Thinking – Understanding of the issues related to the decision-making process; ability to analyze situations fully and accurately, and reach productive decisions.
 
Effective Communications – Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors.

Title: Business Analyst - Houston, TX 77002 - Indeed.com
Description:
The Business Analyst’s role is to elicit, analyze, specify, and validate the business needs of stakeholders, be they customers or end users. This includes interviewing stakeholders and gathering and compiling user requirements to understand the technology solutions they need. The Business Analyst will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help the business make good technology decisions. The Business Analyst will also be proactive about working with the Director of Technology to look for new technologies to optimize business processes. The Business Analyst will play a pivotal role in ensuring IT’s understanding of business requirements. 
 
Location: Houston, Texas 
Position Duration: Direct Hire 
 Where You Come In! 
 
 Strategy & Planning 
 Collaborate with project sponsors to determine project scope and vision. 
 Clearly identify project stakeholders and establish user classes, as well as their characteristics. 
 Conduct interviews to gather user requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods. 
 Identify and establish scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics. 
 Work with stakeholders and project team to prioritize collected requirements. 
 Research, review, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirements-gathering processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes. 
 
 
Acquisition & Deployment 
 Assist in conducting research on software and hardware products to meet agreed-upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts. 
 Participate in the QA of purchased solutions to ensure features and functions have been enabled and optimized. 
 Participate in the selection of any requirements documentation software solutions that the organization may opt to use. 
 
 
Operational Management 
 Analyze and verify requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards. 
 Develop and utilize standard templates to accurately and concisely write requirements specifications. 
 Translate conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team. 
 Where applicable, develop prototypes of interfaces and attributes based on user requirements. 
 Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team. 
 Develop and conduct peer reviews of business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted. 
 Assist with the interpretation of user requirements into feasible options and communicate these back to the business stakeholders. 
 Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary. 
 Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements – verbally or through written documentation – to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood. 
 Provide guidance and/or instruction to junior staff members. 
 
 
What it Takes to Succeed! 
 
 Formal Education & Certification 
 College diploma or university degree in the field of business administration, computer science, finance, or information systems 
 Three to five years’ related work experience 
 
 Knowledge & Experience 
 Demonstrated knowledge of the organization’s core business process and operations 
 Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development 
 Experience overseeing the design, development, and implementation of software and hardware solutions, systems, or products 
 Ability to create systematic and consistent requirements specifications in both technical and user-friendly language 
 Exceptional analytical and statistical skills with the ability to apply them to systems issues and products as required 
 Clear understanding of product management and market placement 
 Demonstrated project management skills and project management software skills, including planning, organizing, and managing resources 
 Understanding of application development and software development life cycle concepts 
 Experience with databases and systems that enable real-time decision making 
 Working technical knowledge of programming languages including Kafka, Spark, Python, PowerBi and MSSQL 
 Working knowledge of network and PC operating systems, including Windows 10 & 11, Server 2016 through 2019 and Centos/Ubuntu 
 Working knowledge of containers, Kubernetes and public cloud providers 
 Working knowledge of current network hardware, protocols, and standards 
 Extensive experience with the organization’s core software applications, including Dynamics Business Central, Office 365, Site Tracker, Salesforce 
 Excellent understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives 
 
 
Personal Attributes 
 Able to exercise independent judgment and take action on it 
 Excellent analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills 
 Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills 
 Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail 
 Highly self-motivated and directed 
 Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure 
 Strong customer service orientation 
 Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment 
 What you’ll get 
 
 Competitive pay reflective of your skills and experience level 
 Health, Dental & Vision benefits. New! Employee Assistance Program (EAP) 
 Paid time off including vacation, holidays, sick leave, bereavement & parental leave 
 
 About Advantage Resourcing 
 Advantage Resourcing is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all persons regardless of race, color, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy, medical condition, genetic information, mental and physical disability, political affiliation, union membership, status as a parent, military or veteran status or other non-merit based factors. We will provide reasonable accommodations throughout the application, interviewing and employment process. If you require a reasonable accommodation, contact us. This policy is applicable to all phases of the employment relationship, including hiring, transfers, promotions, training, terminations, working conditions, compensation, benefits, and other terms and conditions of employment. 
 All employees are directed to familiarize themselves with this policy and to act in accordance with it. All decisions with respect to employment matters and other phases of employer-temporary employee relationships will be in keeping with this policy and in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations.

Title: Loan Closing Analyst Sr - Commercial - Pittsburgh, PA 15219 - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Profile
 
Position Overview
 
At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. In Commercial Lending Operations, we want to inspire new and innovative ideas on how to provide “best in class” service to our customers. As a Loan Closing Analyst Sr - Commercial, you will be based in Pittsburgh, PA; Kalamazoo, MI; Brecksville, OH; Miamisburg, OH; Houston, TX; Dallas, TX; or East Brunswick, NJ.
 
We seek motivated, driven and creative individuals that enjoy working as part of a team in a high-energy environment which thrives on innovation and ingenuity. You will work together to create new solutions which will provide our clients with an exceptional customer experience. Valued opinions, supported by collaborative teams, impact the success of Commercial Lending Operations.
 
The schedule for this position is Monday through Friday, Daylight hours.
 
Job Description
 
Closes varied and more complex loans without supervision and disburses loan funds. Prepares and/or reviews all loan documents for completeness and accuracy with discretion. Independently weighs financial risks.
 Independently reviews documentation and verifies work processes to ensure completeness, accuracy and conformance to established service levels and applicable policies and procedures. Reviews complex loan-closing documentation based on approval documentation. Responsible for sharing best practices with team members and recommending process improvements. Represents department on projects and initiatives. Participates on deal team with negotiations of the legal documentation. Reviews and validates due diligence associated with project or transaction with discretion.
 Partners with internal and/or external business partners to route communications, documents or other action items to complete transactions. Identifies and may address exceptions; escalates appropriately. May interact with customers and/or have assigned accounts or portfolios.
 Provides responses and documentation to inquiries and ad hoc requests. Completes loan set up sheets and other necessary documentation for entry into the bank's loan system.
 May schedule time frames at discretion for loan closings in light of loan commitments and customer needs.
 
PNC Employees take pride in our reputation and to continue building upon that we expect our employees to be:

Products and Services – Knowledge of major products and services and product and service groups; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.
 
Standard Operating Procedures – Knowledge of and ability to design, implement and evaluate standard operating procedures affecting daily and strategic business operations in order to increase operational efficiency.
 
Work Experience

Bachelors

Title: Sr Business Analyst - Montvale, NJ 07645 - Indeed.com
Description:
Company Profile 
 
 Click to see how you can paint your future! 
 
 The color of pride: Benjamin Moore is proud to be a part of Berkshire Hathaway, which was recognized by Fortune magazine as the world'sfourth most admired company. And for more than 130 years we've been a respected leader in the architectural coatings and home décor landscape; creating the products and tools that enrich and beautify thousands of communities each day. We recognize that our associates are the driving force behind our success and we strive to provide a work environment where hard work, creativity and purposeful collaboration are fostered and encouraged. 
 
 Job Summary: 
 
The Sr. Business Analyst will document technical solutions to business challenges, to advance the company's efforts, by defining, analyzing and documenting requirements. The Sr. Business Analyst will follow the proper process and procedures by using the templated project artifacts and carrying out the project activities as stipulated by the IT Program Management Office. 
 
 Responsibilities: 
 
 Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis. 
 Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. 
 Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: (Functional requirements (Business Requirements Document), Use Cases, Use Interface Document) 
 Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously and capable of managing projects of various sizes and complexity 
 Work independently with users to define concepts and partner with Project Managers 
 Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans 
 Serves as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development team through which requirements flow. 
 Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language. 
 Create test cases from user scenarios and assume the testing lead role when necessary 
 Strong ability to collaborate with senior leadership, senior technologists, Business Partners and people at all levels to define business processes, analyze operational efficiencies, implement creative solutions and measure delivery results 
 Understands the business processes associated with the project and ensure the solution is designed and built to meet business requirements 
 Act as the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams. 
 
 Required Skills: 
 
 Bachelor's degree in Business (or Management), Computer Science, or related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required 
 Advanced degree preferred 
 7+ years of experience with formal Business Analysis 
 Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) certification required 
 Strong process orientation with significant attention to detail and ability to document complex business processes 
 Effective interpersonal skills with the ability to participate in and lead "Virtual" teams 
 Knowledge of relational databases, data warehousing, business intelligence and CRM tools 
 Experience in using enterprise-wide requirements definition and management systems and methodologies required 
 Strong analytical skills are required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into an application and operational requirements. 
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts. 
 Advanced skills in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Visio 
 Working knowledge of Project Management processes, tools and techniques in an organization with multiple projects varying in size and complexity 
 Six Sigma Black Belt certification preferred

From generous benefits to a variety of employee resource groups, we strive to build paths that encourage employees to stretch themselves professionally. We want to help you grow, develop, and learn new things. You’re constantly evolving, so shouldn’t your opportunities be, too? 
 The Opportunity
 Ally's residual setting team delivers results that are industry leading in residual performance and critical to the success of Ally's lease business. The Senior Analyst Business Analytics will be responsible for deployment of residuals, data analysis, reporting and solutions in support of strategic residual setting. The role will continuously optimize and automate data solutions, reporting and residual setting processes. 
 The Work Itself

Support ad-hoc reporting, analysis, and presentations 
Residual Setting Processes & Support

 The Skills You Bring
 Bachelor's degree in related field

 Strong financial analytical skills 
 Ability to simplify complex problems and develop creative solutions 
 Organizational and interpersonal skills 
 How We'll Have Your Back
 Ally's compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and pay-for-performance incentives (bonuses) based on achieving personal and company goals. But Ally’s total compensation – or total rewards – extends beyond your paycheck and is designed to support and enrich your personal and professional life, including: 
Time Away:  competitive holiday and flexible paid-time-off, including time off for volunteering and voting. 
Planning for the Future:  plan for the near and long term with an industry-leading 401K retirement savings plan with matching and company contributions, student loan and 529 educational assistance programs, tuition reimbursement, and other financial well-being programs. 
Supporting your Health & Well-being:  flexible health and insurance options including dental and vision, pre-tax Health Savings Account with employer contributions and a total well-being program that helps you and your family stay on track physically, socially, emotionally, and financially. 
Building a Family:  adoption, surrogacy, and fertility support as well as parental and caregiver leave, back-up child and adult/elder day care program and childcare discounts. 
Work-Life Integration:  other benefits including LifeMatters® Employee Assistance Program, subsidized and discounted Weight Watchers® program and other employee discount programs. 
Who We Are: 
Ally Financial is a customer-centric, leading digital financial services company with passionate customer service and innovative financial solutions. We are relentlessly focused on "Doing it Right" and being a trusted financial-services provider to our consumer, commercial, and corporate customers. For more information, visit www.ally.com. 
Ally is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace.  Overview: 
This technical analyst role will require advanced leadership and communication skills, and the successful candidate will need to drive efforts to completion across different lines of business and third party solutions.
 
Performs technical analyst responsibilities relating to information technology implementations, upgrades, conversions associated to a 3rd party telephony platform. Provides analytical support for information technology projects. Develops and revises project materials and maintains project documentation. Recommends improvements in project deliverables. Works on projects under minimal supervision, with general guidance from more seasoned technical analysts, architects and managers.
 
The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to analyze data, positively influence partners, and continuously seek opportunities to improve the telephony platform and process.
 
 Responsibilities: 
 
 Provides business analysis and technical support for modification, implementation, or conversion of business applications and telephony systems. 
 Translates business needs into functional/technical requirements.

 Attend project meetings and technical working groups (architects, developers, network/infrastructure partners and third party vendors) and produce organized and coherent meeting notes and action plans 
 Responsible for helping to plan, coordinate, and delivery of defined deliverables which usually requires engagement from multiple teams such as a project or smaller program. 
 Communicates the work objectives, coordinates delivery, manages risks, ensures compliance to standards, and provides end-to-end visibility into the health of the technical deliverables. 
 Ensures execution and delivery meets the client’s expectations in terms of the functionality, quality, timeline and cost. 
 Plans and coordinates delivery and dependencies with across multiple teams. 
 Facilitates dependency management/risk management/impediment removal for the defined deliverables. 
 Promotes/facilitates communication and collaboration across organizations to support the deliverable completion and timeline. 
 Gathers/facilitates status updates for the deliverables to leadership pertaining to delivery, risks/issues, and schedule. 
 Ensures that execution is aligned with deliverable requirements by working with the change manager. 
 
 Required Skills: 
 
 Requires 5-7 years of experience

 Strong attention to detail 
 SAFe certified PO/PM 
 Ability to independently manage workload 
 Proven problem solving/ root cause analysis skills

Title: Senior Financial Analyst - Claremont, NC - Indeed.com
Description:
SENIOR FINANCIAL ANALYST | Position Overview & Benefits
 Our client is a brand leader in the consumer goods industry and looking for a Senior Financial Analyst with manufacturing experience. Consumer goods background is a plus. 
 POSITION SUMMARY: 
 
The Sr. Financial Analyst will take an active role in the manufacturing financial and operational reporting process. Among their responsibilities, the Sr. Financial Analyst will perform month end close duties, monthly reporting, ad hoc analysis, budgeting, and forecasting. 
 
PRIMARY FUNCTIONS: 
 
 Assist and prepare annual budget and monthly forecast
 Build bottoms up budget and forecast models 
 Develop cost of material models that incorporate trends, expected product mix and pricing changes by location 
 Work with corporate on occupancy models to ensure proper estimates 
 Develop all other operating cost models to ensure accuracy 
 Load forecast and budget into Essbase 
 Work w/ Inventory team to create basic business reports.
 Prepare and distribute budget and forecast p/ls 
 Monthly close activities
 Research variances versus budget, forecast and prior year 
 Recommend and prepare journal entries (i.e. accruals, deferrals, reclasses) 
 Prepare and distribute company-level p/ls, building p/ls, departmental actuals vs forecast 
 Assist with profitability analysis on business changes (i.e. price increases, wage rates, efficiencies, expansion, etc.) 
 Assist the overall team with product profitability reviews and analysis at the collection and product level 
 Analyze and document recurring expenses such as maintenance service agreements, supplies, etc. to develop an understanding and identify cost saving opportunities 
 Prepare weekly and monthly scorecard for distribution to management 
 Assist in reporting and analysis on business issues (i.e. root cause analysis, failed scans, days to receive, inventory turns, etc.) 
 Prepare weekly labor reporting to management 
 Develop SOPs, work instructions and process flows charts around critical operational processes with financial impact 
 Prepare ad-hoc reporting as needed for executive leadership 
 
 MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: 
 
 A Bachelor degree in accounting or finance 
 3-5 years experience in a similar role 
 Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite with advanced Excel skills 
 Experience with accounting and ERP software, SQL, and Power BI 
 Strong problem-solving skills, including the ability to effectively address issues in collaboration with others as appropriate 
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
 Ability to analyze data and produce reports to assist operations 
 Ability to work well under pressure and effectively handle multiple, concurrent demands and appropriately prioritize responsibilities 
 
 PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: 
 
 Experience in manufacturing 
 Experience with Oracle, DAX2009, D36C

Requirements 
 
 Bachelor's degree from an accredited school

 Product Design Analyst With a minimum of 3 years of experience facilitating meetings with stakeholders to develop design and technical requirements

Title: Senior Data Informatics Analyst - San Ramon, CA 94583 - Indeed.com
Description:
Robert Half is seeking a  Senior Data Informatics Analyst  to be part of the Financial Data and Analytics (FD&A) Team. FD&A team has a centralized ownership of our Finance & Accounting reporting infrastructure including Data Governance, Batch Reporting, Analytics and Tools & Technology. Our team works with all sub-teams in Corporate Accounting globally to ensure our data definitions and accounting and finance glossaries are accurate and up to date. We participate in the Business Analytics Council and collaborate with D&A teams throughout the organization. We also produce batch reporting for Finance & Accounting and maintain the reporting tools and technology like SAP Business Objects, Domo, Workday-Prism Analytics. We provide Data Analytics support by bringing data and dashboard solutions to key decision-makers. 
 
Specific responsibilities include:
 Manage BI Tools/Systems
 Develop architecture/implementation plans for Business Intelligence projects.
 Manage/maintain business security model, ensuring that access to data systems are granted to authorized individuals only. Provide Security changes as needed
 Participate in the selection and testing of new BI technologies, including proof of concept and comparison analysis
 Provide system-level support and expertise
 Validate Installation, patching, & configuration of BI environment, ensuring that customer base can effectively use the tool
 Develop standards and guidelines for the effective and efficient delivery of enterprise BI, including operational reporting, dashboarding, and business analytics across the spectrum of descriptive to prescriptive
 Monitor BI application, ensuring that services are running and performing optimally and that production certified content is running as planned

 Strategy / Business Development/Consulting / Support

 Effectively anticipate how business users will interact with semantic model, and build accordingly for maximum user adoption

 Envision new ways to utilize and promote BI technology across the company

 Business Intelligence Configuration, Support and Data Modelling
 Analyze new/existing data sources and determine most efficient table relationships (evaluating primary keys and indexes) and model in semantic modeling tool (Universe Designer) for ease of use by business users
 Integrate data structure and business rules into common semantic model, allowing business users to pull data from a common definition
 Partner with business data owners to define metrics and maintain data definitions on-going
 Implement and maintain data governance employing Master Data Management methods
 Regularly evaluate semantic models for improvement
 Determine appropriate user cases for compatible query mode versus dynamic query mode
 Evaluate opportunities for data improvements, recommending summary tables, materialized views, cubes, or separate data marts to data services partners
 Assist in the ongoing development of technical best practices for data movement, data quality, data cleansing, data security and privacy.
 Subject Matter Expertise (SME) / Training / Mentoring
 Advanced knowledge of BI architecture and tool sets

 Prepare data from cloud data sources (Salesforce, Workday, AWS, etc.) and in-network data warehouses using cloud ETL
 Organize an Analyst Community and hold regular forums to discuss successes and challenges, and inform of new product enhancements
 Advanced Analytics
 Understanding of new and advanced analytics including various tools SAP Business Objects Lumera, Tableau, Domo, Workday Prism Analytics, Cognos and PowerBI
 Participate in the selection and testing of new advanced analytics tools, including proof of concept and comparison analysis.
 Assist in designing the dashboard solutions including KPIs, drill-down capabilities for customers using BI advanced analytic tools.

Description:
Airgas’ Rotational Career Program (ARC) is a highly competitive two year program for recent college graduates designed to accelerate professional growth by providing training, exposure and experience in a variety of key functional areas that impact our business. Participants will work directly with leaders and mentors who can contribute to their career development in addition to helping them build technical and leadership skills. By the end of the rotational program, participants who have demonstrated exceptional performance and leadership will have the opportunity to be placed into a role within the business based on their accomplishments as well as current business needs.

Within our program we have an Industrial Engineer role that will consist of three, eight month assignments throughout the Operations function within Airgas. The candidate will gain a well-rounded perspective from various areas of our business; some examples include: Plant Operations, Supply Chain and Logistics and Project Management and Efficiency. 
 
Program Highlights: 
 Three, eight month rotational job assignments designed to accelerate the development of critical industry knowledge skills and experience

Challenging projects that foster innovative and creative thinking

Opportunities to participate in leadership development activities and networking events

Title: Bus Analytics Consultant Sr - Office of the Customer Data Management - Pittsburgh, PA 15222 - Indeed.com

Job Profile
 
Position Overview
 
At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. As a Business Analytics Consultant Sr within PNC's Office of the Customer Data Management, you will be based in Pittsburgh, PA or Cleveland, OH.
 
 
 Looking for a data analyst 
 Skill set including querying multiple databases to compare data and draw conclusions 
 Experience with data quality analysis preferred 
 Would like to have someone who has experience leading initiatives and driving results beyond just conducting analysis 
 
Job Description
 
Leverages complex analytical tools to provide business and technical expertise for the analytics process, tools and useful applications across multiple functions or business units to create data driven solutions.
 Consulting to clients on tool and strategy implementation and monitoring, statistical scoring, business intelligence, data quality, and analytical product / solution development.
 Determining the optimal analytic approach and supporting development, implementation and enhancements.
 Conceptualizing, developing and continuously optimizing analytical solution for operations and executive management to enable data driven decision making.
 Analyze results and make recommendations for key business partners and senior management or communicate conclusions from complex analytical solutions to a wide range of audiences.
 
PNC Employees take pride in our reputation and to continue building upon that we expect our employees to be:
 Customer Focused - Knowledgeable of the values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions and able to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions.
 Managing Risk - Assessing and effectively managing all of the risks associated with their business objectives and activities to ensure they adhere to and support PNC's Enterprise Risk Management Framework.
 
Competencies
 
Analytical Thinking – Knowledge of techniques and tools that promote effective analysis and the ability to determine the root cause of organizational problems and create alternative solutions that resolve the problems in the best interest of the business.
 
Business Acumen – Knowledge, insight, and understanding of business concepts, tools, and processes that are needed for making sound decisions in the context of the company's business; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.
 
Business Analytics – Knowledge of technologies, techniques and practices for the evaluation of business performance data; ability to analyze business performance using advanced statistical methods to justify and drive future business planning decisions.
 
Consulting – Knowledge of techniques, roles, and responsibilities in providing technical or business guidance to clients, both internal and external; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.
 
Decision Making and Critical Thinking – Understanding of the issues related to the decision-making process; ability to analyze situations fully and accurately, and reach productive decisions.
 
Effective Communications – Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors.
 
Emerging Technologies – Knowledge of and ability to design, apply and evaluate new information technologies for business environments in order to improve work productivity and accuracy.
 
Work Experience
 
Roles at this level typically require a university / college degree, with 3+ years of relevant / direct industry experience. Certifications are often desired. In lieu of a degree, a comparable combination of education and experience (including military service) may be considered.
 
Education
 
Bachelors

Depending on your eligibility, options for full-time employees include medical/prescription drug coverage (with a Health Savings Account feature); dental and vision options; employee and spouse/child life insurance; short- and long-term disability protection; maternity and parental leave; paid holidays, vacation days and occasional absence time; 401(k), pension and stock purchase plans; dependent care reimbursement account; back-up child/elder care; adoption assistance; educational assistance and a robust wellness program with financial incentives. To learn more about these and other programs, including benefits for part-time employees, visit pncbenefits.com > New to PNC .

Title: Workforce Analyst - St. Louis, MO 63105 - Indeed.com
Description:
About Working at Commerce 
Wouldn’t it be great to build your career at a bank that’s known for helping people with their financial challenges? That’s exactly what you’d be doing when you join the team at Commerce Bank. We’re looking for teammates who are ready to do whatever it takes to help our customers with their everyday financial needs. You’d be helping yourself too, because Commerce has a tradition of recognizing and rewarding team members for their talent, skills and contributions. 
No wonder we’ve been an industry leader for over 150 years and have developed a reputation as a great place to work in the financial services world. If you’d like to be a part of a team and culture that is respected by its peers and in your community, we should talk. We’re always looking for the best and brightest. 
About This Job 
As a Workforce Analyst you will analyze data, understand workforce and labor market trends, and integrate all of this information to use in consulting with senior leaders on workforce related issues. You will use data to effectively paint a picture of the Retail workforce landscape that is easily understandable and consumable. 
Essential Functions 
Monitor key metrics related to the Retail workforce 
Coordinate with Talent Management, Talent Acquisition, Learning & Development to understand, forecast, and report staffing trends 
Serve as the Retail subject matter expert on the Workforce Cloud system 
Consult with stakeholders on workforce related metrics and Workforce Cloud adherence 
Conduct periodic staffing forecasts 
Update staffing level information and compares to staffing forecasts 
Identify and report current and projected staffing challenges using Workforce Cloud 
Conduct what-if scenarios in Workforce Cloud to understand projected impacts on business decisions related to the network

Title: Sr. Analyst, Data Management - Philadelphia, PA 19103 - Indeed.com
Description:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the worlds best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.
 Job Summary The data management team’s focus is uniform access and complete transparency for Comcast data assets to enable informed business decisions that drive profitable growth. Manage the complete project lifecycle for new data integration, data integrity and data standardization centered on single source of truth.
 Job Description
 
 Responsibilities: 
A Comcast EBI Data Management analyst will be expected to execute and/or support the following responsibilities:
 Collaboration with stakeholders to understand their business needs and inform the development roadmap for new and existing data products
 Become the subject matter expert in the data and be able to articulate how it benefits business stakeholders
 Capture and document business requirements from stakeholders and users, and coordinate with data architects and engineers to translate business requirements into actionable technical requirements
 Complete data discovery to identify new data sources in the data environment that could potentially provide insights to the business, and complete data profiling so that other users will understand how to use the data as well as what results are expected
 Support data engineers through the development process, providing prioritization of work, clarity on requirements, and insight to problem-solving
 Put together a thorough testing plan on new or enhanced data products to validate that new development work meets the need of the business requirements, and objectively demonstrate data accuracy and quality
 Collaborate with knowledge management resources to create documentation for new data products, and updates for existing data products
 Provide user support on generally available data products, answering questions about how to use the data and proactively notifying the user community of issues and changes
 Provide regular status updates to leadership team
 This role in particular will focus on data products that support Finance functional area, including customer profitability, lifetime value and national subscribers’ initiatives.
 Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
 Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
 Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
 
 Required Skills and Experience: 
BA/BS degree in Computer Science. Minimum of 3-5 years relevant work experience
 Ability to analyze data and work independently
 Good organizational and interpersonal skills with the ability to work with various functional areas, including field, Region, Division and Corporate personnel
 Strong SQL skills are required. Hands on experience with Teradata/Hive/AWS/Presto is plus
 Good understanding of different RDBMS and Database concepts, Streaming data and Data flow processes are required
 Good knowledge of data governance, database structures, theories, principles, and practices.
 Analytical and problem solving skills, applied to big data domain is required
 Knowledge or prior experience of data ingestion between big data and other RDBMS platforms is a plus
 
 Employees at all levels are expected to: 
Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
 Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
 Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
 Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
 Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
 Drive results and growth.
 Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
 Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.
 
 Disclaimer: 
This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications.
 
Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer.
 Education

 Relevant Work Experience
 5-7 Years

The Business Information Analyst ensures that the business reporting needs are properly analyzed and are correctly reflected in the approach the team adopts in order to generate the envisioned solution. The Business Information Analyst is responsible for capturing business requirements, communicating business requirements and context to an offshore development team, collaborating with the offshore development team to create report prototypes, review test scenarios and configure or build a solution that meets business needs. The Business Information Analyst also mentors staff to enable self-service reporting. 
They currently use Business Objects for reporting, SQL Server for their Data Warehouse, and are just starting with Power BI. They are open to someone with any sort of similar reporting tool (like OBIEE) as long as they are willing to learn BO and Power BI. This person also needs to understand Data warehousing concepts.

Crystallizes Acceptance Criteria on requirements. Interprets business requirements and collaborates with the offshore development team to build models & options. Communicates the context to the offshore development and Quality Assurance (QA) teams. Responsible for frequently communicating the model and the evolving solution, in the form of options and demos to the business roles, to ensure that they address the business need. Ensures coverage for offshore QA team’s test scenarios for functional and technical testing – the solution must be fit for purpose. Aids in User Acceptance Testing. Aids in the project planning process by developing a list of tasks & estimates. Supports the development of the business training curriculum Educates users on BI functionality through structured training sessions and open forum workshops Works with business and technical roles to establish tools to measure success criteria. Responsible for capturing the business definition of key metrics and documenting the data in the universes. May aid in the creation of business policies and procedures.

 Responsibilities

Constantly works to identify opportunities for improvement in work process and reports. 
Utilizes Quest Analytics software to produce detailed maps, network adequacy reports, Health Service Delivery (HSD) tables for CMS and member/employee’s accessibility to Fallon Health’s providers (PCP’s, Specialists, Hospitals, etc).

Title: Sr. Project Analyst - Change Coordination - Las Vegas, NV - Indeed.com
Description:
Join TuSimple and help change the way the world moves. Together we're making freight transportation safer, more efficient, and more environmentally friendly. 
 This opportunity is located in Tucson, AZ. 
 
You can apply to the job with this email address:pmo__quality_engineering___sr__project_analyst_86a31f482us@ivy.greenhouse.io 
 
 Company Overview 
 
Come join a higher calling and find a deeper purpose! 
 
As a multi-national Artificial Intelligence Technology Company, we are at the epicenter of the Autonomous Vehicle Universe. Our breakthroughs are leading the industry in autonomous trucking. 
 
While inventing the framework of Autonomous Driving, our current fleet of autonomous Trucks are helping communities receive much-needed supplies and medical equipment around the clock. Our people are some of the most talented engineers and contributors who are leaving behind a historic legacy. 
 
TuSimple was founded half a decade ago with the goal of bringing the top minds in the world together to achieve the dream of a driverless truck solution. With a foundation in computer vision, algorithms, mapping, and Artificial Intelligence, TuSimple is working to create the first global commercially viable  Autonomous Freight Network. 
 
 
Opportunity Overview 
 
TuSimple's  Senior Project Analyst  provides overall technical and program management support for assigned projects/programs. The Senior Project Analyst creates and maintains project/program documentation, prepares short-term look ahead schedules, monitors and analyzes project/program risk and coordinates project/program activities, as assigned. 
 
Join us and be a part of excellence! 
 
 
Role Responsibilities 
 
 With basic direction, works with project leads, prepares and updates detailed project plans, deliverable timelines, KPIs and milestones. 
 Conducts workload planning, tracking and forecasting. Proposes streamlines to workflows. 
 Evaluates potential project risks and recommends solutions. 
 Researches, monitors, and analyzes data to provide business insights. 
 Effectively collaborates with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to monitor project KPIs, proactively overcome project challenges and assist with risk mitigation. Ensures project team members meet assigned project deliverables and deadlines. Escalates updates and information as necessary. 
 Coordinates, tracks and maintains all project documentation, including project plans and objectives, deliverables, timelines, resource plans, communications, and meeting minutes. Updates documentation, as necessary. 
 Coordinates and facilitates meetings. Prepares agendas, presentations and all other necessary meeting materials. Takes meeting minutes and distributes accordingly. 
 Updates and maintains project related pages, dashboards and other relevant data. 
 Gathers and integrates project performance and progress information. Prepares detailed status reports which include: latest accomplishments, upcoming deliverables, project metrics and risk analysis. 
 Provides recommendations for improving internal processes and documents all approved process changes. 
 Manages and enhances existing controlled documentation programs. 
 Manage quality of change implementation plans while optimizing implementation cost and planning. 
 Manage quality of impact analysis of changes, to minimize processing time and reliable planning. 
 Organize and chair cross sector project change control board for impact analysis, planning and disposition of changes 
 Recognize and advise on scope of change requests (scope control, new or update change) 
 Coordinate and coach cross-sector project team on the product change process 
 Monitor and control the implementation of approved changes. 
 Monitor and give feedback on changes being processed according to agreed policy. 
 Be involved in embedding improvements delivered from the roadmap on operational level. 
 Contribute to development of TuSimple quality systems. 
 Manages the distribution of documentation to approved groups (i.e. Sourcing, Service, Production, etc.). 
 Assigns new part numbers, creates, and maintains accuracy of manufacturing business systems Bill of Materials (BOM) 
 Proven ability to effectively support several projects or a full program, simultaneously. 
 Ability to read and understand a project and program plans. Ability to draft a 3 week look-ahead schedule requiring only minor edits. 
 Ability to understand project or program documentation, work with source owners to effectively maintain and update, per agreed processes. 
 Demonstrated ability to effectively influence for routine project needs. 
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Capable of listening and obtaining clarification, adapting approach or method to best fit the situation. 
 Strong interpersonal skills; capable of collaborating with multiple stakeholders, understanding and interpreting stakeholder needs . 
 Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team; capable of effectively interacting with technical staff. 
 Strong organizational skills, ability to coordinate multiple tasks and support projects of varying complexity concurrently. 
 Demonstrated excellence with planning, time-management, prioritization and successful execution of multiple simultaneous assignments. 
 Proven ability to work under firm deadlines in a fast-paced environment. 
 Ability to maintain steady professionalism throughout aggressive deadlines, changing priorities, and evolving operations, as common to progressive start-up environments. 
 
 
Experience & Skills Required 
 
 Associate's Degree or above in Electrical/Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field 
 2+ years of Project Coordination or Project Analyst experience. 
 5+ years of work experience of with at least 2 year's experience in new product introductions or configuration management 
 Requires combination of specialist (Configuration Management) and project management skills 
 Appliance of organizational change management techniques 
 Proven analytical and conceptual skills combined with business sense 
 Know upstream impact of changes (e.g. logistics, operation, customer support) 
 Proven experience in managing multiple changes, configurations and their dependencies 
 Configuration Management certification (CMII module 1-6) is preferred 
 Personal skills 
 Natural leader in providing structure, prioritization and decisiveness 
 Persistent and persuasive towards results in an emphatic and pragmatic manner 
 Convincing, pro-active attitude and drive for improvement 
 Sensitive on value of relations: entrepreneur, coalition former, networker, good facilitator 
 Create learning situations and give feedback to achieve effective behavior from a team 
 Strong communicator to influence without power 
 Eager to learn and ability to self-reflect 
 Adapts and adopts change 
 
 
TuSimple Benefits 
 
 100% employer-paid healthcare premiums for you and your family 
 Breakfast, lunch, and dinner served every day 
 Full kitchens on every floor with unlimited snacks, drinks, special treats, fruits, meals, and more 
 Gym membership reimbursement 
 Monthly team building budget 
 Learning/education budget 
 Employer-paid life insurance 
 Employer-paid long and short disability
