He or she helps to create and implement the people analytics roadmap from infrastructure to advanced analytics, and provides input on data reliability, refresh rates, and HRIS functionality. The Senior Data Analyst II collects, compiles, and analyzes comprehensive HR data, metrics, and statistics, for required reporting, and to provide data summaries and analysis in order to support leadership with making people decisions related to retention, salary budget, recruitment, and legal compliance. 
 
They are adept at using various data software and tools, and know how to capture and display impactful root-cause and predictive information in ways that resonate with their audience. 
 
Role Responsibilities 
 In accordance with TuSimple's objectives and policies and employment laws and legislation, develops and implements advanced and overarching data analyses, data collection methodologies, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality of critical HR data. 
 Collects and compiles HR people data from a variety of sources including the human resource information system (HRIS). 
 Owns all HR people data reporting such as monthly headcount, headcount projection, turnover and attrition, payroll, and employee data changes. 
 Creates and maintains visualization tools, including dashboards, and obtains feedback on usability and functionality. Ensures data can be leveraged at the level required to draw insights. 
 Maintains the quality and consistency of HRIS database information; analyzes current data processes and needs, makes recommendations for, and implements data system improvements. 
 Conducts periodic audits to ensure data consistency and reliability among multiple tools and data sources; provides suggestions for automation of processes (e.g., scripts); identifies discrepancies and suggests solutions and revised data ownership; helps track on-going improvements to mitigate future risks. 
 Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets. Develops people metric insights and creates methods for root cause and predictive analysis. 
 Assists in coaching and knowledge sharing with Business HR and HR Operations in order to move into a more data-driven function. Provides support on the best way to use reports and other HR tools and technologies. 
 Assists in the process cycles for merit increases and bonus disbursements; reviews proposed salary increases and bonus payouts. 
 Creates standard management reporting capturing all People Analytics for periodic/quarterly/annual distribution. 
 Contributes to a data-driven culture, and mentors more junior members of the broader HR team in regards to data processes. 
 Experience & Skills Required 
 Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Statistics, Business Administration, Economics, Finance, or Human Resources, or a related field. 
 6+ years of experience in reporting and data analytics, including 2+ years working in an HR capacity/environment 
 Deep statistical, qualitative, and quantitative analysis skills, with the proven ability to utilize data to influence decisions. 
 Strong ability to perform advanced formulas, power query, tables, conditional formatting, complex pivot tables, VBA and macros. 
 Strong understanding of applicable data sources, tables, and data relationships. 
 Experience developing and maintaining data in a relational database environment, such as SQL Server DBA 2005 or later versions. 
 Previous experience with Paycom, Dayforce, Workday or other HRIS systems. 
 Advanced MS and/or Google Suite skills; ability to build, maintain, and optimize complex spreadsheets and meaningful presentations. 
 Experience visualizing data and communicating complex information to technical and non-technical audiences; strong foundation in using statistical and data visualization tools (e.g. SPSS, r. Tableau, Python, PowerBI, etc.) 
 Solid working knowledge of Human Resources policies, procedures and best practices, including solid knowledge of Federal, State and local employment laws. 
 Proven ability to de-construct complex data, concepts, and issues, translating into concise recommendations that successfully navigate to resolution, in an organized and methodical framework. 
 Strong analytical execution with thoroughness, accuracy, and focus on data integrity. 
 Strong database management skills including the ability to merge, clean and analyze large amounts of data. 
 Effective written and verbal communication skills. 
 Excellent executive presentation skills: ability to extract, analyze and present actionable information from complex research. 
 Able to identify risks and opportunities, brainstorm innovative solutions, and drive actions to quick resolution 
 
 Behavioral Competencies 
 
 Strong ability to actively seek opportunities to consult, influence, build and sustain successful relationships and gain alignment with peers, functional partners and/or external partners to accomplish business objectives. 
 Develops new insights into situations; questions conventional approaches; encourages new ideas and innovations; designs and implements new or cutting-edge programs and processes. Ability to generate and/or recognize imaginative or creative solutions that generate successful outcomes. 
 Solid interpersonal skills and the ability to appropriately communicate with a wide range of individual constituencies in a diverse community. Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing, including translating technical language to a non-technical nature. 
 Works independently and fosters a cooperative spirit within a large and/or small team of diverse cultures, while working in a fast-paced environment with multiple deadlines and frequently changing priorities 
 Entrepreneurial self-starter, with proven ability to effectively work in ambiguous environments and support continuous improvement. 
  Intellectually curious with a strong bias to action. 
 Data-driven, fact-based decision maker with established understanding of business implication. 
 Highly resourceful, a demonstrated history of independently locating information and resources necessary to accomplish objectives. 
 Ability to quickly build trust and rapport with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders. 
  Strong presentation skills with the ability to confidently present to senior management, the Board of Directors, and outside partners. 
 Comfortable working in an evolving and growing environment that is prone to changes, and managing multiple projects simultaneously. 
 Demonstrated experience building and improving processes and promoting quality. 
 Demonstrated ability to manage multiple concurrent assignments while meeting deadlines and demanding quality execution. 
  Proven ability to work in a matrix organization, tech start-up experience preferred. 
 Proven ability to maintain steady leadership throughout aggressive deadlines, changing priorities, and evolving operations, as common to progresive start-up environments. 
 
 Preferred Skills and Experience 
 
 Preferred Master's in Business Administration, Accounting, Statistics, Economics, Finance, or Human Resources, or a related field.

Title: Quantitative Analytics & Model Development Analyst Senior - Quality Assurance/Quality Control - Pittsburgh, PA 15222 - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Profile
 
Position Overview
 
At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. As a Quantitative Analytics & Model Development Analyst Sr. within PNC's Balance Sheet Analytics & Modeling Quality Assurance/Quality Control (BSAM QA/QC) you will be based in Pittsburgh, PA, Birmingham, AL, or Houston or Dallas, TX, Washington D.C., Tyson's Corner, VA, or NYC, NY. Remote locations may be considered.
 
As a Quantitative Analytics & Model Development Analyst, Sr. in the team, you will have the opportunity to participate in the review and challenge of a wide array of activities performed by the BSAM organization, primarily focused on supporting the estimation, review, and presentation of credit loss reserves. Duties generally involve performing quantitative analytics to assess and challenge activities relating to model/non-model development, implementation, change management, and execution, as well as reserve adequacy and reasonableness.
 
The successful candidate will be intellectually curious, with a passion for “opening up the hood and figuring out how it works.” The candidate will have strong background in statistics and programming, with a proven ability to analyze a complex system or problem, assess strengths and weaknesses of an argument, and design tests to effectively challenge stated conclusions.
 
 Required: 
 
 Bachelor’s degree in a STEM or Finance related field 
 Strong coding background (Python or R), with an emphasis on big data analytics 
 3 + years of related experience in Banking or Finance 
 Strong technical writing skills, with an ability to communicate ideas and concepts to non-technical audiences 
 A desire to seek out opportunities for improvement of current practices and a willingness to ask questions and to suggest enhancements or alternatives 
 
 Preferred: 
 
 Graduate degree in STEM or Finance related field 
 Statistical coding experience in either R or Python (systems design and implementation experience a plus) 
 Firm understanding of accounting and/or credit loss reserving (particularly CECL) 
 Experience performing effective challenge duties in banking or financial services (model validation, internal/external audit, credit risk management, etc.) 
 Experience with credit loss forecasting for consumer loans 
 CFA, FRM, or other similar professional designation 
 Please note, PNC will not sponsor a work visa for this position. 
 
Job Description
 
Independently performs advanced quantitative analyses and model development to drive decision-making by running quantitative strategies. Makes recommendations based on analyses.
 Analyzes and develops new model frameworks by supporting the line of business. Refines, monitors, and reviews existing models. Conducts on-going communication with model owners and model developers during the course of the review. Works with larger, more complex datasets to create models.
 Performs quantitative analysis and develops complex reports. Performs qualitative and quantitative assessments of all aspects of models including theoretical aspects, model design and implementation as well as data quality and integrity. Analyzes complex data and associated quantitative analysis. Makes recommendations based on findings from data analytics.
 Uses quantitative tools and techniques to measure and analyze model risks and reaches conclusions on strengths and limitations of the model.
 Prepares and analyzes detailed documents for validation and regulatory compliance, using applicable templates.
 
PNC Employees take pride in our reputation and to continue building upon that we expect our employees to be:
 Customer Focused - Knowledgeable of the values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions and able to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions.
 Managing Risk - Assessing and effectively managing all of the risks associated with their business objectives and activities to ensure they adhere to and support PNC's Enterprise Risk Management Framework.
 
Competencies
 
Bank Quantitative Analysis – Knowledge of and ability to use numerical methods to develop statistical models for devising trading strategies.
 
Consulting – Knowledge of techniques, roles, and responsibilities in providing technical or business guidance to clients, both internal and external; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.
 
Data Gathering and Reporting – Knowledge of and ability to utilize tools, techniques and processes for gathering and reporting data in a particular department or division of a company.
 
Effective Communications – Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors.
 
Predictive Analytics – Knowledge of, experience with and ability to use the tools, processes and practices for predicting business trends and providing forecasts that drive business decisions and business planning.
 
Quantitative Techniques – Knowledge of and ability to use quantitative tools and techniques to measure and analyze risks.
 
Regulatory Environment - Financial Services – Knowledge of and ability to help an organization adapt to applicable federal, state, local, and company-specific regulations, policies, and guidelines affecting business practices.
 
Testing – Knowledge of and ability to plan, implement and manage testing strategies, policies and practices that assure the delivery of high quality applications.
 
Work Experience
 
Roles at this level typically require a university / college degree, with 3+ years of relevant / direct industry experience. Certifications are often desired. In lieu of a degree, a comparable combination of education and experience (including military service) may be considered.
 
Education
 
Bachelors
 
Additional Job Description
 
Benefits
 PNC offers employees a comprehensive range of benefits to help meet your needs now and in the future. Depending on your eligibility, options for full-time employees include medical/prescription drug coverage (with a Health Savings Account feature); dental and vision options; employee and spouse/child life insurance; short- and long-term disability protection; maternity and parental leave; paid holidays, vacation days and occasional absence time; 401(k), pension and stock purchase plans; dependent care reimbursement account; back-up child/elder care; adoption assistance; educational assistance and a robust wellness program with financial incentives. To learn more about these and other programs, including benefits for part-time employees, visit pncbenefits.com > New to PNC .
 
 Disability Accommodations Statement: 
The PNC workplace is inclusive and supportive of individual needs. If you have a physical or other impairment that might require an accommodation, including technical assistance with the PNC Careers website or submission process, please call  877-968-7762  and select Option 4: Recruiting or contact us via email at pathfinder@pnc.com.
 
The Human Resources Service Center hours of operation are Monday - Friday 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM ET.
 
 Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO): 
PNC provides equal employment opportunity to qualified persons regardless of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or other categories protected by law.
 
California Residents
 
Refer to the California Consumer Privacy Act Privacy Notice to gain understanding of how PNC may use or disclose your personal information in our hiring practices.

Title: IT Business Analyst - Cambridge, MA 02142 - Indeed.com
Description: Primary Talent Partners has a 12 month contract opening for an IT Business Application Analyst to join a multinational pharmaceutical company in Cambridge, MA. This will be a hybrid working model with 3 days in your local office and 2 days working remotely each week. There is a strong possibility that this contract will extend beyond 12 months. Position Description:  You will be working in our Early Biologics Discovery group, which develops and leverages innovative technologies for target discovery and proactive campaign execution. Our central scientific data management system is used to register and retrieve information for the group and department. This system is integrated into many workflows already through its API (Application Programming Interface), and we are constantly seeking to automate new data processes. Additionally, we are working towards an integrated BioCAD tool, AUTOBAN, which generates predictive parameters for Client protein designs and aggregates them into a single interface for enhanced knowledge-based decision making. In this position, we are looking for an individual with programming and database experience to facilitate the development of out-of-the-box tools which integrate into our scientific data management ecosystem. To fundamentally enable AUTOBAN, we need to ensure that our lab data is consistently available for automated modeling and analysis. This requires that our data registration and structured data capture solutions are developed to make data creation and upload a seamless and quick process. Our central data management system’s API and underlying relational database will be key to creating these solutions. We are also seeking to further develop our automated analysis capabilities which pull data directly from this database. These efforts will center around our Early Discovery projects and must provide extensible and reproducible insights into our experimental data. We are open to individuals with less life science experience with the intention of providing exposure to someone from a computer science background. That exposure would happen through empirically testing their work and iterating as much as possible. Responsibilities:  Main focus of this role will be to to design/develop automated workflows for current process and database. extends the functionality of the API of an internally used scientific database. Gathering requirements Defining application architecture Unit testing of deliverables Automating Dotmatics data entry Updates and retrieval through custom python scripts APIs and Jupyter notebook entries Developing widgets for various data handling/visualization job aids Qualifications:  A bachelor's degree or higher in the following areas: computer science, bioinformatics, biological engineering, biomedical engineering, or another relevant field. Open to Associates degree with commensurate experience level. Fluency in Python. Experience with the Python packaging ecosystem is a plus. Strong data workflow automation experience Linux and bash experience. Git. Familiarity with Jenkins or other CI/CD systems is a plus. Working with API’s (Application Programming Interface) Candidate should have an understanding of Software Development Life Cycle Methodologies. Candidate may have previous Software Developer/UI experience Should have experience interacting with data and using ease-of-use tools. Preferred experience and skills:  Some knowledge in the life sciences (molecular biology, genetics, protein expression, protein engineering). Fluent in at least one language other than Python (e.g., JavaScript/TypeScript, OCaml, R). Experience with databases (should know SQL). Experience with database design is a plus. Application programming experience Experience with web app design and development is a plus. Experience with Jupyter notebooks/conda is a plus. Job Types: Full-time, Contract Pay: $40.00 - $45.00 per hour Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Python: 1 year (Preferred) Linux: 1 year (Preferred) GIT: 1 year (Preferred) Application Programming Interface: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: One location

Job Profile
 
Position Overview
 
At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. In Commercial Lending Operations, we want to inspire new and innovative ideas on how to provide “best in class” service to our customers. As a Loan Closing Analyst Sr - Commercial, you will be based in Pittsburgh, PA; Kalamazoo, MI; Brecksville, OH; Miamisburg, OH; Houston, TX; Dallas, TX; or East Brunswick, NJ.
 
We seek motivated, driven and creative individuals that enjoy working as part of a team in a high-energy environment which thrives on innovation and ingenuity. You will work together to create new solutions which will provide our clients with an exceptional customer experience. Job Description
 
Closes varied and more complex loans without supervision and disburses loan funds. Prepares and/or reviews all loan documents for completeness and accuracy with discretion. Independently weighs financial risks.
 Independently reviews documentation and verifies work processes to ensure completeness, accuracy and conformance to established service levels and applicable policies and procedures. Reviews complex loan-closing documentation based on approval documentation. Responsible for sharing best practices with team members and recommending process improvements. Represents department on projects and initiatives. Participates on deal team with negotiations of the legal documentation. Reviews and validates due diligence associated with project or transaction with discretion.
 Partners with internal and/or external business partners to route communications, documents or other action items to complete transactions. Identifies and may address exceptions; escalates appropriately. May interact with customers and/or have assigned accounts or portfolios.
 Provides responses and documentation to inquiries and ad hoc requests. Completes loan set up sheets and other necessary documentation for entry into the bank's loan system.
 May schedule time frames at discretion for loan closings in light of loan commitments and customer needs.

Demonstrated ability to work well with teams or individually with minimal supervision

Experience with operational communications

Title: Financial Systems Analyst - Westerville, OH 43081 - Indeed.com
Description:
FINANCIAL SYSTEMS ANALYST 
 Contract to hire opportunity 
 JOB OBJECTIVE: 
 To analyze, design, and introduce accounting data flow, accounting processes, and financial and analytical reporting solutions founded on leading edge technologies. Recommends and implements methods for increasing efficiency and profitability by analyzing financial business practices and accounting processes to suggest improvement regarding topics from budgeting and cash operations to fiduciary management. Work with individuals across the organization to ensure seamless integrations of the organization’s business system platforms with the General Ledger systems and supporting data warehouses. Create operational efficiency through innovation and continuous improvement. 
 ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 
 Work within cross-functional groups to support all aspects of the organization’s financial reporting and audit requirements. 
 Partner with the business team, users, and customers to elicit requirements and document financial reporting or integration issues. 
 Support financial audit and regulatory compliance requirements. 
 Work alongside Information Technology business analysts and application developers to evaluate the impact of new or change business application development on existing financial reporting processes to mitigate downstream impacts. 
 Identify, improve, and develop technology solutions that drive organization’s financial strategic goals. 
 Conduct financial reporting risk assessments along with fit gap and cost analysis for proposed business solutions. 
 Troubleshoot existing financial and business application/system components to determine system reporting or integration issues. 
 Work directly with third party solution providers to understand their products and develop technical financial system integration specifications. 
 Interact with finance leaders and third-party solution providers to assist in maintaining and updating financial system applications. 
 Design business financial reporting solutions to maximize the use of a single source of financial information. 
 Analyze and recommend new financial system technologies, services and ideas to improve financial tracking and processing efficiencies. 
 Analyze data and financial reporting processes to provide recommendations on system modifications and designs to continually improve and streamline workflows. 
 Develop ad hoc financial management reports and dashboards as needed or requested by business or financial leadership. 
 Work with business and QA to prepare test plans and evaluate test results for business application implementations through financial journal entries and management reports. 
 Work with finance applications’ owners to provide backup and support of application security and maintenance. 
 Present financial technical solutions, create supporting materials, and train finance or accounting staff on the correct usage of the organization’s various technologies to accomplish business tasks. 
 Investigates compliance/regulatory issues and concerns and recommends appropriate business solutions and/or strategies based on those issues 
 Construct reconciliation methodologies and ensure the proper coding/reporting needed to ensure core business systems, data warehouses and financials are balanced, or alerts are immediate when out of balance situations occur. 
 
 OTHER FUNCTIONS: 
 Be available for consulting and technical assistance for production problem resolution for daily or month end close and posting issues. 
 Work with IT QA to perform manual or automated application integration testing to ensure financial transaction process correctly. 
 Creates reconciliation scripts to ensure business systems and financial applications are synchronized and balanced. 
 Create strong collaborative relationships with business and IT to provide consulting about financial impacts and considerations. 
 
 KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: 
 
 Bachelor's degree with a major in accounting or computer science or related field from an accredited college or university is strongly preferred; commensurate experience may be considered. 
 A minimum of five years full time or equivalent part time paid experience with a property/casualty or workers’ compensation insurance carrier or equivalent insurance program is required. 
 Strong understanding of accounting processes, data flows, and business system’s impact on accounting. 
 Excellent analytic, communication and problem-solving skills. 
 Detail-oriented with the ability to rapidly learn and take advantage of new concepts, business models, and technologies. 
 Strong understanding the functional accounting applications, business operations and technical flow of any business application. 
 Highly motivated, a quick learner, works independently or on a team to drive solutions with minimal supervision. 
 Experience and strong SQL knowledge and able to demonstrate competency in querying databases. 
 Training or knowledge in property-casualty insurance and statutory accounting rules and procedures. 
 
 ADDITIONAL DETAILS: 
 Due to the volume of responses, only the most qualified candidates to the job requirement can be contacted. 
 We appreciate all our applicants, but we are not able to sponsor now; no C2C or H-1B. 
 There is no ‘per diem’ with this position and must be able to work on W-2 hourly basis. 
 There is no relocation budgeted for this position. If this position requires you to relocate you will be responsible for those costs.

Title: Business Analyst - Clackamas, OR 97015 - Indeed.com
Description:
Opti Staffing is hiring! 
 
 Position:  Business Analyst 
 
 Location:  SE Portland (Clackamas) 
 
 Pay:  $21.60-26.44, D.O.E. 
 
 
 
 Job description 
 
Our client is one of the largest meat distributors in the Pacific Northwest. They are looking for a Business Analyst to join their technology team and assist with the market analysis of existing products. This position will be responsible for performing in-depth market analyses and creating procedures to help ensure quality control. Additionally, the successful candidate will be able to identify and fix system errors in a timely manner and keep a constant stream of communication between our team and clients.
 
 
 Responsibilities: 
 
 Leads the analytical efforts and works collaboratively with the team to meet customer and Company' s daily business needs. 
 
 Daily Sales Reporting Management. 
 
 Daily review of orders to ensure all are in line with forecasts, as well as daily and seasonal demand fluctuations. 
 
 Assist with conference calls, as well as Home Office meetings. 
 
 Assists with planning by providing current sales trend information, analysis, and insights to ensure customers and Company' s objectives are met. 
 
 Daily forecast tracking at SKU level, by DC, to ensure all settings are optimized. 
 
 Perform New Item creation utilizing One World Sync. 
 
 Develop and maintain business systems documentation. 
 
 Provide troubleshooting and problem-solving assistance to users. 
 
 Evaluate business processes to identify opportunities for improving efficiency or effectiveness. 
 
 Prepare data for analysis. 
 
 Perform analyses to support proposals and decisions. 
 
 Design technical specifications for business systems. 
 
 Participate in business process re-engineering activities. 
 
 Work effectively in a team environment. 
 
 
 
 Qualifications: 
 
 Bachelor' s Degree or equivalent Walmart Retail Link experience preferred. 
 
 High level of Excel and PowerPoint experienced required. 
 
 Prefer experience in rep agency or multiple suppliers and/or retailers. 
 
 Proven ability to make sound decisions and take action on them independently. 
 
 Proven ability to prioritize and ability to troubleshoot problems. 
 
 Ability to make recommendations for solutions based on information gathered and analyzed from the systems listed above. 
 
 Advanced technical, report running and analytical abilities. 
 
 Strong verbal and written communication skills. 
 
 
 
 COVID-19 considerations: 
 
 Currently, ALL employees are required to wear a face mask inside any of our buildings, whether vaccinated or not. As a large employer, we do encourage all employees to get vaccinated. 
 
 
 
If you are interested in this position, we want to hear from YOU! 
 
Contact Megan at Opti to secure your interview today! If you cannot get a hold of Megan, contact her partner, Arie!

Title: Purchasing Business Analyst - Columbus, OH 43085 - Indeed.com
Description:
Summary 
The Worthington Industries Rotation Experience & Development (WIRED) Program candidate will participate in a 12-18 month rotational program in which they will be responsible for developing knowledge and business skills in the manufacturing industry, while building strong relationships during each rotational assessment. The WIRED program is to provide the knowledge and resources to accelerate the learning curve at Worthington Industries. The Business Analyst works closely with several individuals at each rotation to ensure development goals are met. Strong emphasis will be placed on the ability to grow deep knowledge of the functional area. The analyst will be exposed to many facets of the business including on-site work in specified rotations. The career path will vary widely depending on interest, career alignment, and overall business need.
 Key Duties & Responsibilities 
Manage inventory levels in facilities and work with the internal purchasing team, operations teams, and suppliers
 Maintain system integrity to accurately reflect delivery dates 
Expedite orders and follow up on late orders 
Monitor suppliers to ensure products arrive on time and are managed if not 
Manage quality issues and return process 
Participate in quarterly business reviews with suppliers 
Involved in departmental projects focus on reducing operating costs
 Negotiate with suppliers to reduce cost and contract development/management 
Work cross functionally across Worthington to provide accurate and timely communications 
Gain exposure to international supply base
 Critical Skills, Knowledge & Abilities 
Strong organizational skills 
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal 
Good interpersonal skills and ability to work well in a team environment 
Strong leadership characteristics 
Demonstrated integrity, values, principles, and work ethic align with Our Philosophy 
Self-starter with good project management skills 
Good customer service orientation with ability to establish professional working relationships with internal/external customers and co-workers 
Actively seeks career-development opportunities and builds new skills through training and reading of professional literature 
Ability to see how assigned work fits into the larger picture and affects other areas so that issues outside original scope of work may be identified 
Education/Travel Required 
Education/Travel Required 
Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent work experience (supply chain, purchasing, transportation) 
3.0 GPA or above preferred 
Community and/or collegiate involvement 
Willingness to relocate for a 4-6 month rotation 
Travel 10-25% 
Worthington Industries (NYSE:WOR) is a leading global industrial manufacturing company delivering innovative solutions to customers that span many industries including transportation, construction, industrial, agriculture, retail and energy. Worthington is North America’s premier value-added steel processor and producer of laser welded products; and a leading global supplier of pressure cylinders and accessories for applications such as fuel storage, water systems, outdoor living, tools and celebrations. The Company’s brands, primarily sold in retail stores, include Coleman®, Bernzomatic®, Balloon Time®, Mag Torch® and Well-X-Trol®. Worthington’s WAVE joint venture with Armstrong is the North American leader in innovative ceiling solutions. 
 Headquartered in Columbus, Ohio, and founded in 1955, the Company follows a people-first philosophy with earning money for its shareholders as its first corporate goal. Relentlessly finding new ways to drive progress and practicing a shared commitment to transformation, Worthington makes better solutions possible for customers, employees, shareholders and communities. 
Alternate Locations:

Equivalent Experience

Title: Quality Analyst - Chappaqua, NY 10514 - Indeed.com
Description:
The primary goal of the Quality Data Analyst is to use data science and analytics to support the improved health of our patients and the value-based performance of our physicians. This individual will report to the Manager, Quality Analytics and will work with the VP of Quality and Physician Enablement to design, produce, validate, and distribute highly visible clinical quality & performance reports based on measure specifications provided by CMS, HEDIS and other measure stewards. The Quality Data Analyst is responsible for evaluating key population health metrics and presenting findings to senior leaders and physicians in order to support the design, development, and implementation of Population Health programs that improve performance of health outcomes across multiple populations. The Quality Data Analyst will work closely with IT and Decision Support teams to institutionalize best-in-class analytics, develop proprietary scalable dynamic reports, and improve population health programs. The position requires strong analytic and organizational skills, initiative, ability to work independently, and a willingness to help develop a robust quality reporting infrastructure. This position will require collaboration with data owners and functions across the organization. 
Key Responsibilities (including but not limited to the following): 
 Participating in the development of analytical tools and performance reports that will monitor organizational progress against clinical quality measures and health outcomes. Providing required analysis in order to understand clinical quality performance based on guidelines provided by CMS, HEDIS, and other measure stewards.
 Designing and constructing data tables, schemas, dashboards, and visualizations related to clinical quality performance. Managing data from key payors including Medicaid, Medicare, and commercial insurers. Designing, building, and optimizing predictive models to risk stratify patients for clinical intervention. Developing, validating, and distributing gaps in care lists for providers and clinical staff. Providing the reports and analysis required to effectively support the annual quality submission via the CMS web interface.
 Performing hands-on tasks, including data acquisition from disparate systems, data transformation and analysis, benchmarking, and communicating insights. Participating in periodic data quality reviews/audits by insurance companies, certifying bodies and assisting with investigations as needed to address areas of concerns.
 Performing data validation tests to ensure data completeness and accuracy. Collaborating with IT, Decision Support, and external vendors to identify infrastructural improvement opportunities and develop new solutions that improve Quality performance. Collaborating with Clinical Operations team, including providers, managers, staff and administration to analyze performance, design and implement work flow processes that improve patient care and quality outcomes. Supporting the design and development of provider compensation models to align incentives with value-based payment contracts. Supporting Business Leads in evaluation of quality incentive programs and negotiations of new value-based payment models. 
Education and Experience Requirements: 
 Four-year degree in quantitative discipline from an accredited institution required such as Business, Economics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Epidemiology, Healthcare Administration; Master's degree in a data-related field preferred. 2-6 years of experience working in an analytics or consulting role in managed care, population health, or health insurance required; Decided advantage for candidates with demonstrable experience with Quality Analytics and working knowledge of ACO GPRO or MA HEDIS, CAHPS/HOS measures. Previous experience working with large databases, e.g. health insurance claims databases, data warehousing, and/or database administration preferred; experience with encounter submissions a plus. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel; including pivot tables, linked spreadsheets, lookup formulas, and graphing; proficiency in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint. Ability to query systems, abstract data, and clearly summarize and present actionable data.
 Knowledge and proficiency in SQL, SAS, Tableau/Power BI; SSRS. EMR (Next Gen) experience a plus. Working knowledge of medical coding preferred (CPT, HCPCS, ICD). Key traits – quantitative analysis skills, critical thinking skills, entrepreneurial spirit, creativity, leadership, self-starter, results orientation, ability to balance multiple projects, attention to detail. 
Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. CareMount will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance. 
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. CareMount is an EO employer – M/F/Veteran/Disability

Title: Digital Forensic Analyst - Phoenix, AZ 85001 - Indeed.com
Description:
Overview:
 
We are seeking experienced professionals with two years of forensic or I.T. experience to join our team immediately at IST Management as Digital Forensic Analyst. The Digital Forensic Analyst will execute data preservation and digital investigations as they pertain to complex litigation support, drawing from a wide variety of (ESI) electronically stored information and data sources and using a diverse portfolio of ESI tools including Magnet Axiom, Cellebrite, and Access Data FTK. Ideal candidates will need to be fluent in network and system architecture with a strong understanding of computer systems. 
About Us 
IST Management is a business process outsourcing company. We have over 1,500 employees and have been in business for over 23 years with operations in over 50 cities across the U.S. We provide a range of services geared toward litigation and corporate office support including e-Discovery services such as processing, hosting, court reporting, collections/forensics, managed review, and managed services. IST Management is a Relativity Certified Provider. We also provide a full range of facilities management and office services. 
We’ve been recognized as one of the fastest-growing companies in the U.S. as a winner of the Nation’s Best & Brightest Companies to Work For, as well as the HR Professional Excellence Award from the Society for Human Resource Management. We are proud to belong to the Military Spouse Employment Partnership through our nation’s Department of Defense and have committed to Hiring Our Heroes’ mission to hire 100,000 active and former service members in 2021. IST Management has also been included in the INC 5000 list! 
Location:  Remote position supporting Washington state area 
Benefits Include:  Medical, Dental, Vision, STD, LTD, Life, 401k, and Paid Time Off 
Co mpensation:  $55,000 per year (based on experience) 
Responsibilities:
 
The Digital Forensic Analyst will execute data preservation and digital investigations as they pertain to complex litigation support, drawing from a wide variety of (ESI) electronically stored information and data sources and using a diverse portfolio of ESI tools. Responsibilities include: 
Investigative analysis, data restoration and conversion of digital devices and data sets, including digital devices and storage, cloud based media, and servers; seizure and retention of related materials 
Identify potential security threats and perform periodic discovery scans to identify potential gaps in data sets 
Adherence to Digital Forensic best practices and methodologies
 Work directly with both internal teams and external clients to deliver results, including preparation and presentation of reporting to both management and clients, presentation of technical findings to clients who are not familiar with the environment and display of professionalism and warmth when representing IST Management
 Litigation support from case scoping call to review 
Qualifications:
 
To be considered a candidate for the Digital Forensic Analyst role, you must have 2 years’ experience in a similar role, and/or fluency in the following tools and functions: 
Understanding of evidence management practices, and ability to collect and analyze data from wide array of ESI 
Understanding of rules of evidence ACPO guidelines, ISO17025, and Chain of Custody 
Magnet Axiom, Cellebrite, or Access Data Forensic Tool Kit experience 
Certifications CFCE, ACE, and CHFI are preferred 
Experience in SQL is preferred 
Computer science or criminal justice degree preferred 
Ability to receive a private investigators license 
Candidates must also be authorized to work for any employer in the US and have a high school diploma or GED 
Your Safety and Well-Being 
The interview process for IST Management can consist of a combination of phone conversations, video interview, and written assessment forms. Final round interviews will be held in person at our corporate office in Atlanta, GA. Out of an abundance of caution due to covid19 - we thoroughly screen candidates prior to in person interviews in order to limit the number of individuals we bring into our office space. 
IST provides reasonable accommodations to individuals with a disability in accordance with applicable law in both the application and employment stages. If you require any accommodation in completing your application for employment, please inform the National Director of Talent Acquisition, Sydney Ayers, by following this link http://www.istmanagement.com/talent-acquisition-team.html for direct contact information. 
Please respect individuals reaching out about accommodations by utilizing the contact information only for this purpose, or for assistance with your submission. You will receive correspondence from your local IST Management hiring team regarding your application submission and status if you were able to do so successfully.

With an ever-present eye on financial performance, evaluation of growth opportunities, and strong attention to cost-effectiveness, the Financial Analyst strives to maintain responsible stewardship of the company’s funds while ensuring RCA is appropriately positioned for success. Specific Responsibilities:  Responsible for the day-to-day general ledger accounting and reconciliation, financial reporting and analysis for assigned functional areas. Maintains and balances subsidiary ledger accounts by verifying, allocating, reconciling transactions, resolving discrepancies. Perform monthly balance sheet, income statement and changes in financial position/budget variance analysis. Prepare financial reports, charts, tables and other exhibits as requested Partner with supervisor and site leadership in site budget preparation. Work closely with site leadership. Investigate and report to the manager any inconsistencies or improprieties. Analyze data to ensure proper accounting procedures have been followed. Title: SimCorp Dimension Senior Business Analyst - McLean, VA - Indeed.com
Description:
At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation.
 As part of Freddie Mac’s return to the office pilot, all employees, contingent workers and visitors must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to be on-site unless they have an approved accommodation. 
Position Overview: 
The Investment & Capital Markets (ICM) department in Finance is seeking a highly motivated hands-on Senior Business Analysis to join our SimCorp Application Support Team. In this role, the individual will support business as usual (BAU), change management, user access testing (UAT) and business management activities across ICM Finance. 
The ideal candidate will have at least 5 years experience using SimCorp Dimension (SCD) to identify and solve for challenges in both BAU and UAT. This position will involve partnering effectively with various business and IT stakeholders and will require solid communication skills, ability to build relationships and drive a consistent agenda. The ideal candidate is a "self-starter" with a desire to understand accounting concepts and a passion for change management. 
Apply now and learn more about our benefits and why there’s #MoreAtFreddieMac! 
Our Impact: 
Our team is responsible for supporting Freddie Mac’s accounting book of reference (ABOR) and investment book of records (IBOR) platform for Fixed Income, Exchange Traded and over the counter (OTC) Derivatives. Our goal is to collaborate with our key Stakeholders within the ICM Division to support their business requirements and help drive change throughout all aspects of the Front to Back Office trade lifecycle. 
Your Impact: 
Your Impact Falls into Three Primary Categories 
Application Support 
Manage SimCorp Dimension enhancements, break-fixes, and small projects in both BAU and UAT independently and as part of the team with internal and external stakeholders 
Demonstrate ownership of problems, issues, or requests from start to finish. Facilitate appropriate handoffs, but track the item through resolution. Escalate proposed or actual solutions that do not adequately resolve the problem or satisfy the stated need. 
Work independently while driving and managing assignments from concept through deployment/launch 
Project Management / Collaboration 
Interact and communicate effectively with business and IT partners to solve issues or business challenges 
Work with project teams and stakeholders to ensure that business requirements gaps or issues are resolved in a transparent and timely manner 
Work with different teams to identify opportunities for efficiency in project planning and execution to provide the business with solutions at the lowest cost while balancing risk appropriately 
Work with business partners to document and understand requirement needs and challenge the team to create inspiring solutions 
Be a liaison between the business area customer/user, testing groups and development groups to ensure that scope items for a release are accurately implemented and tested from the business perspective 
Analytics 
Leverage mortgage experience to ensure that functional requirements / use cases are fully developed, communicated and understood 
Solve complex business issues by putting pieces together and understanding how our systems work 
Strong SQL database querying skills a plus and 
Qualifications: 
Minimum 5 years of business analysis and SCD experience in the mortgage industry, with a strong understanding of Fixed Income products and Interest Rate Derivatives 
Understanding of SCD FAP/FAM configurations, Portfolio Calculation, and Message Queues 
Bachelors Degree or equivalent work experience; advanced studies/degree preferred 
Proven knowledge of strategic planning and execution, project management, and best practices implementation 
Experience in the primary/secondary mortgage market, preferably underwriting and/or credit analytics 
Ability to rapidly learn key business design concepts of given project being developed and internal project tools and project management methodology / related processes 
Ability to support multiple concurrent high priority projects in various capacities (i.e., lead one or more projects while supporting one or more projects) 
Ability to analyze, document, develop and manage complex business processes, think analytically and solve problems 
Ability to work collaboratively with key internal stakeholders, external customers, external stakeholders and matrixed teams 
Project management experience using standard project management tools; collecting, writing and maintaining business requirements; maintaining action item trackers, issue and risks logs; managing budgets and reporting and facilitation of effective project team meetings; ability to work as an influence 
Strong accounting background with general ledger/subledger expertise a plus 
SCD Data Warehouse experience a plus 
Keys to Success in this Role: 
Strong knowledge and expertise with SimCorp Dimension 
Strong verbal and written communication skills including the ability to develop and deliver presentations to multiple types of audiences and ability to interact cross-functionally and drive both business and technical discussions 
Self-starter / independent thinker: demonstrated ambition to take on new roles with increasing responsibility with limited guidance and direction from management 
Strong business analysis skills and experience with agile / waterfall methodologies 
Proven track record of driven, results-oriented, creative and nimble problem-solving capabilities and a willingness to do “whatever it takes” to deliver business value quickly 
Current Freddie Mac employees please apply through the internal career site. 
Today, Freddie Mac makes home possible for one in four home borrowers and is one of the largest sources of financing for multifamily housing. Join our smart, creative and dedicated team and you’ll do important work for the housing finance system and make a difference in the lives of others. 
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will ensure that individuals with differing abilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. 
Notice to External Search Firms: Freddie Mac partners with BountyJobs for contingency search business through outside firms. Resumes received outside the BountyJobs system will be considered unsolicited and Freddie Mac will not be obligated to pay a placement fee. If interested in learning more, please visit www.BountyJobs.com and register with our referral code: MAC.

Job Category:Information Technology 
FLSA Status:Exempt

Title: Senior Analyst Medical Device Epidemiology and Real World Data Sciences - New Brunswick, NJ 08901 - Indeed.com
Description:
Kelly is currently seeking a Senior Analyst, Medical Device Epidemiology and Real World Data Sciences for a long-term engagement with one of our Global Medical Device clients. 
 This person will join our Kelly FSP (Functional Service Provider) division, a managed solution provider and business unit of Kelly. This role is full-time and is offering full benefit options. As a Kelly FSP employee you may be eligible for Medical, Dental, Vison, 401K, and a variety of other benefits to choose from. You may also be eligible for paid time off, including holiday, vacation, and sick/personal time. 
 Principal Duties 
 The Senior Analyst will partner closely with colleagues from the broader organization to extract raw data from servers, create analytical data files, and execute statistical analyses based on protocol specifications. In support of European Union Medical Device Regulation (EU-MDR) compliance and Medical Safety, the successful candidate's responsibilities will include overseeing, executing, and/or reviewing code for analyses against in-house observational data resources, including administrative healthcare claims, surveys, and electronic health records, as well as consultation and support to evaluate data external to J&J. The position will be primarily responsible for developing code sets for team approval, creating data specification files and analytical files by writing and executing programs across our available observational databases, executing statistical analyses conducting quality assurance and code validation, reviewing programming code and data, drafting analysis reports, and supporting the final publication/presentation of results as part of an overall observational study. 
 
 Education and/or Experience 
 A degree in Biostatistics, Public Health, Epidemiology, Informatics, Computer Science or other related field is required. 
 At least 5 years of experience in statistical programming (e.g. R, SAS), and/or database programming (e.g. SQL) is required. 
 At least 5 years of experience in programming against large healthcare datasets is required. 
 At least 2 years of relevant prior work experience in the healthcare industry within a pharmaceutical or device company, insurer, or within a health system is required. 
 In-depth knowledge of the structure and caveats of healthcare claims databases, electronic medical records and/or hospital billing data is required 
 Knowledge in epidemiologic and statistical concepts such as confounding, bias, cumulative incidence, incidence rate, regression models, survival analyses 
 Strong written and verbal communication skills 
You should know:  Your safety matters! Vaccination against COVID-19 may be a requirement for this job in compliance with current client and governmental policies. A Kelly recruiter will confirm and share more details with you during the interview process.
 Why Kelly ® ? 
 
Kelly® Science & Clinical is your connection to premier scientific and clinical companies looking to hire talented people just like you. Every day, we match science professionals with dream jobs that fit their skills and interests—it’s the way we think job searching should be. Nearly 100 percent of our science recruiters have a professional background/education in science, so we know a thing or two about the science market and how to get you noticed.
 About Kelly ® 
 At Kelly, we’re always thinking about what’s next and advising job seekers on new ways of working to reach their full potential. In fact, we’re a leading advocate for temporary/nontraditional workstyles, because we believe they allow flexibility and tremendous growth opportunities that enable a better way to work and live (plus, did we mention we provide a ton of benefits?). Connecting great people with great companies is what we do best, and our employment opportunities span a wide variety of workstyles, skill levels, and industries around the world.
 Kelly is an equal opportunity employer committed to employing a diverse workforce, including, but not limited to, minorities, females, individuals with disabilities, protected veterans, sexual orientation, gender identity. Equal Employment Opportunity is The Law.

Title: Sr. Project Analyst - Change Coordination - Houston, TX - Indeed.com
Description:
Join TuSimple and help change the way the world moves. Together we're making freight transportation safer, more efficient, and more environmentally friendly. 
 This opportunity is located in Tucson, AZ. 
 
You can apply to the job with this email address:pmo__quality_engineering___sr__project_analyst_86a31f482us@ivy.greenhouse.io 
 
 Company Overview 
 
Come join a higher calling and find a deeper purpose! 
 
As a multi-national Artificial Intelligence Technology Company, we are at the epicenter of the Autonomous Vehicle Universe. Our breakthroughs are leading the industry in autonomous trucking. 
 
While inventing the framework of Autonomous Driving, our current fleet of autonomous Trucks are helping communities receive much-needed supplies and medical equipment around the clock. Our people are some of the most talented engineers and contributors who are leaving behind a historic legacy. 
 
TuSimple was founded half a decade ago with the goal of bringing the top minds in the world together to achieve the dream of a driverless truck solution. With a foundation in computer vision, algorithms, mapping, and Artificial Intelligence, TuSimple is working to create the first global commercially viable  Autonomous Freight Network. 
 
 
Opportunity Overview 
 
TuSimple's  Senior Project Analyst  provides overall technical and program management support for assigned projects/programs. The Senior Project Analyst creates and maintains project/program documentation, prepares short-term look ahead schedules, monitors and analyzes project/program risk and coordinates project/program activities, as assigned. 
 
Join us and be a part of excellence! 
 
 
Role Responsibilities 
 
 With basic direction, works with project leads, prepares and updates detailed project plans, deliverable timelines, KPIs and milestones. 
 Conducts workload planning, tracking and forecasting. Proposes streamlines to workflows. 
 Evaluates potential project risks and recommends solutions. 
 Researches, monitors, and analyzes data to provide business insights. 
 Effectively collaborates with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to monitor project KPIs, proactively overcome project challenges and assist with risk mitigation. Ensures project team members meet assigned project deliverables and deadlines. Escalates updates and information as necessary. 
 Coordinates, tracks and maintains all project documentation, including project plans and objectives, deliverables, timelines, resource plans, communications, and meeting minutes. Updates documentation, as necessary. 
 Coordinates and facilitates meetings. Prepares agendas, presentations and all other necessary meeting materials. Takes meeting minutes and distributes accordingly. 
 Updates and maintains project related pages, dashboards and other relevant data. 
 Gathers and integrates project performance and progress information. Prepares detailed status reports which include: latest accomplishments, upcoming deliverables, project metrics and risk analysis. 
 Provides recommendations for improving internal processes and documents all approved process changes. 
 Manages and enhances existing controlled documentation programs. 
 Manage quality of change implementation plans while optimizing implementation cost and planning. 
 Manage quality of impact analysis of changes, to minimize processing time and reliable planning. 
 Organize and chair cross sector project change control board for impact analysis, planning and disposition of changes 
 Recognize and advise on scope of change requests (scope control, new or update change) 
 Coordinate and coach cross-sector project team on the product change process 
 Monitor and control the implementation of approved changes. 
 Monitor and give feedback on changes being processed according to agreed policy. 
 Be involved in embedding improvements delivered from the roadmap on operational level. 
 Contribute to development of TuSimple quality systems. 
 Manages the distribution of documentation to approved groups (i.e. Sourcing, Service, Production, etc.). 
 Assigns new part numbers, creates, and maintains accuracy of manufacturing business systems Bill of Materials (BOM) 
 Proven ability to effectively support several projects or a full program, simultaneously. 
 Ability to read and understand a project and program plans. Ability to draft a 3 week look-ahead schedule requiring only minor edits. 
 Ability to understand project or program documentation, work with source owners to effectively maintain and update, per agreed processes. 
 Demonstrated ability to effectively influence for routine project needs. 
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Capable of listening and obtaining clarification, adapting approach or method to best fit the situation. 
 Strong interpersonal skills; capable of collaborating with multiple stakeholders, understanding and interpreting stakeholder needs . 
 Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team; capable of effectively interacting with technical staff. 
 Strong organizational skills, ability to coordinate multiple tasks and support projects of varying complexity concurrently. 
 Demonstrated excellence with planning, time-management, prioritization and successful execution of multiple simultaneous assignments. 
 Proven ability to work under firm deadlines in a fast-paced environment. 
 Ability to maintain steady professionalism throughout aggressive deadlines, changing priorities, and evolving operations, as common to progressive start-up environments. 
 
 
Experience & Skills Required 
 
 Associate's Degree or above in Electrical/Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field 
 2+ years of Project Coordination or Project Analyst experience. 
 5+ years of work experience of with at least 2 year's experience in new product introductions or configuration management 
 Requires combination of specialist (Configuration Management) and project management skills 
 Appliance of organizational change management techniques 
 Proven analytical and conceptual skills combined with business sense 
 Know upstream impact of changes (e.g. logistics, operation, customer support) 
 Proven experience in managing multiple changes, configurations and their dependencies 
 Configuration Management certification (CMII module 1-6) is preferred 
 Personal skills 
 Natural leader in providing structure, prioritization and decisiveness 
 Persistent and persuasive towards results in an emphatic and pragmatic manner 
 Convincing, pro-active attitude and drive for improvement 
 Sensitive on value of relations: entrepreneur, coalition former, networker, good facilitator 
 Create learning situations and give feedback to achieve effective behavior from a team 
 Strong communicator to influence without power 
 Eager to learn and ability to self-reflect 
 Adapts and adopts change 
 
 
TuSimple Benefits 
 
 100% employer-paid healthcare premiums for you and your family 
 Breakfast, lunch, and dinner served every day 
 Full kitchens on every floor with unlimited snacks, drinks, special treats, fruits, meals, and more 
 Gym membership reimbursement 
 Monthly team building budget 
 Learning/education budget 
 Employer-paid life insurance 
 Employer-paid long and short disability

Hiring, transferring and promotion practices are performed without regard to the above-listed items.

Title: Analyst - Moreno Valley, CA - Indeed.com
Description: HB Staffing is currently assisting The City of Moreno Valley in their need to have an experienced Administrative Professional temporarily join them. This is an excellent opportunity to get your foot in the door with The City! Details:  Duration: Temporary; 3-6 months Schedule: 8am-5pm; Monday-Friday (Non-remote, in office only) Pay Rate: $34/84-$49.05/hour DOE Location: Moreno Valley Job Duties:  Plans, organizes and conducts complex administrative, management and program analyses relating to assigned issues and/or programs; identifies problems, determines analytical techniques and statistical and information-gathering processes and obtains necessary information and data for analysis; analyzes alternatives and makes recommendations; discusses findings with management; prepares reports of study conclusions; recommends implementation plans and assists in implementing policies and procedures; drafts reports, recommended legislative or policy change documents and presentation materials for management. Performs more difficult and responsible assignments in connection with preparation and management of budgets; with limited direction, develops financial plan projections and cash flow analyses; prepares revenue and expenditure analyses, staffing analyses and budget status and monitoring reports; drafts and recommends performance measures; drafts budget request reports and documents; prepares budget adjustment requests; maintains and updates spreadsheets for special funds. Drafts or assists in drafting proposed contracts and agreements and a variety of other supporting documents; monitors contract performance and expenditures; approves contract invoices for payment within guidelines and authority limits; researches and resolves contract problems and disputes; transmits contracts for required City approvals and execution; consults with the City Attorney's office on difficult contractual issues; administers assigned grant funds; compiles and drafts federal and state agency reports and documents; processes draw-downs of grant funds. Conducts more advanced research, analyzes data and drafts policy and procedure documents to address identified needs and issues; drafts communications materials required for implementation. Drafts a wide variety of materials on assigned issues, including reports, procedures, manuals, handouts, newsletters, flyers, communications memoranda, presentations, proposed Code or ordinance changes and other materials; identifies issues, obtains input and feedback, conducts research and analysis; gathers data, maps and other supporting materials and develops recommendations, staff reports to City Council and a variety of other written materials; drafts, publishes and posts public notices. Provides technical assistance to department or division staff by conducting research and drafting documents and materials for review; develops data collection tools, including surveys and questionnaires; analyzes program and operational data and develops recommendations to improve productivity and effectiveness; responds to requests for information from the public. OTHER DUTIES Performs a variety of department-specific program activities to accomplish work goals and objectives, including: using templates and data obtained from multiple sources; coordinating and making arrangements for community meetings, facilitating group discussions and answering a variety of technical and non-technical questions; administering assigned grant programs; recertifying participant eligibility under the City's rental rehabilitation programs; and other activities of equivalent scope and difficulty. May provide work direction and guidance to office support staff. Performs a variety of special projects as assigned. Represents the City or department on committees and in a variety of meetings and other functions applicable to areas of responsibility; may attend and give testimony before the City Council. Qualifications:  Knowledge of: Principles, practices and methods of administrative, organizational, financial and procedural analysis. Principles and practices of public administration, including purchasing, contracting and maintenance of public records. Principles, practices and methods of municipal budget development and management. Basic principles, tools and techniques of project planning and management. Federal, state and local laws, regulations and court decisions applicable to assigned areas of responsibility. Research methods and analysis techniques. Title: Risk Management Data Analyst - Kansas City, MO 64105 - Indeed.com
Description:
About Working at Commerce 
Wouldn’t it be great to build your career at a bank that’s known for helping people with their financial challenges? That’s exactly what you’d be doing when you join the team at Commerce Bank. We’re looking for teammates who are ready to do whatever it takes to help our customers with their everyday financial needs. You’d be helping yourself too, because Commerce has a tradition of recognizing and rewarding team members for their talent, skills and contributions. 
No wonder we’ve been an industry leader for over 150 years and have developed a reputation as a great place to work in the financial services world. If you’d like to be a part of a team and culture that is respected by its peers and in your community, we should talk. We’re always looking for the best and brightest. 
About This Job 
The main purpose of this job is to support Risk Management in developing plans and methods to identify and analyze analytical tools/processes throughout the Bank that may pose various risk and to participate in data intensive initiatives as needed as a representative of the second line of defense. 
Essential Functions 
Work with management to develop a methodology that identifies tools that require independent validation 
Perform initial planning and scoping activities with management for the tool that will be validated 
Develop and execute a validation plan that tests the conceptual soundness, governance structure, and applicability of ongoing monitoring for certain tools used throughout the Bank 
Work with management to craft recommendations for potential risks present within the tool/process 
Design and lead data projects for examinations, data intensive regulatory processes, or other Risk Management data initiatives 
Develop metrics and data analytic tests to effectively evaluate different tools and partner with management to interpret the results 
Assist with data mining projects throughout Risk Management during the exam planning process, and for periodic compliance monitoring assessments, by helping determine available data sources/tools (e.g. OnDemand, Business Objects, ACL, etc.) and techniques to evaluate those sources 
Assist Risk Management monitoring teams with development of analytics to assess large, comprehensive data sets for compliance with various laws and regulations 
Actively seek out best practices and emerging trends both internally and externally to provide recommendations for how to leverage new techniques to manage risks 
Provide technical guidance and expertise to Risk Management department staff, which may, at a minimum, include the following: technical training and mentoring, maintaining current knowledge of technology industry trends and practices and working with other Risk Management staff to evaluate technology impacts in their reviews. 
Perform other duties as assigned 
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Required 
Intermediate knowledge of data analysis, including data extraction tools and technology (preferably Power BI, ACL, Business Objects, AQT, SQL, or similar) and MS Access 
Intermediate understanding of relational database concepts and queries 
Demonstrated ability to summarize and explain technical data/processes 
Demonstrated ability to analyze and document processes, data, procedures, and controls 
Demonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving skills 
Ability to manage interrelated and/or complex issues and to respond to changes regarding project objectives, scope, or deadlines. 
Intermediate presentation, analytical and critical thinking skills 
Strong project management skills 
Motivated and organized self-starter with strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple priorities 
Inquisitive, agile and strong team player with excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills 
Ability to remain adaptable and resilient to all situations with an optimistic outlook and cast a positive shadow that is aligned with our culture and Core Values 
Intermediate level proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, Teams and Outlook 
Education & Experience 
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Mathematics, Accounting, or other Business focused degree or equivalent combination of education and experience required. Master’s degree in a technical field or a business-related such as Data Science, Actuarial Science, Applied Statistics, MBA or MSF preferred. 
4+ years data analysis experience with progressively increasing responsibility and performance or technical internal audit, with proven data analysis experience required 
Advanced hands on experience in Statistical Software (e.g. SAS, R, Python) and big data environments (e.g. cloud (e.g. AWS, Azure, Snowflake), and on-prem (e.g. Hadoop), as well as traditional data warehouse environments (e.g. Teradata) required 
Financial institution experience or familiarity with the industry preferred 
Technical knowledge of financial industry processes preferred 
Location: 922 Walnut St, Kansas City, Missouri 64106 
Time Type: 
Full time
